description: This feels very ripe, perhaps overripe, with its seemingly sweet flavor of black fruit juice and its soft structure. It's appealing and does have some tannins, but it is not for aging.
title: Herdade dos Machados 2009 Morgado da Canita Red (Alentejano)

description: On the dry side, with caramel and strawberry flavors, this is an attractive, bright rosÃ©, as fresh as they come.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Barca 2010 Escolha RosÃ© (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a fruity, fresh, forward wine that has delicious red berry fruitiness and soft tannins. It's bright and smooth, the structure just lightly supporting the fruit. It's ready to drink.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2012 Xairel Red (Tejo)

description: A sweet, soft, clean wine, anonymous almost. Yes, there is freshness, lightness, but all the time the awkward, unbalancing sweetness pulls it down. Drink very chilled.
title: Lagosta 2008 White (Vinho Verde)

description: The very local Tamarez grapes make an appearance in this lemon-colored and flavored wine. It is fruity, soft and bright with acidity. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Brado Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Soft, sweet raspberry fruit-flavored wine. It has a line of acidity while its main character is the light, sweet aftertaste. Screwcap.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Coreto RosÃ© (Lisboa)

description: With a light prickle on the tongue, this is a fresh and fruity wine that has sweetness balanced by a citric edge. It's crisp and ready to drink.
title: Campelo 2014 Casal da Seara White (Vinho Verde)

description: A light spritz gives this wine some of the character of club soda and lime, with a slight brinyness to add interest.
title: Quinta da Aveleda NV Casal Garcia White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a structured wine, probably because of the Touriga Nacional in the blend. That also gives a perfumed edge to this ripe, full wine with its juicy red fruit acidity. It is fruity and will be ready to drink from late 2016.
title: Caves Velhas 2015 Casaleiro Colheita Seleccionada Red (Tejo)

description: This wine comes from the heart of the DÃ£o region. It is firm and dark with tannins and a concentrated texture. Fine acidity cuts through the black-fruit character. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Caves da Montanha 2010 Vinha do Poeta Red (DÃ£o)

description: With hints of pineapple and peach flavors, this is a ripe wine with a refreshing juicy character. It's a food wine thanks to its mineral texture and tangy acidity. It could age a few more months, so hold until 2016.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2014 BridÃ£o Classico Branco FernÃ£o Pires (Tejo)

description: Despite its light touch, this is fruity and full, with its blackberry fruit dominating the warm spice note and acidity. Soft tannins keep the wine together. Drink now. Screwcap.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Coreto Red (Lisboa)

description: Soft, fruity and off dry, this is a typically fresh and light-hearted Vinho Verde. Attractive apple and lemon flavors shine through the lightly prickly texture. Drink immediately.
title: Caves AlianÃ§a 2013 AlianÃ§a White (Vinho Verde)

description: The Borba cooperative is in one of the most productive Alentejo wine regions. With this simple and fruity wine, it has captured warmth as well as ripe tannins. Berry fruits and acidity give it a lift. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2015 Brado Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a structured wine, probably because of the Touriga Nacional in the blend. That also gives a perfumed edge to this ripe, full wine with its juicy red fruit acidity. It is fruity and will be ready to drink from late 2016.
title: Caves Velhas 2015 Casaleiro Colheita Seleccionada Red (Tejo)

description: One of the most familiar Vinho Verde brands in Portugal, this wine is medium sweet with a light prickle on the tongue. It is fruity with creamed apple and citrus along with a touch of honey. The wine is crisp and clean, delicious to drink as an apÃ©ritif.
title: Borges NV GatÃ£o White (Vinho Verde)

description: A light and fruity style of Vinho Verde, its acidity balanced with pear and white-currant notes. Lemon flavors cut through, adding brightness.
title: Vercoope 2011 Terras de Felgueiras White (Vinho Verde)

description: A light, crisp strawberry- and melon-flavored wine, with a fresh mint aroma. There is some sweetness, but the acidity and fresh fruits balance that attractively.
title: Herdade do EsporÃ£o NV Alandra RosÃ© Red (Portugal)

description: Soft and fruity, the fruit light, flavored with plum jelly and dried fruits. The wine is soft, somewhat unfocused, the tannins giving some dryness, but leaving a feeling of old-fashioned over-ripe fruits.
title: Casaleiro 2006 Colheita Seleccionada Tinto Red (Ribatejo)

description: This simple and fruity wine is made to be drunk young. And with its red fruits, light acidity and crisp texture, it succeeds. Drink the wine with summer barbecues.
title: Sanguinhal 2016 Cerejeiras Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: Named after the poppy that blooms in May in the Alentejo, this wine is juicy and fruity, with a light touch of tannins. It is all red berries, with an easygoing juicy character, Drink now.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2015 Flor de Maio Mayflower Red (Alentejano)

description: This broad, fruity wine brings out ripe berry flavors in spades. It has generous fruit, soft tannins and a smooth, open texture. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2015 Convento da Vila Red (Alentejano)

description: Made to be drunk young, this is a fruity red berry flavored wine. It has a bright crisp edge to its fruit as well as light tannins and acidity. It is quite ready to drink.
title: Cartuxa 2014 Vinea Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Somewhat lean, this has a tart, grapefruit character that sits awkwardly with the otherwise fresh, green fruit character. Hard-edged.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2006 Terra de Lobos White (Ribatejano)

description: For a wine at this price, this is an impressive performance. It is rich, finely structured, the juicy blackberry flavors filling the mouth. It may lack complexity, but the spice, tobacco and berry flavors are enjoyably drinkable.
title: DÃ£o Sul 2006 Cortello Touriga Nacional (Estremadura)

description: Light and simple, with green apple and citrus aromas and flavors. Use it to wash down steamed shellfish at the beach.
title: Quinta da Romeira 2001 Estate Bottled Arinto (Bucelas)

description: From the SetÃºbal Peninsula, this 100% Periquita is bright and cherry-laden. Soft and velvety in texture, yet with sufficient acidity to accompany food. Be forewarned: There are some nasty bottle stinks that warrant decanting prior to serving. Best Buy.
title: Quinta da Romeira 1999 TradicÃ£o Red (Palmela)

description: Orange pink in color, this is a fat wine. It has acidity and red berry fruits although they are surrounded by a plump texture. It is ready to drink.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2014 BridÃ£o Classico RosÃ© (Tejo)

description: This light wine is gently fruity and with the minimum of tannins. It is juicy with acidity and red-berry fruits. The partial wood aging has smoothed out the ripe blend of most of the major grapes of the Douro. Drink now.
title: Borges 2015 Lello Red (Douro)

description: A soft wine that has ripe red fruits and gentle tannins. Ready to drink immediately, it is fruity with spice, black cherry and acidity all in balance.
title: Enoport 2014 Penina Red (Tejo)

description: A soft, open wine with only light tannins. The fruit is just as light, with strawberry and some spice. For drinking now.
title: Finisterra 2010 Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a gravel- and mineral-textured wine that has a very structured feel, with red berry flavors and firm tannins. Still young, it is a wine that should soften, so wait until 2016.
title: Herdade dos Machados 2010 Morgado da Canita Red (Alentejano)

description: On paper, this is an interesting blend of Aragonez and Cabernet	 however, this fruity wine is much simpler than that. There is a spice element that adds some complexity, but the palate concentrates mainly on red fruits and layered acidity. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2004 Adegaborba.pt Red (Alentejo)

description: This is a soft, fruity blend of Roupeiro, Rabo de Ovelha and FernÃ£o Pires. It is ripe, full of apple and crisp green fruits, shot through with acidity. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Convento da Vila White (Alentejano)

description: This blend of Touriga Nacional and Cabernet Sauvignon is soft and ripe, with a good sense of structure and fruitiness. Rounded and with acidity as a counterweight, the wine is ready. Drink now.
title: Fiuza 2016 Babu Red (Tejo)

description: The wine has structured fruit along with red berry flavors. It is otherwise soft, easy, and ready to drink with a crisp finish.
title: Quinta Monteiro de Matos 2014 Terras de Paul Red (Tejo)

description: A lively, juicy wine, with pepper, cinnamon and green herbs. The fruits are red berry and rhubarb, giving a wine that is both fruity and edged with rawness. The acidity is prominent, layering over the dry tannin core.
title: DÃ£o Sul 2006 Cortello Red (Estremadura)

description: Grown on the shelf above the Tagus (Tejo) River, the wine is soft and ripe. It does have tannins that are well integrated into the spicy red fruits and dry core. The wine is rich, and the alcohol is noticeable in the pepper aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2013 Coudel Mor ClÃ¡ssico Red (Tejo)

description: Earthy aromas lead to a wine that has some greenness, with dry tannins and bell pepper flavors. It is not likely to age.
title: Quinta de SÃ£o SebastiÃ£o 2011 Mina Velha Red (Lisboa)

description: Ripe red fruits dominate this warm, round wine. The light touch of acidity makes the fruit seem forward and bright, yet the core remains rich and smooth. Its soft tannins make this ready to drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2009 Portada Winemaker's Selection Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a soft fruity wine. It has attractive red-fruit flavors, very ripe fruit and light acidity at the end. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2015 Xairel Red (Tejo)

description: Light mouthfeel to this cinnamon- and herb-flavored wine. The fruit shows through with a black jelly character. Soft, rounded, ready for drinking.
title: Finisterra 2009 Red (Alentejano)

description: A serious, rich wine, this is full of ripe berry fruits and structured tannins that highlight a dry core. It's a complex wine with a light touch of acidity, a pinch of pepper and a firm aftertaste that suggests medium-term aging. Drink between 2014â€“2020.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Portada Winemaker's Selection Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a soft wine, its acidity melded into the ripe berry fruit flavors. The texture is soft with just a bite of tannin at the end. With its open fruitiness, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Fiuza 2015 Babu Red (Tejo)

description: Richly tannic, this concentrated wine has great structure and intense fruitiness and acidity. Generous and full bodied, it retains a dry core that gives shape to the ripe red berry fruits. Hints of wood aging still show, and the wine needs to develop further. Drink from 2017.
title: Herdade dos Machados 2012 Toutalga Red (Alentejano)

description: Soft, light, flavored with raspberry and red fruit. There is a gentle tannin character to this open, fresh wine.
title: Caves Bonifacio 2009 BonifÃ¡cio Red (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: A soft, open wine with only light tannins. The fruit is just as light, with strawberry and some spice. For drinking now.
title: Finisterra 2010 Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a bright, fruity, off-dry wine that is crisp and clean. It has a fine light touch of acidity and white fruits. Aromatic and attractively perfumed, it is ready now.
title: Global Wines 2015 Xadrez White (Vinho Verde)

description: A soft, smooth and juicy wine, with attractive red fruit aromas and a warm, fragrant texture. The wine has spice, hints of herbs and a strong layer of acidity. Drink now and until 2018.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2010 BridÃ£o ClÃ¡ssico Red (Tejo)

description: Wonderful aromas of orange blossoms and cream stay orangey right through to the long finish. Clove and cinnamon nuances provide complexity. Light on the palate and very refreshing	 also very differentâ€”a unique style of wine. Best Buy.
title: JoÃ£o Pires 1998 Muscat (Terras do Sado)

description: Green apple notes give way to grapefruit and melon, but tart lime and green apple flavors power this wine.
title: Quinta da Aveleda 2001 Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: A lively crisp wine, flavored with soft pear, green plum oregano, streaked through with vibrant acidity. It's light, fresh, ready to drink.
title: Caves Primavera 2009 Primavera Branco White (Bairrada)

description: This is a young and fruity wine that has the rare Vital grape in the blend. It is crisp although with an attractive creaminess that gives the wine a smooth texture. The acidity and red apples are balanced and make the wine ready to drink.
title: Sanguinhal 2016 Cerejeiras Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Big, ripe and spicy, with tobacco and herbal flavors alongside the black currant intensity and powerful acidity. It is rich while the austere tannins of the Baga grape are still young. Keep for 2â€“3 years.
title: Caves Primavera 2008 Primavera Reserva Red (Bairrada)

description: The wine is soft, fruity and with its light tannins and fresh red berry fruits, it is ready to drink. The aftertaste has a fresh, bright finish. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2014 Xairel Red (Tejo)

description: This has soft, ripe fruit, with notes of lime and orange zest fitting easily with the ripe peach and melon flavors. This is warm, rounded and ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Portada Winemaker's Selection White (Lisboa)

description: A ripe, smooth and richly fruity wine that has a well-integrated structure. Flavors of generous blackberry and red plums are lightly touched by acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2013 BridÃ£o ClÃ¡ssico Red (Tejo)

description: This firm wine shows fresh, compacted fruits and vivid acidity. Its tight tannins suggest aging potential, while the black plum juice and blueberry fruit flavors make it attractive now. Layers of smoky toast show through on the finish.
title: DÃ£o Sul 2006 BerÃ§o do Infante Red (Estremadura)

description: This is a shade off-dry, with ample crispness, a bright, prickly lightness and delicate texture. It's a great apÃ©ritif style, with its soft edge and easygoing freshness, that's ready to drink now.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2012 Vilacetinho White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a gravel- and mineral-textured wine that has a very structured feel, with red berry flavors and firm tannins. Still young, it is a wine that should soften, so wait until 2016.
title: Herdade dos Machados 2010 Morgado da Canita Red (Alentejano)

description: A rich and fruity blend with swathes of ripe red berry fruits that are smoothed out by the soft wood and tannin flavors. Acidity freshens the ripeness. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2012 Quinta dos Bons Ventos Red (Lisboa)

description: This appealing wine is rich, smooth and juicy, with a spice and blackberry character. Still young, it has the chance of aging another year, but remains great to drink now.
title: Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel 2012 Vinho AtlÃ¢ntico Red (Alentejano)

description: This sweet sparkling rosÃ© is clean and crisp. It has attractive strawberry fruit, soft texture and a light mousse. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo NV Plexus RosÃ© CastelÃ£o (Tejo)

description: Very young, the wine gives out pure fruitiness, very fresh and lively. Good juiciness offers a riper view of this already very drinkable wine. Drink from 2015.
title: Fiuza 2013 Native Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: Red berry fruits great freshness and brightness to this fruity wine that has tight acidity as a balance. The wine is crisp, young and layers light tannins at the end.
title: Fiuza 2013 3 Castas Red (Tejo)

description: The wood aging of this wine has given a lightly oxidized character. It is rich and creamy with toasty acidity as well as yellow fruits. Drink now.
title: C. da Silva 2011 Dalva Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: Named for the Servite convent in the town of Borba, this fresh, crisp and tangy wine is citric, with almond and apple overtones. It's young, fruity and made for immediate consumption.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2015 Convento da Vila Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This wine balances swathes of ripe berry fruit with hints of tannin. It's fruity, full bodied and delicious to drink now. A great barbecue wine.
title: Global Wines 2014 Cal Monte da Cal Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a dry sparkling wine with tannins, spice and berry fruit, giving it a deep color. Not an apÃ©ritif wine, it's perfect for cutting through rich, oily foods. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo NV Plexus Tinto Alicante Bouschet (Tejo)

description: A medium-dry Vinho Verde, this is light and fresh without being quite crisp enough. Well chilled, though, it makes a lively and fresh apÃ©ritif.
title: Caves AlianÃ§a 2009 AlianÃ§a White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a featherlight red, full of berries and bright acidity, but with a texture that just coats the palate. This is one of those rare reds that works as an apÃ©ritif, fresh, clean and fruity. Screwcap.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2007 Coreto Tinto Red (Estremadura)

description: This is an attractive, lemon and lime-flavored wine. Riper yellow fruits also show through the crisp acidity and the lightly mineral texture. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2015 BridÃ£o Classico Branco White (Tejo)

description: Heading nicely in the crisp and aromatic direction, this is a light and bright wine. It has a citrus flavor that is balanced by richer pear and plum fruits. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Bote Chardonnay-FernÃ£o Pires-Vital White (Lisboa)

description: In a medium sweet style, the wine has a light prickle and fine citrus acidity to balance the soft freshness. It is a refreshing wine, totally drinkable immediately.
title: Messias 2015 Santola White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is an open and ready-to-drink wine that has soft tannins and juicy blackberry fruit. With 50% Aragonez in the blend, it is has a smooth character that brings out plenty fruit and not too much structure. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 CuvÃ©e B Red (Alentejo)

description: Crisp, bright and fruity, this is a refreshing and ripe wine. With attractive citrus acidity and a bright aftertaste, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Adega de Borba Branco White (Alentejo)

description: Young and fruity, this is a bright and wine for immediate drinking. It has hints of tannins, plenty of red fruits and no wood.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Brado Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a rich, full wine that has red fruits and soft tannins. With balanced acidity, only a hint of tannins, it is ready to drink.
title: Parras Vinhos 2014 Montaria Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: A blend of Moscatel and Arinto, this is light and thin with only the vaguest hint of citrus fruit acidity. It should be drunk now.
title: Parras Vinhos 2014 Castelo do Sulco Colheita White (Lisboa)

description: Aromas of strawberry sherbet are followed by sweet candy-shop flavors on the palate. Chill it thoroughly before drinking. Screwcap.
title: Viniverde 2011 Estreia RosÃ© (Vinho Verde)

description: Light red wine, with a stalky black currant character. It is very fruity, showing herbs and soft tannins. Almost an apÃ©ritif red, certainly one for lightly flavored dishes.
title: Aveleda 2010 Casal Garcia Tinto Red (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: This is an easy, fruity wine. Soft and light in character, it has attractive red fruits and acidity. Drink this wine now.
title: Jose Maria Vieira 2014 Borges Quinta da Soalheira Red (Douro)

description: There is a strong barnyard aroma here, although the palate is cleaner and more modern. With rich tannins and a dark plum character, it's ripe and structured. There is a strong mineral element, giving the wine power and density. Drink from 2016.
title: Borges 2011 Lello Red (Douro)

description: Soft and smooth, this is a rounded, apple and pear flavored wine. With a streak of lemon acidity at the end, it has just the right amount of freshness. Drink now.
title: Caves AlianÃ§a 2013 Alabastro Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Expanding the Casal Garcia range into the Douro, this light and fruity wine is an easy drink. It has some toast to balance the soft tannins and black currant fruits.
title: Aveleda 2014 Casal Garcia Tinto Red (Douro)

description: A smoky wine with black currant flavors that bring together spice and fruitiness. The wine has a light touch, licorice and stalky tannins ending with attractive juiciness. It is ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Bigode Red (Lisboa)

description: The familiar rosÃ© Lancers is all about crushed strawberries with a touch of sugar. There is a light structure, but the attractive light pink color and the fresh fruit all work together. Screwcap.
title: JosÃ© Maria da Fonseca NV Lancers RosÃ© Red (Table wine)

description: A sweet Vinho Verde, it is light, fruity and perfect for the summer. With crisp acidity, a lively, frothy texture and a clean apple aftertaste, it can be drunk now.
title: Quinta das Arcas 2013 Arca Nova White (Vinho Verde)

description: Here's a ripe, earthy wine that is softly tannic and richly fruity. It has a fine balance between the warm blackberry fruits and solid structure. Made to be drunk young, it is already delicious. Screwcap.
title: Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel 2012 Ciconia Red (Alentejano)

description: With soft tannins and ripe berry fruits, this is an immediately accessible wine. It has a fresh character, with a smoky edge and a ripe, smooth aftertaste. This would make a great barbecue wine for the summer.
title: Aveleda 2014 Charamba Red (Douro)

description: Going for structure as much as fruit, this is a cool wine with black currant flavors giving high acidity. It feels light, fresh, although there are tannins and spice to give some final weight.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2007 BridÃ£o Classico Red (Ribatejo)

description: This is called sweet and that's what it is. The candied sweetness is balanced by some acidity to keep the wine crisp and fruity. It will be fine as an apÃ©ritif. Drink now.
title: Aveleda NV Casal Garcia Sweet White (Vinho Verde)

description: In a reference to the storks who build nests in the chimneys of the Eiffel-designed DFJ winery, Storks Landing shows bright acidity, layers of citrus plus a touch of more exotic pineapple. A blend of FernÃ£o Pires and Chardonnay, it's fresh and light in the mouth, mineral and crisp at the end.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Storks Landing White (Lisboa)

description: Lightly sweet, this is a soft, gently fruity wine with a prickle on the tongue and fruit-drop acidity. Screwcap.
title: Aveleda 2012 Casal Garcia RosÃ© (Vinho Verde)

description: Named after the crickets, or cicadas, whose song fills the summer nights, this soft and lightly perfumed wine has citrus and apple fruit flavors, a tangy, flinty texture and plenty of acidity. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Cigarra Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This is a spicy, rich, smooth wine, immediately attractive and ready to drink. It has ripe tannins, black fruits in abundance and delicious acidity to give a lift. It's a classic barbecue wine and great for summer parties.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2009 Quinta das Setencostas Red (Alenquer)

description: An attractively fruity wine that's easy to drink and fresh. Lemon and apples give a crisp edge, followed by a zesty, fragrant character. Drink this light wine now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Portada Winemaker's Selection Branco White (Lisboa)

description: A lean, edgy wine, which shows bramble fruits, red berries and tense tannins. There's fine structure and, given a few months, the acidity will turn this into a good food wine.
title: Quinta do Gradil 2005 Cortello Syrah (Estremadura)

description: Although based in Bairrada, further south, Messias does have considerable interests in the Douro. This wine, with its firm, mineral structure, brings out the tannins and concentration of the Douro. That goes with the black fruit flavors that are dark and dry. Drink this wine now.
title: Messias 2013 Messias Selection Red (Douro)

description: Soft, with a light texture and approachable acidity, this is a bright wine that has plenty of apricot and pear flavors. The wine is fresh and ready to drink, with an orange zest finish.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Portada Winemaker's Selection Branco White (Lisboa)

description: One of the classic brands of Vinho Verde, this is still one of the best. It has great fruitiness and crisp acidity, only just off dry. Lemon sherbet and fresh orange zest give a delicious lift to the finish.
title: Aveleda 2014 Casal Garcia Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: Apples and strawberry combine easily in this soft, fresh rosÃ©. It's fruity, light, with a slight prickle in the mouth.
title: Aveleda 2010 Casal Garcia RosÃ© (Vinho Verde)

description: Named after a Portuguese dance, this fresh, fruitcake and blackberry-flavored wine is easily ready to drink, a wine that powers through with its sweet, juicy fruit and final acidity.
title: Aveleda 2005 Charamba Red (Douro)

description: A blend of Syrah, CastelÃ£o and Aragonez, this is a ripe, full wine that has fine soft fruit. The tannins give just the right edge to the red fruits and final acidity. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Bote Red (Lisboa)

description: This is an easy-drinking, smooth and generous wine. With its light tannins and red berry fruit, it is ready to drink young. The aftertaste adds some acidity to give a lift.
title: Lobo 2014 Lobocellar Red (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: Ripe and fruity, with some sweetness that does not seem to be fully integrated. So the green plum flavors are attractive, as is the acidity, but there is an intrusive sugary edge.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Segada Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This is pure fruitiness, a wine packed with spice, berry fruits and soft, open tannins. It is a great barbecue-style wine, ripe, with good acidity and a bright, crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2010 Quinta EssÃªncia Red (Tejo)

description: This is a satisfying, ripe and rich wine. It has big layers of red fruits, attractive spice from partial wood aging and fresh acidity. Still young, it will be even better from early 2016.
title: Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel 2014 Ciconia Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Bright pink in color, this 100% Touriga Nacional rosÃ© is ripe with caramel and red berry flavors. It misses out on acidity, leaving the wine flat at the end.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2014 RosÃ© (Tejo)

description: Fresh, crisp and fruity, this is a citrus and apple-flavored medium-dry wine. With plenty of acidity, bright and packed with easy fruitiness, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Aveleda NV Casal Garcia Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: This soft and fruity wine is crisp, fragrant and fresh. It has light acidity that balances with the forward apple flavor, as well as a dry lime edginess and nervy texture. Drink now. Screwcap.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Paxis Branco Arinto (Lisboa)

description: This wine is young but ripe, with spice and blackberry fruits. It has a core of mineral tannins that are a reminder of the hard schist rocks of the Douro. With this dry structure, it needs to be aged, so drink from 2017.
title: Aveleda 2013 Charamba Red (Douro)

description: While this wine is dry, its warm strawberry fruit rounds out its character with a softness. Lemon sherbet acidity gives another touch of almost sweetness. Drink now.
title: Roquevale 2015 Ossa RosÃ© (Alentejano)

description: Named after the range of mountains close to the Roquevale winery, this wine is ripe, soft and offers an attractive series of red fruits and rich tannins. Drink this wine now.
title: Roquevale 2015 Ossa Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a fruity wine with a off-dry character that is balanced by lime and lemon fruitiness. The acidity and the tangy herbal character give the wine an attractive bite. Drink now.
title: Caves Velhas NV Lagosta White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is classic, off-dry Vinho Verde. With its light prickle, crisp fruit that has a tangy lime and lemon character that comes through the candy flavor, it is a refreshing, light wine.
title: Aveleda 2015 Casal Garcia White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a young, fruity wine with fine acidity and plenty of red-fruit flavors. Light spice, generous tannins and a hint of wood all contribute to a balanced wine that is ready to drink.
title: Casa Agricola Santos Jorge 2014 Toutalga Red (Alentejano)

description: This blend of Touriga Nacional with Merlot is perfumed and light. It has a salmon pink color, layers of citrus as well as red-currant fruit and a soft texture. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2015 Vinho Selection RosÃ© (Tejo)

description: A great value wine, its firm tannins surrounded by the freshest berry fruits and acidity. For drinking young, with its attractive ripe, open flavors.
title: DÃ£o Sul 2009 Cabriz Colheita Seleccionada Red (DÃ£o)

description: Warm and ripe, this is a full-bodied rosÃ© that has the weight and some of the tannins of a red wine. With its vivid pink color and sweet strawberry fruits, it's fruity and ready to drink.
title: Herdade do EsporÃ£o 2013 Alandra RosÃ© (Alentejano)

description: Perfumed, with a soft, smooth texture, this has flavors of tropical fruit, peach and a hint of lemongrass that make for a rich wine.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Monte Alentejano Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Smooth and oily in texture, this is round and full of pear juice flavor. There is just a touch of green legume, adding piquancy to this ripe wine. Screwcap.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Paxis Branco Arinto (Lisboa)

description: This caramel-flavored wine has a light red fruit character. It is off dry and needs to be severely chilled.
title: Calamares 2014 RosÃ© (Vinho Verde)

description: One of the most popular Vinho Verdes, this is in a light, medium-sweet style. Very fresh and crisp, with some attractive citrus acidity, and ready to drink now. Screwcap.
title: Aveleda 2012 Casal Garcia Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: All white fruit, lemon and grapefruit, soft and with a hint of softness. It's a fine apÃ©ritif wine, right up front and friendly. Screwcap.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2009 What's for Dinner? Branco White (Tejo)

description: Named after the pheasant (FaisÃ£o), the wine is crisp enough to be refreshing. It is medium sweet and lightly textured with orange zest. Drink now.
title: Enoport 2016 FaisÃ£o White (Vinho Verde)

description: Although the wine is closed at the moment, showing only its tannic side, it has a good promise from the weight of fruit that's at the back. Ripe and juicy, it should age well. Drink from 2017.
title: Herdade do PerdigÃ£o 2009 Terras de Monforte Red (Alentejo)

description: Solid and chunky, a wine that fills the mouth with its attractive red fruits, structured tannins and a general juicy feel. A fine barbecue wine.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2009 Bigode Red (Lisboa)

description: While the wine has plenty of juicy fruit, it also has a heavy hand with wood that gives a bitter, spice and pepper character. Densely textured, it's tough for the moment although it will round out. Drink from 2017.
title: Herdade dos Coelheiros 2012 Ciranda Red (Alentejano)

description: The Merlot certainly does its job here of smoothing out the Baga tannins. Together, they yield a soft, red fruit-flavored wine with minimal tannins and juicy acidity, adding a burst of flavor on the finish. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2014 Encontro Q do E Merlot-Baga Red (Bairrada)

description: Ripe, balanced and attractive, this red boasts fine tannins that lend subtle structure to the black plum fruit. Dense with fruitiness and acidity, it's rich enough to savor with meat. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Beira 2014 FaisÃ£o Red (DÃ£o)

description: There is some of the mineral character that is typical of the Douro in this black-fruit-laden wine. It has acidity and tannins and a stalky, juicy character that keeps it crisp. The wine is ready to drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Bote Red (Douro)

description: An attractive, simple wine, with the freshest of citrus and melon flavors, pushed through by crisp acidity and a final hint of almonds. Screwcap.
title: Monte Largo 2008 White (Estremadura)

description: The principal grapes of DÃ£o are all in this ripe, fruity blend: Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Alfrocheiro are rich, full of blackberry fruits and layered with some firm tannins. The wine is ripe while still retaining the structure from the granite soil. Drink now.
title: Messias 2013 Messias Selection Red (DÃ£o)

description: This is an attractive, aromatic blend of Arinto and AntÃ£o Vaz. It has a softly citrus character with riper, fuller peach and pineapple fruit. It's full, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Parras Vinhos 2014 Montaria Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Along with the typical warmth of an Alentejo wine comes an earthy character that is less attractive. There are juicy rhubarb and redcurrant tones, but they are engulfed by its rustic character. Drink now.
title: Caves AlianÃ§a 2013 Alabastro Red (Alentejano)

description: A dry, but rich, vanilla-and-cream-flavored rosÃ© that shows soft tannins, ripe strawberry and full red plum flavors. The aftertaste is soft, with little acidity.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2007 Vinzelo RosÃ© Red (Douro)

description: Having spent time in oak, this is a ripe and soft wine that is generously proportioned. The opulent texture is cut by bright acidity and juicy red berry flavors. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2012 Passion of Portugal Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: There is no compromise in the pinkness of the color of this wine. It is fruity with plenty of acidity and with a touch of caramel as well as some light tannins. Drink this blend of Syrah and Aragonez now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 CuvÃ©e B RosÃ© (Alentejo)

description: This wine is on the sweet side of crisp, with ripe strawberry and plenty of acidity. It is a wine to chill, with its bright aftertaste and slight prickle on the tongue. Drink now.
title: Enoport 2016 Mapreco RosÃ© (Vinho Verde)

description: Cigarra, a cricket, is common in the Lisboa vineyards. The wine has a good mix of citrus and yellow fruit flavors, crisp and ripe at the same time. An attractive chalky, steely feel comes through in the acidity and the tight, nervy aftertaste.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Cigarra White (Lisboa)

description: This medium-sweet, fruity wine is both light and crisp. Attractive acidity contrasts with the sparkling texture and the sugared citrus. It's very ready to drink.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2013 Vilacentinho White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a bone-dry, piercingly fresh wine. It has tense acidity and a mineral texture that would make it delicious as an accompaniment to seafood. The wine is crisp, refreshing and bright.
title: DÃ£o Sul 2011 Quinta de Lourosa White (Vinho Verde)

description: The wine is ripe, full with red currant and raspberry fruits and some attractive acidity. A blend of Touriga Nacional and Merlot, it is soft, fruity and needs drinking fast before it fades.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2014 Selection RosÃ© (Tejo)

description: This crisp, lightly sparkling, off-dry Vinho Verde offers attractive acidity and bright citrus flavors, with hints of apple and green plum. Light and fresh, it's ready to drink now.
title: JosÃ© Maria da Fonseca 2013 Twin Vines White (Vinho Verde)

description: Just off dry, this is a bright and crisp wine that bounces round the palate. It is summer apÃ©ritif time with this vivid, pink grapefruit-flavored wine.
title: Aveleda 2009 Fonte White (Vinho Verde)

description: A dark colored red that is firmly tannic as well as ripe and fruity. The wine is spicy and earthy, redolent of dried fruits, like figs and red berries. With its solid texture, it can age	 drink from 2015.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Pedras do Monte Red (Lisboa)

description: Young and fresh with an attractive prickle on the tongue, this medium-sweet Vinho Verde is well cut with acidity. Accented with apple and citrus, it is bright and ready to drink. Screwcap.
title: FVine 2013 White (Vinho Verde)

description: Green plums and ripe apples bring out the best in Arinto's range of flavors. This is a soft wine, with light acidity that's well integrated into the rich fruitiness. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Paxis Branco Arinto (Lisboa)

description: There is some of the freshness of the ocean climate in this cool, red fruited wine. It has a fine structure, juicy red berry flavors and fresh, lifted acidity. It's a wine to drink now for its fruitiness and fresh character.
title: Parras Vinhos 2014 Castelo do Sulco Colheita Red (Lisboa)

description: An easy, fresh, slightly sparkling wine with pleasant, soft, lightly sweet fruit flavors. It is clean, a great apÃ©ritif for a summer's day.
title: Caves AlianÃ§a 2006 White (Vinho Verde)

description: While the wine does have tannins, it's dominant characters are juicy red fruits, sweet tannins and a fresh, lightly mineral texture. It's a wine that's ready to drink, fruity while firm at the end.
title: Borges 2012 Meia Encosta Red (DÃ£o)

description: Aging on the lees for a few months has given this fresh white wine also richness. It has lemon juice and crisp apple flavors and a bright mineral acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel 2014 Ciconia Branco White (Alentejano)

description: A fresh, slightly sweet rosÃ©, that keeps crispness through its bright, breezy strawberry flavors. The wine is soft, crisp, clean, a summer rosÃ©.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 Portada RosÃ© Red (Estremadura)

description: Bright, fruity and fresh, this familiar Vinho Verde brand does exactly what it's meant to do: provide a refreshing, light glass of wine. Apples and citrus easily carry the lightly sweet flavors and blend with an orange zest texture. Drink immediately.
title: Aveleda 2013 Casal Garcia Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: Bigode, meaning the mustache, is fruity, fresh and light in texture. The juicy character needs another few months to integrate fully with the berry fruits. Spice adds interest. It will be better by the end of 2014.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Bigode Red (Lisboa)

description: Sweet red berry fruits come through the firmer tannins. An unusual blend of Pinot Noir and Touriga Nacional, it has plenty of acidity, delicious juiciness and touches of wood at the end. It's not for long-term aging, ready to drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2011 Terra de Touros Red (Tejo)

description: This sparkling wine from Touriga Nacional grapes is dry, not just with acidity but also its firm tannic structure. An acquired taste, perhaps, but great with fresh sardines or other oily fish. Drink now.
designation: Encontro Q do E Tinto Bruto Classico
title: Global Wines NV Encontro Q do E Tinto Bruto Classico Sparkling (Bairrada)

description: This is a classic style of Bairrada sparkling wineâ€”a blend of Bical, Maria Gomes and Arinto. Plenty of crisp acidity and soft white fruit flavors balance its yeasty character. Drink now.
designation: Encontro Q do E Blanco Bruto Classico
title: Global Wines NV Encontro Q do E Blanco Bruto Classico Sparkling (Bairrada)

description: Fruity and off-dry, this has light touches of sweet strawberry and vanilla to go with the orange zest acidity. Screwcap.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Pink Elephant RosÃ© (Lisboa)

description: This is a ripe, generous wine that speaks of the sun and warmth of the Alentejo. It has rich black fruits, dark plums and berries, with spice and vanilla flavors. The acidity, with its final lift, gives the wine a fresh aftertaste.
title: Herdade dos Machados 2013 Toutalga Red (Alentejano)

description: Fresh red berry fruit and caramel aromas create a wine that is all sweet strawberry, highly aromatic and just touched by acidity. There's a definite softness, almost sweetness in the aftertaste.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2007 Monte Alentejano RosÃ© Red (Alentejano)

description: Bright and fruity, this has a ripe applesauce flavor that's cut with citrusy acidity. It's a great apÃ©ritif, with a soft texture and refreshing finish.
title: Herdade do EsporÃ£o 2011 Alandra Branco White (Alentejano)

description: A tight, freshly acid wine, with stalkiness but also good juicy fruit. There is a green pepper element, leaving a wine that is light, simple.
title: Caves AlianÃ§a 2006 Reserva Red (Bairrada)

description: It takes a while for the taste of this light, fresh white to come through. Then, it is soft, creamy textured, flavored with pear juice and lemon zest. It is simple, easy, cleanly made.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 Portada Branco White (Estremadura)

description: A soft wine, creamy and ripe. The flavors are open, with white fruits, green plums, a baked apple character. There is acidity, but with the gentle, ripe fruit, this blends in easily. For early drinking.
title: Borges 2008 Meia Encosta White (DÃ£o)

description: This is an attractive, ready-to-drink wine, a blend of Arinto and FernÃ£o Pires. Bright and fruity with plenty of citrus freshness, it is lightly crisp and fresh at the end.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2014 White (Tejo)

description: Soft and warm, this is an apricot and pear-flavored wine. It has a soft texture, with a ripe feel that is just lifted by acidity. The aftertaste, with a more citrus character, adds the freshness.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2015 Roupeiro-AntÃ£o Vaz White (Alentejo)

description: This blend of the white Trincadeira das Pratas and Arinto is soft and perfumed. It has some ripe acidity and an open texture. The aftertaste brings in some attractive melon flavor. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2015 Selection White (Tejo)

description: A rose pink colored wine that is dry and with ripe fruit. Its acidity contrasts with the warm red-berry fruit and the edge of tannin. There is a peppery, crisp aftertaste.
title: Quinta de PaÃ§os 2015 Casa de PaÃ§os RosÃ© (Vinho Verde)

description: A blend of FernÃ£o Pires and Arinto, this is totally crisp and refreshingly fruity. It is perfumed, smooth while also cut with acidity. The acidity comes from both citrus and pineapple flavors. Drink now.
title: Falua 2015 Conde Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Branco White (Tejo)

description: This is a crisp, clean and refreshing wine. There is just the lightest sense of tannin giving the wine a zingy edge. Other than that, it is red-berry fruits all the way. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Bigode RosÃ© (Lisboa)

description: This is a soft wine with its creamy fruits assimilated into the tangy texture. There is plenty of acidity to give this wine its cool character as well as its citrus and green-apple flavors. Drink now.
title: Quinta das Arcas 2016 Arca Nova Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: Lisboa, with its cool climate, lends itself to crisp rosÃ©s like this. This lively fruity wine is touched by hints of vanilla and layers of red-fruit flavors. It is light and ready to drink.
title: Adega MÃ£e 2015 Pinta Negra RosÃ© (Lisboa)

description: This wine is ripe with red fruits and soft tannins. It is smooth, packed with red-berry flavors lifted by the acidity. Made to be drunk young, it is ready now.
title: Adega MÃ£e 2015 Pinta Negra Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a lively, off-dry wine with intense acidity to accompany its crisp apple and citrus flavors. Very fruity, it's ready to drink now. Screwcap.
title: Quinta do Portal 2011 Trevo White (Vinho Verde)

description: Light and bright, this has a crisp prickle on the tongue, along with canned grapefruit and tight apple-skin flavors. It is almost dry, which gives the wine a mineral texture that adds a bite. Drink now.
title: Quintas de MelgaÃ§o 2013 QM Blue White (Vinho Verde)

description: Named after a local volcanic rock formation, this wine is a delicious blend of Aragonez (aka Tempranillo) and Touriga Nacional. It is rich and smooth with black fruits, soft tannins and an aftertaste that is lively with acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Manzwine 2014 Penedo do Lexim Red (Lisboa)

description: The wine is fruity, although with a yeasty character that leaves a bready taste. It has acidity, ripe yellow fruits and the fruitiness may come to dominate although that is not certain.
title: Cooperativa Reguengos de Monsaraz 2014 Monsaraz Branco White (Alentejo)

description: This ripe blend holds 80% Baga, with the rest Merlot. The Merlot softens the firmer tannins of the Baga, giving the wine its red-fruit character with a juicy aftertaste. Drink the wine now.
title: Messias 2014 Selection Red (Bairrada)

description: A blend of six varieties, this is a perfumed wine, with flavors of wood aging to go with the yellow fruits. and a soft, rounded mouthfeel.
title: Quinta das Maias 2010 Branco White (DÃ£o)

description: Fresh, juicy wine, with soft tannins and taut red cherry fruit. The tannins provide a discreet backbone. Age for 2â€“3 years.
title: BacalhÃ´a Wines of Portugal 2010 JP AzeitÃ£o Tinto Red (Setubal)

description: While the familiar white version of this wine is from Vinho Verde, the producers have gone a little further south to the Douro for the red. That gives a soft wine but with weight and attractive layers of red-berry fruits and a touch of warmth. Drink now.
title: Aveleda 2015 Casal Garcia Red (Douro)

description: This soft ripe wine is smooth and velvet textured. Its black fruits and ripe tannins are well integrated with the acidity and juicy aftertaste. The blend of Aragonez, Trincadeira, Petit Verdot and Alicante Bouschet is eclectic but certainly works. Ready to drink now.
title: Global Wines 2016 Monte da Cal Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: A soft apple-tinged wine, with bright acidity that cuts right through. The wine is rounded, with just enough crispness. Ready to drink.
title: Falua 2010 Conde de Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada White (Tejo)

description: Produced from the vines that surround the family house at Quinta da Aveleda, this is an exemplary Vinho Verde. Dry and crisp, with richness as well as freshness, it is a bright, tight and lightly mineral wine to drink now.
title: Aveleda 2014 Quinta da Aveleda Estate Bottled White (Vinho Verde)

description: A subtle pink color, worthy of Provence, marks this wine with its attractive acidity and soft texture. There is only a hint of tannin to remind that this raspberry-flavored wine comes from Syrah. It is crisp and ready to drink.
title: BacalhÃ´a Wines of Portugal 2016 JP AzeitÃ£o Syrah RosÃ© (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: Coming from the cool climate of the Lisbon vineyards, this is a fresh and fruity wine. Some Touriga Nacional perfumes emerge from the soft tannins and final acidity. It's an attractive wine to drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Point West Touriga Nacional (Lisboa)

description: Always attractive, this light and fruity wine is crisp with lemon acidity and tart green apples. There is an attractive tangy character that gives the wine extra freshness. Drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2014 Vila Santa Loios Branco White (Alentejano)

description: The merest prickle on the tongue adds to the freshness of this crisp, clean, lightly sweet wine. Very fruity, it conveys apples and citrus, with a soft, fragrant aftertaste.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Salsus White (Vinho Verde)

description: With a strongly juicy character and high acidity, this wine brings out the tannic character of the two grapes in the blend rather than the fruit. There's a spicy character and red fruit acidity at the end.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Casa do Lago Tinto Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)

description: An earthy wine, with a strong herb and spice character. The fruit is fresh, laced with black currant acidity and soft tannins. A fine, food-friendly wine, ready to drink.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2009 Cister da Ribeira Red (Douro)

description: A bright, citrusy, crisp, off-dry Vinho Verde. It is the perfect aperitif wine with its light texture, slight fizz and a delicious lemon and grapefruit aftertaste.
title: Vinhos Norte 2010 Cruzeiro Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a friendly fruity wine that has a soft texture and bright acidity. If it does miss a sense of place, it makes up for it with citrus and white fruit flavors that are so fresh. Drink now.
title: Cartuxa 2014 EA Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This wine is soft and fruity, although without great structure or sense of purpose. The finish is attractive and bright. Drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2014 Vila Santa Loios Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Delicately perfumed, yellow and tropical-fruit flavored, this is bright and very fruity. The citrus edge adds a further lift to this refreshing, ready-to-drink wine.
title: Casa Cadaval 2015 Vinha Padre Pedro Branco White (Tejo)

description: Smooth, rounded wine, with vanilla, ripe pear and a bitter herbal finish. The wine feels fat, unfocused.
title: Borges 2010 Lello Branco White (Douro)

description: Pink in color, a smooth wine, layered in caramel, missing real fruit.
title: Borges 2010 Lello RosÃ© (Douro)

description: This is a ripe, fruity wine that has both tannins and generous of black fruits. The combination has produced a rounded, fruity wine that is sustained by its structure although it is very ready to drink now.
title: Parras Vinhos 2014 Terra Grande Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a soft, tropical-fruit flavored wine. It has a tangy, mineral texture that cuts through the riper fruitiness to give a wine that is easy and very drinkable now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Loios White (Alentejano)

description: This is a wine that's ready to consume, with its ripe red fruits and spicy tannins. It is smooth with just a bite of structure along with considerable acidity. The wine is balanced and attractive in a summer barbecue style.
title: Caves Velhas 2014 Serradayres Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: This is a ripe, fruit-forward wine. It has black currant and some attractive acidity. It seems to miss out on the structure and firm texture that would be expected from a Douro wine, so it is possible to drink now.
title: Enoport 2014 Novo Mondo Red (Douro)

description: Rich and bold, it's a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Tinta Roriz, both giving a floral character as well as some concentrated tannins. The dry structure and the intense acidity at the end suggest some aging. Drink from 2015.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Pedras do Monte Red (Lisboa)

description: This is made from the most widely planted red grape in Vinho Verde, VinhÃ£o. It is soft and juicy with a ripe character and almond and caramel flavors. Drink now.
title: Quinta de PaÃ§os 2016 Casa de PaÃ§os RosÃ© (Vinho Verde)

description: With its apricot and ripe pear aromas, this is a full and rounded wine. It has a good balance between acidity and ripe fruit. It is floral, smooth and ready to drink.
title: Casa Cadaval 2012 Vinha Padre Pedro White (Tejo)

description: Crisp apples, touched with some sweetness, but finely clean and fresh, this is a great apÃ©ritif style of Vinho Verde, finishing with just a sparkle. Screwcap.
title: JosÃ© Maria da Fonseca 2006 Twin Vines White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a light wine that has crisp, perfumed red fruits and layers of acidity. It is juicy and spicy and finishes with good acidity and a mineral texture. Drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Smart Dog Syrah-Trincadeira Red (Alentejano)

description: The Aveleda estate is the source of the fruit for this dry, delicious Vinho Verde. It's a reference for the food-friendly, lemon and grapefruit style, adding minerality and a taut texture to the forward fruitiness. Drink this summer, or hold for up to six months.
title: Aveleda 2012 Quinta da Aveleda Estate Bottled White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a clever blend with the natural ripeness of Pinot Noir in Portugal smoothing out the firmer tannins of Touriga Nacional. The result is a rich, soft wine, just lifted by acidity and anchored by a background of cherry fruits and black currant. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2014 Terra de Touros Red (Tejo)

description: A blend of Arinto and FernÃ£o Pires, this is light and crisply refreshing. There are some yellow fruit flavors that contrast with the lime acidity. It is ready to drink now.
title: Adega MÃ£e 2015 Pinta Negra Branco White (Lisboa)

description: With its apricot and ripe pear aromas, this is a full and rounded wine. It has a good balance between acidity and ripe fruit. It is floral, smooth and ready to drink.
title: Casa Cadaval 2012 Vinha Padre Pedro White (Tejo)

description: This ripe, fruity wine has soft tannins and red-berry flavors. With just a touch of spice, it is ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Pacheca 2013 Colheita Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Delicately perfumed, yellow and tropical-fruit flavored, this is bright and very fruity. The citrus edge adds a further lift to this refreshing, ready-to-drink wine.
title: Casa Cadaval 2015 Vinha Padre Pedro Branco White (Tejo)

description: A sugar water style of Vinho Verde, all sweetness and acidity. It is fresh and clean, very crisp and green.
title: Vidigal 2013 White (Vinho Verde)

description: The Estremadura region, north of Lisbon, is at the western extremity of mainland Europe. It produces a good line in this style of fresh, crisp wines, light and bright. There is just a hint of sweetness, with currant flavors and a final softness.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 Point West White (Estremadura)

description: A blend of the rare Caladoc, a specialty of DFJ Vinhos, and Tinta Roriz, this is a soft, juicy, fruity and forward wine. It has bright red-berry fruit and light tannins, along with just a hint of wood aging. It's very ready to drink. Screwcap.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Alta Corte Red (Lisboa)

description: Lightly fizzy, this young fruity wine is an easygoing Vinho Verde. It is just off dry, giving a soft character to the lively fruit, citrus and floral wine. It is ready to drink.
title: Santos & Seixo NV Rotas de Portugal Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: Fresh, juicy wine, with soft tannins and taut red cherry fruit. The tannins provide a discreet backbone. Age for 2â€“3 years.
title: BacalhÃ´a Wines of Portugal 2010 JP AzeitÃ£o Tinto Red (Setubal)

description: Aged in barrels in the cool cellars in AzeitÃ£o, this wine combines great freshness with spice, toast and acidity that come together in a sweet, honeyed aftertaste. It won't improve in bottle, so drink now.
title: BacalhÃ´a Wines of Portugal 2011 Colheita  (Moscatel de SetÃºbal)

description: A soft and fruity wine, with raspberry and caramel flavors. It is attractively lightened by acidity and give a soft, off-dry aftertaste.
title: Falua 2010 Conde de Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada RosÃ© (Tejo)

description: This is a very perfumed wine, with the addition of Moscatel in the blend, adding the lychee flavor. It's textured with a crisp edge that allows the wine to retain its fresh character. This is a wine to be drunk young.
title: BacalhÃ´a Wines of Portugal 2012 JP AzeitÃ£o Branco White (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: Bical produces delicious pear and apple flavored wines. This bright, fruity wine is a fine example of this creamy freshness. It is a wine for drinking now, while fresh and crisp at the end.
title: Caves AlianÃ§a 2012 Galeria Bical (Bairrada)

description: With its ripe tannins and soft, juicy black fruit, this is an immediately drinkable wine. It has a crisp layer of acidity, giving it a light touch. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2015 Vinha Maria Premium Red (DÃ£o)

description: Light, bright and fruity this is an easy-to-drink off-dry wine for the summer. It is clean and crisp, apples and pears set off by floral aromas. Drink now.
title: Vinihold 2016 Caiua a Noite White (Vinho Verde)

description: The wine is all tangy zesty fruit. With plenty of apple and grapefruit acidity, it is lively, textured and bright. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Montes Claros Colheita White (Alentejo)

description: This is an attractive fruity wine. With its soft texture, perfumed white fruits and balanced acidity, it is the sort of wine that is ready for a warm day. Drink now.
title: Adega MÃ£e 2016 Pinta Negra White (Lisboa)

description: The wine, named after a typical mustache from the 19th century, is all fruit: ripe blackberries with balancing acidity. This is an easy ripe wine that will be great with barbecues this summer thanks to its soft tannins and drinkability.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Bigode Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: Chardonnay offers the roundness while FernÃ£o Pires offers perfume in this attractive, ready-to-drink wine. It has bright, crisp lemon and green-apple acidity that is immediately appealing. Screwcap.
designation: Tagus Creek Chardonnay and FernÃ£o Pires
title: Falua 2012 Tagus Creek Chardonnay and FernÃ£o Pires White (Tejo)

description: A very herbal wine, with vegetal flavors of celery and asparagus. Citrusy acidity comes through at the end.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2010 Cister da Ribeira Branco White (Douro)

description: Produced in eastern Alentejo, near Spain, this light and soft wine is easy and drinkable. It has a smooth texture, just hinting at lemony acidity. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2015 Monte da Cal Colheita Seleccionada White (Alentejano)

description: Bright and fruity, with a tannic edge, this is a blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah. This is food friendly, with a rich red-fruit flavor that's cut with a caramel note and strawberry acidity.
title: Falua 2011 Conde de Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada RosÃ© (Tejo)

description: The Douro version of Paxis is a blend of Touriga Franca, Touriga Nacional and Tinta Roriz. It is a rounded, smooth and spicy wine, with weight and richness. Packed with red berries and plums, it is fruity and structured, with tannins providing a strong base of support. Drink from 2014.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Paxis Red (Douro)

description: Perfect apÃ©ritif Vinho Verde, light as a feather, attractively laced with citrus and peach flavors. It has a light prickle on the tongue, with a soft aftertaste.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2010 Salsus Colheita White (Vinho Verde)

description: Named after the valley where the vineyard is situated, this red-fruited spicy wine is crisp. There are soft tannins and attractive acidity. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2014 Vale das Donas Red (Tejo)

description: From the south of Vinho Verde, close to the Douro, this is a lively and fresh wine, bright with acidity and lifted by its prickle on the tongue. It is dry, although a soft touch of baked apple gives a gentle, fruity aftertaste.
title: Quinta das Arcas 2014 Conde Vilar Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: This medium-sweet rosÃ© is bursting with ripe strawberry aromas and flavors. It is soft, just edged by crispness and ready to drink with its light, fruity finish.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Coreto RosÃ© (Lisboa)

description: Fresh and crisp, this is a wine that has little flavor and only the thinest palate. It is bright to drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 Terra de Touros Arinto (Tejo)

description: This is an earthy, rustic wine that has high acidity and stalky fruit. It will round out as it develops although that rustic character is likely to remain.
title: Adega MÃ£e 2014 Pinta Negra Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a soft, rounded and fruity wine that is already ready to drink. It has dark berry notes, spicy accents and a strong layer of acidity to keep it fresh. Tannins show through gently, softly, just enough to give the wine structure. Drink now and until 2018.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Casa do Lago Tinto Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)

description: Perhaps with a nod to the battlefields of the Napoleonic wars fought in this region north of Lisbon, this is a crisp, apple- and lime-flavored wine. It has bright acidity and a delicate texture, with notes of pear skin and grapefruit. Drink now.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2012 Forgotten Field Branco White (Lisboa)

description: A blend that is dominated by Arinto, this is crisp and lemon flavored with hints of riper yellow fruits. It has a lively, bright aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Santos & Seixo 2015 Rotas de Portugal Branco White (Alentejano)

description: An attractive, fruity blend that brings in a fair number of local and international grapes. The result is a seamless, fruity, soft wine that is ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Coreto Red (Lisboa)

description: Alvarinho and Chardonnay are the chosen grapes for this blend. As its name suggests, a salty taste from the ocean spices up the ripe yellow and green plum fruits. It's soft with a fine balance of acidity and a soft honey touch at the end.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Point West White (Lisboa)

description: A warm, ripe vintage of Altano, its berry and red plum fruits rich and generous. It has attractive, well-balanced, soft tannins. A layer of acidity and spice completes this harmonious wine.
title: Symington Family Estates 2009 Altano Red (Douro)

description: This is a ripe and juicy blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Tinta Roriz. The tannins are present although well integrated into the fine juicy red-fruit flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Pedras do Monte Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a rich and smooth wine that has the lightest hint of minerality. Ripe yellow fruits and elegant green plum and citrus flavors give this wine both a fruity character and a fine texture. Drink now.
title: Aveleda 2014 White (Douro)

description: This is a full, fruity, rich and concentrated wine. It has bright red berries, some firm tannins and a good dense texture. It's also light and crisp, with acidity that cuts through the ripe fruitiness. Drink now through 2019.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Paxis Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a rich wine, smoky with vanilla and apple flavors. It has some good intensity, as well as a textured character that gives it some aging potential. Bright, fresh acidity cuts through the riper fruits. Drink now and until 2019.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Segada Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Lightly prickly on the tongue, this is a refreshing, almost dry wine. It is bright, lively and fruity with citrus and crisp apple flavors. The wine is light and bright with plenty of acidity at the end.
title: Aveleda 2015 Aveleda White (Vinho Verde)

description: DFJ is one of a few producers who grow Caladoc, which is here blended with Tinta Roriz. A cross between Grenache and Malbec, it gives a dark colored, structured wine that is shown well here. Berry fruits come through the texture strongly, giving a rich character and plenty of final acidity. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Alta Corte Red (Lisboa)

description: Arinto is a grape that has just crossed the Tejo river from the western Lisboa vineyards. In this wine, it seems to have preserved its fresh and crisp character that is bright and packed with lemon and grapefruit flavors. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2014 Arinto (Tejo)

description: A lemon flavored wine that is soft and fruity. With its zesty, tight texture and really crisp acidity, the wine is lively and crisp. Drinkable now, it will be better from early 2017.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Vila Santa Lois White (Alentejano)

description: Lightly prickly on the tongue, this is a refreshing, almost dry wine. It is bright, lively and fruity with citrus and crisp apple flavors. The wine is light and bright with plenty of acidity at the end.
title: Aveleda 2015 Aveleda White (Vinho Verde)

description: Almost cool in character, this crisp Douro comes from high-altitude vineyards. The grapes yield a fruity citrus- and pear-driven wine that's minerally, with just the right amount of acidity to push its freshness forward.
title: Aveleda 2012 Vinho Branco White (Douro)

description: A full, ripe vanilla- and strawberry-flavored wine that hits the spot for the summer, with an emphasis on dryness, but with a soft, fruity, food-friendly aftertaste.
title: Falua 2007 Conde de Vimioso Vinho RosÃ© Red (Ribatejano)

description: Rustic wine, its fruit angular and its tannins cutting into the wine awkwardly. Final acidity gives more sharpness.
title: Monte Novo e Figueirinha 2007 Herdade da Figueirinha Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Elegant, fresh wine, full of delicious red berry fruits, a fruit salad of red and black plums and a light touch of spice. Bright, juicy, ready to drink.
title: Parras Vinhos 2008 Castelo do Sulco Colheita Red (Lisboa)

description: A ripe, full-bodied and spicy wine, defiantly dry, with a tight acid character. Aromatic fruit finish with intense perfumes, so that the wine is both rich and fresh.
title: BacalhÃ´a Wines of Portugal 2009 JP AzeitÃ£o Branco White (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: The Cabernet Sauvignon structure shows strongly in this firm wine. Mint and black currant flavors are dense and concentrated. The tannins give a dry character to the wine that contrasts with its fruitiness. Drink from 2017.
title: Casa Ermelinda Freitas 2013 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: A richly fruity wine, warm and ripe. Spice, tannins and black plums are all there in a concentrated package that projects richness. It's perfumed although it does need to age. Drink from 2016.
title: C. da Silva 2011 Dalva Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is a fresh wine with attractive ripe fruits. Apples, bitter orange and a streak of citrus are coupled with pineapple acidity. It's a well-made, immediately drinkable wine.
title: Herdade Grande 2013 Audaz White (Alentejano)

description: Named after the kingfisher bird, this wine has a warm, yellow-fruit and ripe character. It is perfumed, with a full texture and the richness that comes from aging on the lees. Drink this ripe wine now.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2016 Guarda Rios Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This soft, spicy wine has easy fruitiness. Black currants are balanced with acidity and a bright aftertaste. This great-value wine is ready to drink.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2016 Guarda Rios Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Part of a range of single-varietal wines from this producer, this bottling features richly structured and perfumed Touriga Nacional. A firm core gives a minty edge to the blackberry fruits. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2015 Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: With its dark color and rich fruit, this is instantly approachable. Tannins are well integrated into the ripe plum and black cherry fruits. With fresh acidity and a core of dry tannins at the end, the wine could age. Drink from 2016.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Casa do Lago Tinto Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)

description: This attractive, spicy and fruity wine brings out the warmth of the Alentejo while also keeping crispness and black-currant acidity. It is smooth, rich and very ready to drink.
title: Santos & Seixo 2016 Rotas de Portugal Red (Alentejano)

description: Green plums, freshly sliced melon and some pineapple all come together in this fruit-salad-fresh wine. It is ripe, but retains plenty of crispness, a light structure of orange zest giving shape and piquancy.
title: DÃ£o Sul 2007 Q do E Encontro Bical (Bairrada)

description: Two rounded, ripe varietals give a rich, smooth wine. It has just a touch of perfume from FernÃ£o Pires, made ripe by the creamy Chardonnay. Pear fruit is cut with balanced acidity. Drink now.
title: Falua 2015 Tagus Creek Chardonnay-FernÃ£o Pires White (Tejo)

description: This is a soft wine, attractively fruity with gentle tannins. It is fresh with red berry fruits and open acidity. There is a burnt edge at the end which needs to blow off. Drink from 2015.
title: Vidigal 2011 Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: A blend of FernÃ£o Pires and Arinto, this is totally crisp and refreshingly fruity. It is perfumed, smooth while also cut with acidity. The acidity comes from both citrus and pineapple flavors. Drink now.
title: Falua 2015 Conde Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Branco White (Tejo)

description: This wine is a blend of Aragonez with Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. Firm and rich while maintaining fresh fruit flavors, this is a solid, intense and stylish wine. The palate balances red-berry fruits with a core of dry tannins laced with acidity. Keep this wine for another year.
title: Falua 2011 Conde de Vimioso Colheita Selecionada Red (Tejo)

description: This is a firmly structured, dark wine. It has black cherry and berry fruit, a solid core of tannins and tight acidity. With its dense character, there is every chance of this impressive wine aging well, yielding a more rounded wine. Drink from 2016.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Vega Red (Douro)

description: The wine is structured and tannic which gives a dry edge that balances the perfumed black fruits and acidity. The aftertaste is fruity and juicy. Ready to drink.
title: Casa Ermelinda Freitas 2013 Reserva Syrah (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: This fruity wine bursts with the warmth of the Alentejo. It has a rich texture, black currant and berry fruits, and just the right amount of acidity. It is a good wine to drink young.
title: Global Wines 2015 Monte da Cal Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: This ripe, fruity blend of Touriga Nacional and Alfrocheiro is zesty and lightly spicy, with a warm, ripe character. The strawberry fruit is laced with acidity, allowing the smooth texture to shine. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2016 Cabriz RosÃ© Colheita Seleccionada RosÃ© (DÃ£o)

description: Named after the kingfisher bird, this wine has a warm, yellow-fruit and ripe character. It is perfumed, with a full texture and the richness that comes from aging on the lees. Drink this ripe wine now.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2016 Guarda Rios Branco White (Alentejano)

description: FernÃ£o Pires and Arinto are blended together to yield this ripe and warm, while also poised wine. It has pear and creamed apple flavors that are shot through with orange-zest acidity. Ready to drink in six months.
title: Falua 2012 Conde de Vimioso Colheita Selecionada White (Tejo)

description: Bright, lively and fruity, this is a delicious, crisp, dry Vinho Verde from the north of the region, close to Spain. It has citrus notes, a bright texture, lively acidity and a touch of spritz.
title: Quintas de MelgaÃ§o 2012 Terra Antiga White (Vinho Verde)

description: Soft, dusty-textured wine that shows blackberry and black currant fruit flavors, along with a dry, firm core of tannins. The edge initially shows some bitterness, but then the wood comes through. Drink now or until 2010.
title: Falua 2007 Conde de Vimioso Red (Ribatejano)

description: The apricot notes of Viognier come through strongly with this smooth, ripe wine. It has a steely character and a cool freshness from the Arinto and SÃ­ria in the blend. All in all, an attractive wine that could age a few months.
title: Terras de Alter 2013 Fado Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Fado, wine and song, reads the label, and Fado is the essentially Portuguese style of music. The wine is more international in character, ripe, soft and smooth, with attractive acidity and juicy fruit. Drink through 2016.
title: Terras de Alter 2013 Fado Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Bold and spicy, this is a soft, round wine. It is ripe with berry fruits and crisp with acidity. While it only hints at the structure of Touriga Nacional it does have a rich, warm character that makes it ready to drink now.
title: Casa Ermelinda Freitas 2013 Reserva Touriga Nacional (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: Initially fresh, with a creamy, white-fruit texture, this has acidity, but it finishes fat and rather hot, with pepper.
title: Marcolino Sebo 2006 Visconde de Borba White (Alentejo)

description: A perfumed wine that is soft and fruity. It has a fresh, tangy character that makes it very refreshing and crisp.Think of this as an apÃ©ritif rosÃ©, bright and light.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Casa do Lago RosÃ© (Lisboa)

description: Tight and textured, this is a mineral structured wine. Green fruits and acidity keep the wine fresh. The aftertaste is flatter, not bringing out enough fruit.
title: Herdade do PerdigÃ£o 2013 Villa Romanu White (Alentejo)

description: This well-balanced wine is rich, just off dry and with a mineral texture. Plenty of freshness with a crisp aftertaste balances the softer side of the wine. It's for immediate drinking.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Barca 2013 Hera White (Vinho Verde)

description: This candied rosÃ© is a blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah. Full of soft red berry fruits with only light acidity, it is off-dry to taste. A touch of pepper at the end is less attractive.
title: Falua 2013 Conde de Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada RosÃ© (Tejo)

description: A sweet wine that has a candy shop confected taste. It does have acidity along with a touch of citrus although the sherbet aftertaste is off-putting.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Barca 2013 Ela Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: Vividly pink in color, this is a light and sweet wine. There is a sugary aftertaste followed by fresh, crisp acidity.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Barca 2013 Ela RosÃ© (Vinho Verde)

description: Lightly spritzy, this tastes of crisp apple and finishes just off-dry. It's deliciously refreshing, bright and tangy. Drink now.
title: Caves Campelo 2015 Miranda White (Vinho Verde)

description: A soft and easy wine with black currant fruit and gentle tannins, this has just enough acidity and structure to hold it together. Spice adds interest on the finish. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2014 Monte da Cal Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: Now in a smart clear blue bottle, this is Aveleda's estate wine. It is always a classic, with just some extra weight to give it distinction. The flavors are apple, brightened with lime, finishing with vibrant acidity.
title: Aveleda 2009 Quinta da Aveleda White (Vinho Verde)

description: A young and fruity wine that is made to be drunk young. It has soft tannins, red berry fruits and a juicy fresh character. Full of fruit with just a light structure, it can be drunk now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2014 Red (Alentejo)

description: A rounded wine, this gives pleasure with its pear and ripe apple flavors. Lightly touched with acidity, this has a soft finish.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Point West White (Lisboa)

description: Named after a traditional Douro dance, this wine is ripe and spicy, with new wood flavors. It has a soft structure that allows the vibrant berry fruits to come through strongly. Both the fruit and the wood aging say this wine is too young, so drink from 2017.
title: Aveleda 2014 Charamba Reserva Red (Douro)

description: One of the better examples in this category, this is crisp and clean. It has a hint of tannin and a green edge from the only just-ripe grapes. The strawberry flavor at the end does bring an attractive aftertaste.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 RosÃ© (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a fruity wine with crisp red fruits and acidity that are balanced by gentle tannins. With its warm feel, it is an easy wine that is ready to drink.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Vila Santa Loios Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: The wine is ripe with apple and creamed pear flavors. It is warm, rich and missing acidity. There is an attractive almond and spice character to this ripe wine. Drink now.
title: Herdade Grande 2015 Audaz Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Syrah, CastelÃ£o and Aragonez go into the blend of this rich juicy wine. It is so soft and ripe, just hinting at tannins and with red-berry fruit. The wine is round and smooth, ready to drink.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Cascas Winemaker Selection Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a delicious and ripe-fruited wine. Dominated by FernÃ£o Pires, it has an apple-puree texture: smooth and creamy. The wine has an edge of light acidity at the end to give it a lift. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Casa do Lago Branco White (Lisboa)

description: There are firm and dusty tannins in this spicy wine. It has firm fruit, a solid texture and a juicy, nutmeg-flavored aftertaste. Drink from 2018 when some of the tannins have softened.
title: Enoport 2014 TopÃ¡zio Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Mula Velha, â€œthe old donkey,â€ is a younger wine than its name suggests. Brisk and fruity, it offers firm tannins and layers of blackberry fruit. With a touch of oak aging, the wine is developing well and will be ready to drink from late 2017.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Mula Velha Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: This wine is ripe, full of black fruits and soft tannins. With plenty of acidity to keep it crisp, the wine has a cool, flavorful character topped off by berry fruits. It's ready to drink.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Terra Grande Red (Alentejano)

description: The local grape CastelÃ£o is blended with Cabernet Sauvignon in this soft, spicy and fruity wine. Red fruits and balanced acidity are given a shove by a lightly tannic structure. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Terra de Lobos Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: This wine comes from vineyards outside the boundaries of the DÃ£o region but has the same typical blend. It shows minerality as well as rich fruit and soft tannins. The wine is balanced, stylish and deliciously ready to drink.
title: Caves Velhas 2014 D. Fuas Reserva Red (Terras do DÃ£o)

description: This ripe, full-bodied rosÃ© is made from 100% rich, perfumed Touriga Nacional. Good balance between ripe strawberry fruits and the crisp acidity make it both fruity and warm. Drink now.
title: Secret Spot Wines 2016 Vale da Poupa RosÃ© (Douro)

description: Not many wines come from Bucelas today, as its vineyards get eaten up by the northern Lisbon suburbs. This Arinto-based wine suggests there should be some more of this ultra-crisp white, which bears a passing resemblance to a Vinho Verde in its super-fresh apple and grapefruit flavors.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2007 Prova RÃ©gia Arinto (Bucelas)

description: An attractive salmon pink-colored wine, very fresh, with bright red currant acidity, fleshed out with some caramel, raspberry and a dash of red apple skins texture.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2007 Casa do Lago RosÃ© Touriga Nacional (Estremadura)

description: A young, fresh blend of Arinto and FernÃ£o Pires, the wine is fruity, light and with a crisp, bright aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 White (Tejo)

description: A fresh, juicy wine with berry fruits, ripe but intense tannins and a black cherry flavor. There is a delicious, final burst of acidity.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2007 Porca de MurÃ§a Tinto Red (Douro)
