description: This wine is ripe, fruity and balanced. It has red-berry flavors along with acidity and a bright aftertaste. Drink from 2019
title: Casa Ferreirinha 2015 Esteva Red (Douro)

description: This softly perfumed wine has red-fruit flavors and plenty of acidity. It is jammy and juicy with succulent red berries. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Paxis Pinot Noir (Lisboa)

description: This is an attractive, perfumed wine that is a blend of SÃ­ria, Arinto and Viognier. It's the Viognier that gives the perfumed character that makes it so distinctive. It's fruity, lightly textured and ready to drink.
title: Terras de Alter 2014 Terra d'Alter White (Alentejano)

description: The wine is young, still more structure than fruit. It has firm tannins as well as juicy blackberry fruits. A blend of Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon and Touriga Nacional, it is likely to age for a few months, so drink from the end of 2016.
title: Fiuza 2014 3 Castas Red (Tejo)

description: A mixed bag of varieties went into this soft and fruity wine. It has gentle tannins that are lifted by acidity and black currant fruitiness. With its lifestyle label (a small Vespa motor scooter), it is obviously meant to be an easy-going ready-to-drink wine. And it succeeds.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Bonavita Red (Lisboa)

description: The style of this wine is fruity with blackberry flavors giving a bright and lively character. Black currant acidity joins in the fruitiness while allowing room for some structured tannins. The wine will be ready to drink from late 2016.
title: Terras de Alter 2015 Terra d'Alter Red (Alentejano)

description: Quite why Smart Dog is a good name for a wine is a mystery. The wine itself a rich, soft Syrah with attractive ripe blackberry and plum flavors and soft, finely integrated tannins. It's an enjoyable wine that's ready to drink.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2012 Smart Dog Syrah (Alentejano)

description: A soft and indistinct wine that is fat and has only the merest hint of fruit. It is round with some fresh acidity at the end.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2014 Vale das Donas White (Tejo)

description: A crisp and strongly lemon-flavored wine, this is light and bright with an herbaceous hint and a softer aftertaste that has melon and a rounder texture. Drink now.
title: Quinta Vale do Armo 2013 Vila Jardim Siria (Tejo)

description: A blend of the two major grapes of the region, Alvarinho and Loureiro, and grown at the home estate of the producer, this is delicious Vinho Verde. It is dry, crisp, light and piercingly bright, perfect either as an apÃ©ritif or with seafood. Drink now.
title: Aveleda 2016 Quinta da Aveleda White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is an intensely perfumed wine, with typical Syrah earthiness and acidity. It is soft, fruity, full of black plum flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel 2014 Ciconia Reserva Syrah (Alentejano)

description: Light, fruity and off dry, this is a fresh and crisp wine. It has sweetened lemon juice flavors that are cut by intense, young acidity. Balanced and ready to drink now.
designation: Salsus Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Salsus Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas White (Vinho Verde)

description: Adding Syrah (Shiraz as the producer calls it) to the blend with Tinta Roriz and Touriga Nacional gives a strongly perfumed character to this firm, still structured wine. It also has a fresh element from the black currant acidity that cuts through the wine. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Brigando Red (Lisboa)

description: Produced from Touriga Nacional, this fresh wine keeps the acidity of the grape while losing any tough tannins. The result is an attractive, crisp wine, with final strawberry flavors.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Brigando RosÃ© (Lisboa)

description: Spicy and light at heart, this is a perfumed wine that the winemaker reckons will go with Asian food. Apples, a touch of green herbs and peaches abound in this refreshing, drinkable wine. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Casa do Lago Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This wine from the mountain vineyards of eastern Portugal is rich, fruity and made to be drunk young. With soft tannins and juicy red berry fruit, it's open and ripe. Drink now.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2014 BarÃ£o de Figueira Red (Beira Interior)

description: This wine is full of red berry flavor and soft tannins. With its forward fruit and smooth texture, it's made to be drunk young, so drink now.
title: Falua 2015 Conde Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Red (Tejo)

description: This is a soft, bland wine, with light fruit flavors, a creamy texture and a final tang of lemon zest. Drink now.
title: Parras Wines 2014 Terra Grande Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This blend is dominated by one of the two grapes of Vinho Verde: the Loureiro. That gives both a crisp texture and ripe apple and green-plum fruits. It is a ripe wine, juicy and ready to drink now.
title: Quinta de PaÃ§os 2016 White (Vinho Verde)

description: This wine is packed with flavor from the ripe blend of Shiraz, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Nacional. Its berry fruits and balanced acidity give the wine an easy, juicy character. The gentle tannins are easily integrated with the fruit. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Brigando Red (Lisboa)

description: A blend of AntÃ£o Vaz and Arinto, this is a deliciously fresh wine, lighted by acidity and with a tight texture. Drink now for summer pleasure.
title: Alente 2009 White (Alentejano)

description: Fresh and creamy, this is a smooth, rich wine. It has citrus and baked apple flavors that meld easily and fully into a fruity texture. With some weight, it also has a bright, crisp aftertaste.
title: Herdade Grande 2012 Audaz Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Apple flavors dominate this attractive blend of seven grapes, including three aromatic varieties, that give the wine its perfumed character. So although it is young and with enough acidity, it is the hints of lychee and peppered pear that add interest to the wine. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Portada Winemaker's Selection Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Gently wood aged, the wine is rich in tannins and with generous red fruits. It is ripe with pepper as well as red-fruit flavors. It will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Opta 2016 Red (DÃ£o)

description: Crisp, not quite dry, this incorporates lively, fruity Loureiro grapes with a touch of Trajadura and Arinto culled from Lima Valley vineyards. With its light squeeze of lemon and sliced apple and grapefruit flavors, it's all about freshness. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Lima 2013 Ponte White (Vinho Verde)

description: This lightly perfumed wine is crisp and clear. Apple and pear flavors are attractively packaged in fresh acidity and an orange-peel tang. The wine is still young, with its tight aftertaste, so wait until later in 2015 to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Palha Canas White (Lisboa)

description: The lightest wine from Cartuxa, EA stands for EugÃ©nio de Almeida, the creator of the charity that owns the winery. It's simple and fruity, with attractive tannins and red cherry fruit. Ready to drink.
title: Cartuxa 2010 EA Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This is an attractive, perfumed wine that is a blend of SÃ­ria, Arinto and Viognier. It's the Viognier that gives the perfumed character that makes it so distinctive. It's fruity, lightly textured and ready to drink.
title: Terras de Alter 2014 Terra d'Alter White (Alentejano)

description: A fairly full, rich and creamy version of Vinho Verde, with floral and anise aromas. Big and yet refreshing, sparked by some lively spritz. The finish echoes the anise and blends in some bright lime notes as well.
title: Quintas de MelgaÃ§o 1998 Couto de Frades Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: It is the Verdelho that gives this wine its attractive, perfumed character. Crisp and bright with a tangy, lemon zest texture, the wine is rich. fruity and ready to drink.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2016 White (Tejo)

description: A firm wine, based on dry tannins and some dense fruit. It has acidity, driven by black berry flavors. The core of the wine is dry, both from wood and acidity, and it will benefit from 2â€“3 years' aging.
title: Quinta do Portal 2007 Mural Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Soft, warm and lightly tannic, this has an herbaceous character. Its fresh acidity balances its black currant flavor. It is fragrant, fruity and mature	 ready to drink.
title: Monte da Penha 2007 Montefino Red (Alentejano)

description: This has big red berry flavors along with intense acidity topped by the dark, dry tannic structure. It will need some aging, so drink from 2017.
title: Perescuma 2013 Orquestra Red (Alentejano)

description: Soft, attractive wine whose lightness is belied by its 14% alcohol. That makes it balanced, the black cherry flavors well integrated with the easy tannins, light spice and acidity. Drink this year.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2009 Loios Red (Alentejano)

description: Classic tannic DÃ£o Touriga Nacional, packed with minerality, dark and dry tannins, firm and with a good juicy final character. Part of a range of wines from across the country under the name Azul Portugal.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2008 Azul Portugal Red (DÃ£o)

description: A soft, earthy wine with light fruits and plum jelly flavors. It is a wine that should be drunk young to enjoy its balance of fruitiness, acidity and light tannins. Screwcap.
title: Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel 2010 Ciconia Red (Alentejano)

description: Considering both grapes in the blend are known for their tannic structure, this is ripe and open. It is fruity with red berry flavors and acidity to balance. There is a round soft aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Fiuza 2014 Native Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: The wine is rich, possibly too rich with its dark tannins and tarry character. While there are plenty of black plum fruits, there is also some bitter licorice that comes from extraction during winemaking. Considering its age, it is likely this character will remain. The wine is ready to drink.
title: H. Abrantes Douro Wines 2011 LVW Red (Douro)

description: A smooth and ripe wine with tropical fruits as well as more crisp apple. It is ripe wine, full in the mouth with a final perfumed acidity. Give it another six months.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2014 White (Tejo)

description: This wine heads the range of good value wines under the Monte Alentejano name. It has some weight and a tangy, structured character, and has not lost its black-plum flavors. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2007 Monte Alentejano Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Soft, fruity wine, a perfect foil for grilled meats with its light tannin structure. Ripe and very fruity, generous and juicy.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2010 Loios Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Fresh, crisp Arinto gives a fine lemon and sliced apple character to this light soft wine. With its bright fruit, crisp acidity and tangy texture, it is totally ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Escada Arinto (Lisboa)

description: This is a smooth, clean, attractive wine that is bright and crisp. Lemon and pink grapefruit give the fine fruitiness while the acidity and lightly mineral texture add the structure. Drink now.
title: Terras de Alter 2015 Terra d'Alter SÃ­ria-Arinto-Viognier White (Alentejano)

description: Fresh and fruity, this is a blend of local white grapes with Sauvignon Blanc is light-bodied and crisp. Full of citrus and herbal flavors, this is an easy wine to enjoy. Drink now.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2014 Forgotten Field White (Lisboa)

description: Fine ripe fruit pushes through the young tannic structure in this fresh wine. It still has an edge of tannin which balances well with the red berry fruits. Acidity cuts through everything to leave a crisp, blueberry flavored aftertaste.
title: Quinta do Portal 2013 Muros de Vinha Red (Douro)

description: While there is plenty of fruit here, there is also a rustic, barnyard edge that is less attractive. The wood aging has produced some spicy flavors and tannins to give the wine structure.
title: Parras Vinhos 2013 Montaria Tinto Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This dark, structured wine, with its balanced blend of Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz, is firm with tannins and dense berry fruits. Full in the mouth, it is a concentrated wine that brings out a strongly chalky texture. The wine is still moving towards a rich future. Drink from 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Paxis Red (Lisboa)

description: From vineyards at 2000 feet elevation, this is a rich and spicy wine that has a pure streak of fruit freshness and a firmly tannic core. It is perfumed from Touriga Nacional in the blend, with red berry and black plum flavors coming through strongly along, balanced by acidity. It will be better from 2017.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2013 BarÃ£o de Figueira Reserva Red (Beira Interior)

description: This is a fruity, soft wine with a light texture and plenty of citrus fruits. It is crisp, clean with a hint of perfumes and a herbal edge that comes from the Sauvignon Blanc in the blend. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2015 TalhÃ£oI White (Tejo)

description: Orange peel aromas emerge on this delectable fortified Moscatel. Aging in barrel for at least three years has given it roundness and some old toast character that adds to the dried raisin and apricot flavors. Not for aging, drink now.
title: JosÃ© Maria da Fonseca 2007  Moscatel de SetÃºbal

description: A fruity, fresh and crisp wine, this is given some weight by the inclusion of Chardonnay in the blend. It has an attractive texture, and the lemon and grapefruit flavors dominate.
title: Herdade dos TemplÃ¡rios 2011 Vale das Donas Branco White (Tejo)

description: It is the FernÃ£o Pires that gives this wine its class and freshness. The Sauvignon Blanc in the blend, with its herbaceous character, seems to clash. The wine is crisp with lemon flavors and brings an intense final acidity.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Terra de Lobos Branco White (Tejo)

description: A mixed bag of varieties went into this soft and fruity wine. It has gentle tannins that are lifted by acidity and black currant fruitiness. With its lifestyle label (a small Vespa motor scooter), it is obviously meant to be an easy-going ready-to-drink wine. And it succeeds.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Bonavita Red (Lisboa)

description: Mint and red-fruit aromas dominate this classic DÃ£o wine, with its firm tannins and mineral structure. Spice, toast and dark-berry flavors give a feeling of weight to a wine that demands to be paired with rich red meats.
title: Caves Velhas 2008 Catedral Reserva Red (DÃ£o)

description: Fresh and perfumed, this wine offers great citric flavors, a lively crispness rare in white wines from central Portugal. Pear and some yellow fruits give roundness.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2006 White (Ribatejo)

description: This is a ripe, smooth blend of Alvarinho and Chardonnay. The two complement each other well with yellow fruits touched by a more citrus edge and a rich character. It is fruity, full-bodied and ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Point West White (Lisboa)

description: This young, citrus flavored wine is crisp and still with its yeasty and fruity flavors. The wine is fresh and ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Lobo e FalcÃ£o (Wolf and Falcon) White (Tejo)

description: Spanish producer Vicente Gandia has made a foray into Portugal with this ripely fruity and soft wine. It is fresh, herbal and spicy with attractive red berry fruits. It's been made to be drunk young and it's ready now.
title: Vicente Gandia 2012 BoÃ¢brisa Red (Alentejano)

description: A light and fruity wine that is deliciously crisp with raspberry flavors and is nicely cut with acidity. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Brigando RosÃ© (Lisboa)

description: Syrah and Trincadeira, both known to be spicy, fit comfortably together in this generous, soft and fruity wine. Juicy black fruits and acidity come together with the tangy texture to produce a wine with an attractive pepper bite as well as great fruitiness. Drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Smart Dog Syrah-Trincadeira Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine is all about fruit. It is dry and so fresh and crisp with apple and green pear flavors. There is a light prickle there that adds a dancing lightness to this refreshing wine.
title: Quintas de MelgaÃ§o 2015 QM Terra Antiga White (Vinho Verde)

description: Baga has been softened by Merlot to produce a rounded wine, with accents of spice and generous tannins. Berry fruits come strongly through the dry core, giving a rich character to the wine. The finish is full of acidity and ripe red fruits.
designation: Quinta do Encontro Q do E
title: DÃ£o Sul 2012 Quinta do Encontro Q do E Red (Bairrada)

description: There is a crisp spring in this wineâ€” light and bright with great acidity and a touch of sweetness. It has a light prickle on the tongue that adds to the liveliness of this attractive wine.
title: Casca Wines 2016 Bote Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a soft wine with attractive ripe strawberry fruits and a soft texture. There is balancing acidity giving an edge of freshness to the otherwise gentle fruity texture.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Portuga RosÃ© (Lisboa)

description: Fresh and creamy, this is a smooth, rich wine. It has citrus and baked apple flavors that meld easily and fully into a fruity texture. With some weight, it also has a bright, crisp aftertaste.
title: Herdade Grande 2012 Audaz Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Very lemony, this is a crisp citrus- and peach-flavored wine. It has delicious, refreshing fruitiness that contrasts with a softer, rounded texture.  For drinking now and until 2018.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2012 Portal da Aguia Branco White (Tejo)

description: This is a smooth, clean, attractive wine that is bright and crisp. Lemon and pink grapefruit give the fine fruitiness while the acidity and lightly mineral texture add the structure. Drink now.
title: Terras de Alter 2015 Terra d'Alter SÃ­ria-Arinto-Viognier White (Alentejano)

description: This wine is fresh, fruity and crisp. It has delicious, young citrus flavors that are bursting with energy and life. Aromatic and textured, with mineral hints, this is a delicious, refreshing wine to drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2014 Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: Named after the Estrela mountain range that lies on the east of the DÃ£o, this structured, mineral-driven wine is firm yet packed with juicy red berries and currants that give a fragrant, juicy character. It needs more time, so drink from 2017.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2013 Jardim da Estrela Red (DÃ£o)

description: This blend of Encruzado and Malvasia Fina is both rich and perfumed. It has a smooth texture that is pointed up by apple and lemon acidity. There is a floral character to the bouquet, while the mouthfeel is ripe and full. The finish, with its textured acidity, promises aging, so drink from 2016.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2014 Jardim da Estrela Branco White (DÃ£o)

description: A lively, fresh, lightly sweet wine, with raspberry and caramel flavors. It is crisp, but soft with an easy balancing acidity.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2008 Espirito RosÃ© Red (Tejo)

description: An herbaceous, youthful wine that can be drunk immediately for its fresh, crisp fruits. It's light and bright.
title: Casa Cadaval 2013 Vinha Padre Pedro Branco White (Tejo)

description: This is a lightly structured wine with a soft juicy black-fruit character. It is smooth, rounded and with a crisp aftertaste from the acidity. It is ready to drink.
title: Adega Vila Real 2015 Colheita Red (Douro)

description: The vineyard is named for a 16th century archbishop whose jurisdiction in the Age of Discovery covered all lands discovered and to be discovered. This wine is soft with pear and peach fruit and light acidity. It is balanced and warm, its creamy texture giving an attractive roundness and smoothness. The wine is ready to drink.
designation: Dom Martinho by Quinta do Carmo
title: BacalhÃ´a Wines of Portugal 2016 Dom Martinho by Quinta do Carmo White (Alentejano)

description: A rich, fruity wine that's ready to drink now, especially with a barbecue. There are swathes of red fruits, light tannins and attractive juicy acidity. Drink this year.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2012 Loios Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a full-bodied, solid wine, dominated at this early stage in its development by tannins as well as black currant fruits. The wine is potentially warm, perfumed with truffles and spice. Age for a couple of years.
title: Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel 2010 Ciconia Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: From vineyards on the north bank of the Douro, this is a rounded, smooth wine that has layers of black fruits and finely integrated tannins. It is bold, ripe, full of blackberry fruitiness and a perfume from the Touriga Nacional in the blend. It is drinkable now, but will be better from the end of 2016.
title: Enoport 2014 Vilalva Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Soft and round, this is a wine that has the warmth of the Alentejo coupled with a tangy, fresh slice of lemon. Blending AntÃ£o Vaz, Roupeiro and Perrum, it's a wine to drink now, or just age for a few months.
title: Herdade do EsporÃ£o 2013 Monte Velho White (Alentejano)

description: Soft, warm and lightly tannic, this has an herbaceous character. Its fresh acidity balances its black currant flavor. It is fragrant, fruity and mature	 ready to drink.
title: Monte da Penha 2007 Montefino Red (Alentejano)

description: Fruity, juicy and packed with red berry fruit, this is an attractive, easy-drinking wine. It is rich, with good dense flavors that are balanced by raspberry-like acidity on the finish.
title: Caves Bonifacio 2009 Aragonez (Lisboa)

description: This is a soft, easy wine with the lightest texture and crisp apple and pear flavors. It is gentle and ready to drink.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Cabo da Roca White (Lisboa)

description: The mineral structure gives this wine an initially austere character. There is a balance between acidity and textured black-plum skin and berry fruit flavors. There are also firm, dry tannins that need to soften. Drink from 2017.
title: DÃ£o Sul 2013 Palestra Tinto Red (Douro)

description: The wine, a blend of AntÃ£o Vaz, Arinto and Siria, comes from Vidigueira, one of the cooler regions of the Alentejo. That gives the wine its crispness while also allowing it to have a ripe yellow-fruit character. With its spice and final crisp acidity, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Ribafreixo 2016 Pato Frio SelecÃ§Ã£o White (Alentejano)

description: Green plums and attractive spice combine in this easygoing wine. Its acidity and bright aftertaste emphasize its dry character and its place at the table. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2016 Casas White (Douro)

description: This wine is flavorful, with plenty of blackberry fruit, as well as a dense, tannic heart. The fruit's edges are smoothed by the wood aging, but it is still fruit that dominates, ripe, hearty and packed with acidity to finish.
title: Messias 2004 Quinta do CachÃ£o Touriga Franca (Douro)

description: Fresh and perfumed, this wine offers great citric flavors, a lively crispness rare in white wines from central Portugal. Pear and some yellow fruits give roundness.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2006 White (Ribatejo)

description: Aragonez, aka Tempranillo, here produces a ripe, juicy, red-fruit laden wine. Hedgerow fruits add a more stalky character to the palate. The whole wine is generously suffused with fresh acidity. Screwcap.
title: Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel 2011 Ciconia Aragonez (Alentejano)

description: This family-owned estate has produced an immediately attractive entry-level wine. Lightly spiced with wood, it blends Touriga Franca, Tinta Roriz and Tinta Barroca to show black fruit, ripe tannins and bright acidity. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Portal 2014 Muros de Vinha Red (Douro)

description: This wine shows shows characters of berry fruits and soft tannins, matched by juicy acidity. Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend gives the structure while Trincadeira and Aragonez provide the smooth fruits. Drink now.
title: Quinta Vale do Armo 2011 Valle ZangÃ£o Red (Tejo)

description: A blend of Loureiro, Arinto and Avesso, this light and fruity wine has an edge of prickle along with great acidity and citrus flavors. It is a great summer food wine. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines NV Cascas White (Vinho Verde)

description: A blend of Pinot Noir and Touriga Nacional, this is a smoothly ripe wine. Its cherry and spice flavors are given just a hint of structure built by a tannic edge. This soft juicy wine is ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Portada Winemaker's Selection RosÃ© (Lisboa)

description: Fruity and juicy, this wine has light tannins and red-berry flavors. It is an accessible wine, softly textured, ripe and ready to drink.
title: Manzwine 2014 PlatÃ³nico Red (Lisboa)

description: Produced from vines aged between 25 and 30 years old, this is a ripe yellow and citrus-flavored wine. It has a strongly mineral edge as well as crisp, tight fruitiness. With its structure and tension, it is likely to age further. Drink from late 2017.
title: Lavradores de Feitoria 2015 Branco White (Douro)

description: This is an attractive, warm, rounded wine. Yellow fruit flavors are cut with white fruit and acidity. It has a smooth, creamy texture that gives it extra richness. Drink now.
title: Valle da Fonte 2015 White (Douro)

description: This soft, yeasty and sweet blend of FernÃ£o Pires and Bical is fruity with apple and pear flavors. It has just enough acidity to keep it crisp on the finish and makes an easy apÃ©ritif.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo NV Plexus Branco Sparkling (Tejo)

description: This medium-sweet rosÃ© is a familiar style of local Portuguese wine. Fruity with raspberry flavor, it gives a slight a prickle on the tongue and has lively acidity. Drink now.
title: Caves Campelo 2015 Campelo RosÃ© (Vinho Verde)

description: This simple, ripe and fruity wine is destined for early drinking. It has rich dark plum fruits, a sprinkling of tannins and a fine juicy character. Very ready to drink now.
title: Caves AlianÃ§a 2010 Alabastro Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: A firmly tannic wine, bringing out its cool climate origin. But the wine does have weight and the potential for showing black fruits and dark-plum skins, as well as a dry character. Keep for another year.
title: Quinta de SÃ£o SebastiÃ£o 2010 Mina Velha Red (Lisboa)

description: This young, ripely fruity wine is made to be drunk quickly and easily. It has light tannins, plenty of red fruits and acidity. It is smoothly textured, with a crisp aftertaste.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Portada Winemaker's Selection Red (Lisboa)

description: Juicy, sweet fruited wine, with a ripe, jammy character allied to fresh acidity and soft tannins. With enticing raspberry flavors, the wine is for easy and early drinking.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2007 Espirito Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: A light, modern, just off-dry and fruity wine, freshened by bright lime and apricots, with a tang of orange zest. This is crisp, very clean, a good apÃ©ritif drink.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2008 Espirito Branco White (Tejo)

description: A blend of four Vinho Verde grapes, this dry wine is crisp and spicy, with an herbal character. It has bright fruitiness, plenty of acidity and a crisp, tight, mineral aftertaste.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2016 White (Vinho Verde)

description: This wine is all fruit. Its black-currant flavors and attractive acidity come from a blend that is dominated by Tinta Roriz, Touriga Franca and Tinta Barroca. It has minerality and a dry edge, although its fruitiness means it is ready to drink.
title: Delaforce 2015 Red (Douro)

description: This wine is produced from organically grown grapes. It is aged in tank, giving a wine that is all blackberry fruit with a crisp texture as well as generous tannins. With touches of DÃ£o minerality, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Global Wines 2013 Cabriz Biologico Organic Red (DÃ£o)

description: A ripe, soft wine that represents great drinking value. The fruit is fresh and easy, with light tannins and acidity. This is juicy, full of red fruits and touched by a light element of wood.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2005 Cister da Ribeira Red (Douro)

description: Soft and light, with good black plum and fig flavors. There's a touch of spice, but this is lively, juicy and fresh.
designation: The Cork Grove Shiraz and CastelÃ£o
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2004 The Cork Grove Shiraz and CastelÃ£o Red (Ribatejano)

description: Palmela is the region just south of Lisbon, producing light, fresh wines that are both great values and great everyday drinking. The strawberry fruit flavors are immediately appealing, freshened by the acidity.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2000 Pegos Claros CastelÃ£o (Palmela)

description: Light-textured wine, with its berry fruits dominant. Hints of wood aging balance with fruit tannins and acidity. Very accessible, the finish earthy and rustic.
title: Alente 2007 Red (Alentejo)

description: A wine with great juicy swathes of fruit that combine well with the natural structure of the DÃ£o. It is textured and firmly tannic, with delicious black fruits coming through. It's ready to drink, but will certainly benefit from 1â€“2 years' aging.
title: Caves AlianÃ§a 2010 AlianÃ§a Reserva Red (DÃ£o)

description: This wine is soft and creamy with melon and green apple flavors. Light, fruity and crisp, it is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Bonavita White (Lisboa)

description: Named in tribute to the many wine rivers of Portugal (Foz means estuary), this generous, fruity and soft wine is quite ready to drink. It is smooth with black fruits and light tannins well balanced and cut by acidity.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2013 F'Oz Red (Alentejano)

description: A cherry-pink-colored wine, soft and full-bodied. Flavors are of wild strawberries, red cherry with a touch of pepper. The wine feels fat, missing acidity.
title: PaxÃ¡ Wines 2009 PaxÃ¡ RosÃ© (Algarve)

description: With what seems a stylistic change, this 2005 version of Periquita is firm, tannic, structured, with dark fruits and plenty of dry tannins. It is impressive for a big brand, dark and concentrated.
title: JosÃ© Maria da Fonseca 2005 Periquita Red (Terras do Sado)

description: A ripe, juicy and fruity wine that has attractive black currant aromas, lively acidity on the palate and a light, bright feel. With open berry fruits, this wine is ready to drink.
title: Pinhal da Torre 2010 Quinta do Alqueve Tradicional Red (Tejo)

description: A single-vineyard wine from property owned by the Messias family, this is structured and packed full of tannins. A chocolate and spice character partners with the red fruits and acidity. It is ready to drink.
title: Messias 2014 Quinta do CachÃ£o Red (Douro)

description: Coming from the series of single-varietal wines produced by this estate, this wine adds a southern warmth to the crispness and elegant green-fruit flavors of the Alvarinho. It is tangy, hinting at minerality and with a zesty aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2016 Alvarinho (Tejo)

description: A ripe and perfumed wine, this is well structured with a touch of crisp minerality as well as melon and peach fruits. It is smooth, balanced and ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2016 Verdelho (Tejo)

description: Elegant and smooth with just a touch of wood and vanilla to bring out the blueberry fruit flavors. It's deliciously perfumed with soft tannins and a gentle, fruity aftertaste.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2010 Quartilho Red (Tejo)

description: 15% Alicante Bouschet gives this wine its dark color and rich, plummy texture. It has weight, ripe, bold fruit and soft tannins and is ready to drink.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2015 Portas da Herdade Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: From high-altitude vineyards, this is a crisp wine with fine acidity and white fruits. Light, bright and deliciously fruity it has a tangy, very drinkable aftertaste.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2015 Lab Branco White (Douro)

description: Fresh green plum, apricot and pears freshen this light, soft wine, clean, crisp and finishing with lime juice.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2008 Forgotten Field White (Estremadura)

description: Soft and fruity, this easy-drinking, ripe wine has soft tannins, plenty of acidity from the red berry fruits, and a light-bodied character. Drink now, although it will be best from 2016.
title: Perescuma 2013 Terra Brava Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a light, fruity wine with fresh red berry flavors and soft tannins. It has a cool feel from the nearby Atlantic Ocean, giving a bright, character and a wine that's ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Quinta de Bons-Ventos Red (Lisboa)

description: Spanish producer Vicente Gandia continues its venture into Portugal with this ripe, spicy and toasty wine. Wood flavors mingle with the red fruits and bright acidity. It is rich, full and ready to drink.
title: Vicente Gandia 2013 BoÃ¢brisa Red (Alentejo)

description: This is a fruity but also structured blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Alicante Bouschet and Touriga Nacional. It's full of red fruit, dusty tannins with a dry core and balancing acidity. Drink until 2020.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2011 Pancas Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a crisp, fresh wine. It has attractive red fruits that are cut by juicy lemons. The touch of caramel in this blend of Syrah and Touriga Nacional is lit by the acidity and spiced by a final touch of pepper.
title: Falua 2015 Tagus Creek RosÃ© (Tejo)

description: Ripe and rich, it's full of tropical fruit, pineapple and mango flavors. Fresh acidity balances the full fruitiness. The aftertaste brings out a more mineral character.
title: Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel 2013 Ciconia Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This is a light and fruity wine from J. Portugal Ramos. It's crisp, with lemon and citrus flavor, and bright with grapefruit acidity. Drink now and over the next year.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2012 Loios Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Smooth caramel and raspberry flavored wine, with a fat, full texture. The wine misses out on fresh acidity, but certainly has ripe fruit richness.
title: BacalhÃ´a Wines of Portugal 2008 Serras de AzeitÃ£o White (Terras do Sado)

description: Fresh green plum, apricot and pears freshen this light, soft wine, clean, crisp and finishing with lime juice.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2008 Forgotten Field White (Estremadura)

description: Fresh and fruity, this wine is full of generous red berry fruits. It is soft, open and ripe. With both Touriga Nacional and Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend, it does have some structure, just there to support the fruitiness of the wine. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Portas de Lisboa Red (Lisboa)

description: A mineral, dry wine, relatively light but still packing plenty of firm red fruits, solid tannins and a dry core. It could age for 2â€“3 years	 with its fresh aftertaste, this is already a great food wine.
title: Castello d'Alba 2005 Colheita Red (Douro)

description: This light and fruity wine has fresh acidity as well as lemon and ripe pear fruits. It is soft, smooth, and with a creamy texture, is very ready to drink.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2015 Ciconia Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This wine is dry, full and brimming with ripe red-berry fruits. A blend of Syrah and Touriga Nacional, it has a rich character that gives the wine more weight than freshness. Drink now.
title: Falua 2014 Tagus Creek RosÃ© (Tejo)

description: This is a fruity, crisp wine with an attractive balance between acidity and sweetness. Ripe strawberries give the fruit flavor while the acidity at the light prickle on the palate add a crisper aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Viniverde 2015 Alto Lima RosÃ© (Vinho Verde)

description: Red-cherry flavors dominate this soft fruity wine. It is aromatic, full of ripe fruitiness and with just the right touch of acidity. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Cascas Winemaker Selection RosÃ© (Douro)

description: This is a ripe, wood-aged wine that is rich with dark plum and ripe berry tones. Its big, bold character is primary and a far cry from subtle. Drink now.
title: Ribafreixo 2012 BarrancÃ´a Red (Alentejano)

description: A wine made in memory of Catherine (Caterina) of BraganÃ§a, a Portuguese princess who married Charles II of England in the 17th century. It is a superripe wine, full of tropical fruit flavors and only the lightest of acidity. Wood aging gives the wine a plush character and suggests it could age for another year. Drink from 2016.
title: BacalhÃ´a Wines of Portugal 2013 Catarina Chardonnay (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: Syrah performs well in the hot, dry climate of Alentejo. This is a perfumed wine, richly tannic although the tannins are cushioned by the red fruits, spice and fresh acidity. It is ready to drink now.
title: Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel 2013 Ciconia Syrah (Alentejano)

description: Named after a local order of monks in the Middle Ages, the wine is rounded and easy. The gentle fruitiness gives the wine a zing of acidity. That's balanced by the open and smooth texture and flavors of creamed apple. Drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Loios Branco White (Alentejano)

description: A blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah, this rosÃ© gives ripe red fruits that are cut with lively acidity. There is a jammy, caramel-flavored backdrop to this wine that makes it heavy rather than fresh. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Terra de Lobos RosÃ© (Tejo)

description: A stylish wine, with mineral tannins and a dusty texture. It is cool, elegant and with a tight layer of acidity. There's plenty of firm structure, with berries and sweet fruit to finish. Age for 2â€“3 years.
title: Falua 2009 Red (Tejo)

description: This is a dense wine with firm tannins and a solid structure. The black currant fruits are stalky and still developing, along with the acidity. It's a lean wine and needs to age for a few more months to fill out, so drink from 2017.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2013 Maria Mora Red (Alentejano)

description: A bright pink wine that tastes drier than it looks. It has bright strawberry aromas, as well as touches of caramel and lively final acidity. It's not for aging.
title: Casa da Passarella 2012 Somontes RosÃ© (DÃ£o)

description: As crisp as possible, this is a light, strawberry fruited wine with balanced acidity and a fresh, delicious aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 RosÃ© (Tejo)

description: Fresh and ripe, packed with red berry fruits, this is a young and fruity wine that is perfect to drink right away. It's light, bright and refreshing.
title: Herdade do EsporÃ£o 2015 Alandra RosÃ© (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: A smooth wine, feeling light in style, with a touch of acidity to go with the gentle tannins. It is now quite ready to drink, easy and approachable.
title: Caves AlianÃ§a 2008 Vista Tinto Tinta Roriz (Beiras)

description: A generous wine that still manages to keep elegance and style. It offers black, juicy fruits that are blended with the spice from wood aging. There are blackberries, plenty of acidity and a dry but always fruity aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
title: Vilalva 2013 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This ripe, bold wine is rich in black fruits. They cushion the naturally prominent tannins of Cabernet Sauvignon and Touriga Nacional that form part of the blend. It is a solid effort, juicy and ready to drink.
title: Perescuma 2014 Terra Brava Red (Alentejano)

description: With its flamboyant aromas of oranges, tangerines and apricots, this screams â€œMuscatâ€ at the top of its lungs. The plump flavors of tropical and citrus fruits make it easy to like and easy to drink. Great as an apÃ©ritif.
title: JoÃ£o Pires 2001 Muscat of Alexandria Muscat (Terras do Sado)

description: The Arinto grape and the town of Bucelas go together. This small enclave in the larger Lisboa region produces this crisp fruity style, like a southern version of dry Vinho Verde but with extra weight. Drink this attractive, lemon and red-apple flavored wine now.
title: Caves Velhas 2016 Arinto (Bucelas)

description: This is a finely made wine, fresh and crisp. It is dry but with a soft texture that turns it into a wine that's both good with food and as an apÃ©ritif. The aftertaste is crisp and still fruity.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Portugal Ramos RosÃ© (Vinho Verde)

description: From vines in the upper Douro valley, this is an intense wine that's still young. Its smooth, ripe black cherry fruits are followed by blueberry, spice from wood and bitter chocolate. This is a complex wine that finishes fresh.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2005 Fronteira Red (Douro)

description: This is an attractive wine that is crisp while also having a soft background texture. It is fruity, perfumed and balanced. Drink now.
title: Campelo 2014 Tres Castas White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is an aromatic wine with generous fruit and soft tannins. Its wood aging has given the wine extra richness as well as spice. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Alteza Red (Lisboa)

description: Named after an Arabic battle cry and now an expression that's shouted at wine festivals, the wine is lightly wood aged, ripe although with a stalky edge. It's easy and ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Conde 2016 Algazarra Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a strongly perfumed wine with a curious barnyard flavor that hides the fruitiness. This spoils the tangy texture and acidity that are there in the back.
title: Quinta de PaÃ§os 2016 FernÃ£o Pires (Minho)

description: Lightly perfumed, this is a simple, fruity wine that is ready to drink. It is floral, with a citrus flavor and a zesty aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Ribeirinha 2016 Rota de Cabral FernÃ£o Pires (Tejo)

description: This earthy wine has barnyard aromas and a rough edge. The redeeming feature is the juicy black-currant fruit that provides a crisp aftertaste.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2015 TerraÃ§os do Tejo Red (Tejo)

description: This wine has weight and considerable richness. Spice and an attractive perfume meld with the blackberry fruits and juicy acidity. The CastelÃ£o grape is at home in this region, which shows in the sense of terroir in this bold wine. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Fonte do Beco CastelÃ£o (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: A fruity blend of four local Alentejo grapes, this wine is soft and smoothly rich with fine acidity and a mix of yellow fruit and apple flavors. It has plenty of crisp acidity to bring out a lively aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Encostas de Estremoz 2016 DJ Branco White (Alentejano)

description: As always, Loios is a bright and fruity wine that is ready to drink young. With peach, grapefruit and red apple flavors, it's a soft wine with a crisp streak. It is ready to drink now and will be better at the end of 2014.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2013 Loios Branco White (Alentejano)

description: With the lightest, freshest tingle on the tongue, this is an off-dry wine that is crisp and fresh, combining citrus with sweetness. It is light-bodied, bright and ready to drink.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Lima 2014 Encostas do Lima White (Vinho Verde)

description: To the blend of local Aragonez and Trincadeira, the producer has added the DÃ£o's Alfrocheiro. That gives a ripe and attractively perfumed wine. It is soft and juicy, full of rich berry fruits and with a generous, warm texture. Drink now.
title: Herdade Grande 2014 Audaz Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This smooth, wood-aged wine is ripe with red fruits, soft tannins and a generous, full-bodied character. The acidity keeps the wine in shape, round and ready to drink.
title: Falua 2014 Conde Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Red (Tejo)

description: A ripe wine that is soft and fruity, this is juicy and with fine acidity. The quinta, situated at the western end of the Douro region, has produced a wine with light tannins and which has fine, ready to drink fruitiness.
title: Messias 2013 Quinta do CachÃ£o Red (Douro)

description: Pure Touriga Nacional, this is a crisp and fruity wine. Its red currants and light tannic structure give it shape and bring out the fruitiness that makes it immediately attractive. Ready to drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Brigando RosÃ© (Lisboa)

description: The wine is all about fresh fruit. Blackberry fruit jumps from the glass with its light tannins and lively acidity. The structure, with just a touch of dryness, is just right to support the boisterous fruit. Drink from 2017.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Cascas Winemaker Selection Red (Alentejano)

description: The cooperative of Reguengos is now a major force in the region. This wine, named after the hilltop town of Reguengos, is a powerful, condensed wine. It has dark black fruits, solid tannins and a smooth texture. Full-bodied and worth aging. Drink from 2015.
title: Cooperativa Reguengos de Monsaraz 2012 Reguengos Red (Alentejo)

description: Herbaceous and richly crisp, its acidity is tangy with mineral undertones and bright green- and white-fruit flavors. This is delicious and fruity, with a great final zing.
title: Duorum 2011 Tons de Duorum Branco White (Douro)

description: Named after a traditional Portuguese dance, the wine is full of red fruits, soft tannins with a rich texture. It is made to be drunk young, its red berry and red-currant fruits well integrated into the structure and acidity. Drink now.
title: Aveleda 2015 Charamba Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Firmly tannic, this wine is richly endowed with a solid structure and also with bold black fruits. It comes from the producer's main Douro vineyard. Concentrated and ripe, it will age and should be drunk from 2018.
title: Borges 2015 Quinta da Soalheira Red (Douro)

description: This wood-aged wine shows dark berry fruits and a dusty structure. That goes with the juicy fruitiness that is perfumed, fresh and spicy. The wine has a stalky aftertaste with plenty of acidity. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Cabra Cega Red (Lisboa)

description: The wine is smooth, soft and juicy. It has a fine balance, ripe with berry fruits and light with acidity and a easy-going texture. The oak aging has served to smooth any tannins, leaving a wine that is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Espiga Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a really soft wine with the minimum of tannins and the lightest fruit. It has just a hint of crisp, clean red berry fruits. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2016 Bons Ventos RosÃ© (Lisboa)

description: A single-vineyard wine from property owned by the Messias family, this is structured and packed full of tannins. A chocolate and spice character partners with the red fruits and acidity. It is ready to drink.
title: Messias 2014 Quinta do CachÃ£o Red (Douro)

description: Coming from the series of single-varietal wines produced by this estate, this wine adds a southern warmth to the crispness and elegant green-fruit flavors of the Alvarinho. It is tangy, hinting at minerality and with a zesty aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2016 Alvarinho (Tejo)

description: A ripe and perfumed wine, this is well structured with a touch of crisp minerality as well as melon and peach fruits. It is smooth, balanced and ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2016 Verdelho (Tejo)

description: The wine is all about fresh fruit. Blackberry fruit jumps from the glass with its light tannins and lively acidity. The structure, with just a touch of dryness, is just right to support the boisterous fruit. Drink from 2017.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Cascas Winemaker Selection Red (Alentejano)

description: An herbal wine, rather green in character and missing fruitiness. Structure and cherry fruits are there but lost in this green stalky character.
title: Casa Cadaval 2011 Vinha Padre Pedro Red (Tejo)

description: Ripe and smooth wine, with a rich Port-like aroma, the sweet fruit structured with some fresh stalky tannins. Great herbal and wild berry flavors to finish.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2008 Azul Portugal Red (Douro)

description: While it's fresh and creamy, as any Vinho Verde should be, there's something extra to this smooth wine. The tangy acidity is balanced by melon and apple flavors to give the wine some richness. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Barca 2013 Hera Grande Escolha Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: This is the entry-level wine from this Alvarinho specialist. A blend with Trajadura, it is crisp, light and bright. Tangy orange and lemon zest flavors give the wine its tight, lively acidity and refreshing aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Provam 2015 Varanda do Conde White (Vinho Verde)

description: Fresh black fruits give this wine a bright start in life. It is rich with some tannins and dark spice. Dominant berry-fruit flavors are balanced with acidity and a dry, firm aftertaste. Drink from the end of 2015.
title: Caves Velhas 2014 Romeira Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: A soft, clean, fruity wine, with spice and a fresh, aromatic character. The lemon and white fruit flavors are in an easy, apÃ©ritif style, with a lightly sweet aftertaste.
title: DÃ£o Sul 2008 Cabriz Colheita Seleccionada White (DÃ£o)

description: High-acid red wine is not for everyone, but this oneâ€”dry, stalky and lightâ€”is a genuine example of a wine that has always had a following in northern Portugal, great for pairing with fresh sardines. Think that way, and it's more than just a curiosity.
title: Caves Campelo 2015 Campelo Tinto Red (Vinho Verde)

description: Soft, light and fruity, this wine is ready for a warm day. Apple flavors and clean acidity balance its soft sweetness, making it ready to drink now. Intriguingly, its label resembles that of a much more familiar brand of Vinho Verde.
title: Caves Campelo 2015 Casal da Seara White (Vinho Verde)

description: There is a crisp spring in this wineâ€” light and bright with great acidity and a touch of sweetness. It has a light prickle on the tongue that adds to the liveliness of this attractive wine.
title: Casca Wines 2016 Bote Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: Perfumed and bright, this is an attractive blend that includes Pinot Noir and Syrah. With its ripe creamy texture and exuberant red fruits, the wine is ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Casa do Lago RosÃ© (Lisboa)

description: The Alicante Bouschet and CastelÃ£o in the blend give it its rich, immediately fruity character and dense color. Structure and concentration leave room for an elegant texture. Blackberry juiciness shines at the end. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Lobo e FalcÃ£o (Wolf and Falcon) Red (Tejo)

description: The Lapa vineyards are away from the Tagus (Tejo) river giving better structured soil and therefore firmer wines. That shows in this ripe wine with its tannins and bold fruits. It is attractively fruity, with a dry core. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2014 Selection Red (Tejo)

description: This attractive, soft and fresh wine is fruity, with red berry flavors, balanced acidity and warm tannins. With its light touch of spice, it is ready to drink.
title: JosÃ© Maria da Fonseca 2009 Periquita Red (Setubal)

description: Melon and ripe pear flavors give some richness to this lightly citrus flavored wine. With attractive acidity, it is crisp, clean and tangy at the end. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Cabo da Roca White (Douro)

description: A totally ready-to-drink wine that is full of bright red fruits and crisp acidity. It has some soft tannins and a dry edge, though the wine just bursts with fruit. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Brigando Red (Lisboa)

description: With pictures of violinists, this is obviously a musician's wine. The wine is soft, full of red berry fruits, and attractive bursts of acidity. Drink this crisp wine from 2017.
title: Perescuma 2015 Orquestra Red (Alentejano)

description: This is an attractive, fruity wine that has soft tannins and ripe fruit. Berry flavors and a full-bodied fruitiness are right up front, while the aftertaste has crisp acidity. Drink Now.
title: Perescuma 2015 Terra Brava Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine is soft and rounded. It has lemon and light spiciness along with cool acidity. It is an easy wine that is ripe with apple and fresh lemon juice and ready to drink.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2014 BarÃ£o de Figueira Branco Siria (Beira Interior)

description: The family-owned vineyard of Santar is run by DÃ£o Sul. This white has plenty of the mineral texture of the region, along with a rich, fruity character. Orange zest, refreshing acidity and bright pear and green-plum flavors come together. Drink from 2016.
title: DÃ£o Sul 2014 Casa de Santar Branco White (DÃ£o)

description: Textured and mineral, this crisp wine has some lively acidity as well as raspberry fruitiness. It's totally ready for the summer.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2013 Terra de Lobos RosÃ© (Tejo)

description: Attractively fruity, this is a crisp, citrus and green plum flavored wine. The tight texture gives a fresh character that also has some minerality. Lively and bright at the end.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2013 Portal da Aguia White (Tejo)

description: This is an earthy blend of Touriga Nacional, Jaen and Trincadeira. Unencumbered by wood aromas, it's full of structured red berry fruit and balanced acidity and is ready to drink.
title: Boas Quintas 2014 Encosta da Vinha Red (DÃ£o)

description: Made to be drunk young, this wine gives a burst of ripe red fruit. The tannins are soft and open, balanced with acidity. The aftertaste is smooth and generous. Drink now.
title: Casa Santa VitÃ³ria 2015 VersÃ¡til Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: With its typical prickle on the tongue, this is a medium sweet wine. It's clean, crisp and citrusy, with sliced apple and orange zest flavors. Drink now.
title: Caves Campelo 2015 Campelo White (Vinho Verde)

description: According to legend, the Baron of Figuiera got his foot stuck in the stirrup while riding one day. He promised that where his horse stopped, he would build a chapel, and that's where this 2,100 foot high, cool-climate vineyard is today. The wine is crisp and fresh, with attractive citrus notes and plenty of refreshing acidity. Drink now.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2015 BarÃ£o de Figueira Branco Siria (Beira Interior)

description: This is a lightweight, fruity and softly tannic wine. The red berry flavor is bright and breezy, and the acidity is a dominant feature. Screwcap.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Brigando Red (Lisboa)

description: A wine for early drinking, this is soft, fruity and bright. With red berry flavor and gentle tannins, it's direct and packed with fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Herdade do EsporÃ£o 2015 PÃ© Tinto Red (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: Just off-dry, this is a smooth, caramel and red fruit flavored wine. It has plenty of acidity to balance its soft texture, with red currant freshness coming in at the end. Drink now.
title: JosÃ© Maria da Fonseca 2014 Periquita RosÃ© (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: A blend of Arinto and AntÃ£o Vaz, this is refreshingly fruity. It has pineapple as well as citrus flavors, an attractive blend of freshness and crispness. The aftertaste is bright, full of lively acidity.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2014 Maria Mora Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Ripe and perfumed, this has great fruitiness and crisp acidity that suit the delicate texture. The wine is completely ready to drink.
title: Pedra Cancela 2013 SeleÃ§Ã£o do EnÃ³logo White (DÃ£o)

description: This wine has weight and considerable richness. Spice and an attractive perfume meld with the blackberry fruits and juicy acidity. The CastelÃ£o grape is at home in this region, which shows in the sense of terroir in this bold wine. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Fonte do Beco CastelÃ£o (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: This is a very crisp wine dominated by herbaceous notes and intense acidity. It is bright and lively, hinting at spice and toast and tantalizingly fresh on the finish.
title: Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel 2010 Colheita Seleccionada White (Alentejano)

description: Round and smooth, this has a weighty, full-bodied structure, with the Alvarinho adding a more crisp character. Pear and melon fruits are balanced by citrusy acidity.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 DFJ Alvarinho-Chardonnay White (Lisboa)

description: This soft, balanced selection has warm, ripe red fruits that are laced with acidity. With its spicy edge and open texture, this is ready to drink now.
title: Herdade do EsporÃ£o 2011 Monte Velho Red (Alentejano)

description: Attractive fruits with a good, juicy flavor characterize this easy, fresh wine. Black berry flavors and vivid acidity make it ready to drink now.
title: BacalhÃ´a Wines of Portugal 2009 Serras de AzeitÃ£o Red (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: With its earthy aromas and soft palate, this is a rustic wine, the sort designed for pairing with grilled meat. It has black plum flavors along with spice and bright red fruits. Drink now.
title: Falua 2009 TÃ¢mara Red (Tejo)

description: This fresh wine shows fruit tones balanced by a light mineral note. It is bright with acidity and grapefruit flavors alongside a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Campelo 2014 Miranda White (Vinho Verde)

description: Produced in the Lima Valley, in the heart of the Vinho Verde region, this is fruity and crisp. It is medium sweet in character, the sweetness balanced by the refreshing acidity and citrus flavors. Drink now.
title: Viniverde 2015 Alto Lima White (Vinho Verde)

description: With partial aging in wood, this is a spicy, smoky wine that is also full of ripe red fruits. Its well-integrated tannins give shape to this wine. A crisp finish and the wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Credencial Red (Lisboa)

description: This ripe wine is smooth and rounded. Its melon and pear flavors give a generous, fruity character. Clean and crisp at the end, finished with acidity, it is ready to drink.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2015 Castello d'Alba Colheita Branco White (Douro)

description: Ripe, fruity wine with quince and pineapple flavors, layered through with apple skin tannins. It could do with six months aging, but it will certainly be ready to drink by the fall.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2007 Cister da Ribeira White (Douro)

description: This is a fruity, juicy wine that has a dry tanninc core. That gives a mineral texture to the otherwise ripe and fruity wine. Full of black currant fruit flavors, shot through with acidity, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa da Passarella 2012 Somontes Colheita Red (DÃ£o)

description: This wine is light in tannins and ripe in fruit, with a delicious red-berry character. Drink this attractive wine from 2019.
title: Quinta dos Avidagos 2015 Lote 138 Red (Douro)

description: A soft, lightly sweet style of rosÃ©, flavored with strawberries and a touch of caramel. Fresh, and flavorful, with balancing acidity, this is a good apÃ©ritif wine.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2006 Touriga Nacional (Ribatejano)

description: A blend of Arinto and Tamarez, this wine is light and fruity, with attractive acidity and flavors of apricots sprayed with lemons. It has a light texture and a fresh, lively aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2014 Selection Branco White (Tejo)

description: Made from CastelÃ£o, the local grape of the SetÃºbal region, this wine is as bright and clean as possible. The light texture makes it ideal for summer drinking.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Azul Portugal RosÃ© (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: Crisp. dry and fruity, this wine has a light touch of citrus and fresh acidity. Fruity with a slight sparkle, it's an ideal apÃ©ritif.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Azul Portugal Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: An unexpected combination perhaps, but it works to give a fresh, flavorful wine, with soft tannins, juicy fruit and flavors of red cherries and vanilla. Not complex, and ready to drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2004 Tinta Roriz and Merlot Red (Estremadura)

description: Both mineral and herbaceous, this is a crisp, taut and textured wine. It shows a tangy character, lemon zest and bright acidity. It's still too young, so drink from the end of 2015.
title: Quinta da Rede 2013 Rede Branco White (Douro)

description: Arinto is the real local grape of the small city of Bucelas where this quinta is located. This fresh wine shows its light mineral and citrus character very well. It also brings out riper fruit flavors that fill it out and give it a rich character. The wine is ready to drink now.
title: Quinta da Romeira 2014 Prova RÃ©gia Arinto (Lisboa)

description: Both mineral and herbaceous, this is a crisp, taut and textured wine. It shows a tangy character, lemon zest and bright acidity. It's still too young, so drink from the end of 2015.
title: Quinta da Rede 2013 Rede Branco White (Douro)

description: This crisply fruity wine is primarily composed of the local Loureiro grape. It is light, bright, dry and full of citrus flavors. Drink now.
title: Vicente Faria Vinhos 2016 Animus Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: An instantly enjoyable, balanced rosÃ©. It's fresh, clean and full of red berry fruits, with a crisp finish. Drink now.
title: JosÃ© Maria da Fonseca 2013 Periquita RosÃ© (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: A wine that is so soft, its texture only just brushes the palate. White fruits and lemon juice give a gentle, balanced character that is light and quite ready to drink.
designation: Serras de AzeitÃ£o SeleÃ§Ã£o do EnÃ³logo Branco
title: BacalhÃ´a Wines of Portugal 2013 Serras de AzeitÃ£o SeleÃ§Ã£o do EnÃ³logo Branco White (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: Lively, light and easy on the palate, this is a celebratory sparkling wine. Apples give the fruity element of this medium-dry wine that has a lively prickle on the tongue. Drink now.
title: Aveleda NV Meio Seco Sparkling White Sparkling (Vinho Espumante)

description: The second wine from Duorum, the brand created by JoÃ£o Portugal Ramos and JosÃ© Soares Franco in 2007, this is ripe with tannin, black fruit and juicy acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Duorum 2015 Tons de Duorum Red (Douro)

description: Soft tannins and bright acidity give a wine that's ready to drink. Juicy red berry fruits dominate, with tannins just in the background.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2013 ChÃ£o das Rolas Red (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: The second label of Alorna, Portal da Aguia wines develop early. This bright and fruity red is based around soft tannins, very ripe fruits and a juicy, full-in-the-mouth texture. It needs little time to age, so drink from the end of 2014.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2011 Portal da Aguia Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Soft and ripe, this is a refreshing wine that has a dash of Moscatel in the blend to give a perfumed character. It is light in texture, very fruity and ready to drink.
title: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes 2014 Dona Helena Branco White (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)
winery: Cooperativa Agricola de Santo Isidro de Pegoes

description: An upfront, strawberry-flavored wine, this is ripe and immediately fruity. There are enough tannins to hold the palate together, but it is ready to drink now.
title: Quinta da Ribeirinha 2009 Vale de Lobos Red (Tejo)

description: Dominated by juicy CastelÃ£o, this lightly structured wine has fine tannins to propel the berry fruits up to the front. It is rich and full-bodied with a touch of pepper from the alcohol. The aftertaste brings out fresh acidity and softness.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Azul Portugal Red (Tejo)

description: Normally grown in the DÃ£o region, this grape needs poor soil to flourish. On its own, it makes a powerfully fruity wine packed with red fruits and some flavors of dark chocolate. The acidity is intense, and needs another few months to settle down.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2006 Alfrocheiro (Alentejano)

description: Made from 100% CastelÃ¢o, the local grape of SetÃºbal, this wine is attractively fruity, with a crisp texture. Warmer, ripe red-berry fruits contrast with the acidity, leaving a balanced wine that is ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Azul Portugal RosÃ© (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: Fast becoming one of the hallmark blends of Portugal, this 50-50 mix of Aragonez and Touriga Nacional is a seriously structured wine, with great wild fruit and mushroom flavors alongside dark, dry tannins. The acidity is very definite. A good food wine.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2006 Aragonez and Touriga Nacional Red (Alentejano)

description: This delicious and refreshing wine comes from the plateau above the Douro Valley, giving it a cool character along with a mineral and spice texture. The wine is perfumed from the 20% Moscatel in the blend. Drink now.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2016 Porca de MurÃ§a Branco White (Douro)

description: Soft, full-bodied wine. It has an oily, smooth sheen, with the flavors of pear and apricot just leavened by acidity. This is certainly a warm-climate white, designed for food rather than apÃ©ritif.
title: Cortes de Cima 2007 ChaminÃ© White (Alentejano)

description: It may be a second-rate grape in France, but in Portugal Alicante Bouschet has really come into its own. This is a ripe, smooth wine, with dark plum skin tannins, red peppers and intense concentrated spice. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2006 Alicante Bouschet (Alentejano)

description: Named after the boats that used to transport wine from the Douro vineyards to the cellars in Oporto, the wine is a smooth, ripe blend of Touriga Franca, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Nacional. It has rounded berry fruits and attractive acidity. Drink now.
title: Cap Wine 2014 Barco Negro Red (Douro)

description: This is an attractively perfumed wine with Malvasia Fina and Verdelho in the blend. It is tangy, crisp and with a lightly mineral texture. Drink this wine now.
title: Casa da Passarella 2015 Somontes Colheita Branco White (DÃ£o)

description: One of a pair of wines under the Grilos name, this DÃ£o is solid and tannic, still young, with a firm core of dryness surrounded by a more fruity black cherry component. It needs aging for a year.
title: DÃ£o Sul 2009 Grilos Red (DÃ£o)

description: Smooth and soft, this is a ripe, white-peach-flavored wine. It has an attractive tang of orange zest and a note of almond, and its bright acidity adds balance. With its fruitiness, it's ready to drink, but it will mature over 2â€“3 years.
title: Quinta da Ribeirinha 2010 Vale de Lobos Branco FernÃ£o Pires (Tejo)

description: Soft, smooth and fruity, this polished wine is full of red berry fruits and a touch of licorice. The juicy, ripe, immediately attractive aftertaste comes from the local CastelÃ£o grapes in the blend. Drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Monte da BaÃ­a Red (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: This is a bright, fruity wine, full of acidity and generous red fruit flavors with a soft texture. This will be ready to drink in a year.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2012 ChÃ£o das Rolas Red (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: From a single vineyard in Estremoz, this structured and dense wine houses notes of bitter chocolate and tart berry. It's full of tannins and needs time to soften. Drink from 2016.
title: BacalhÃ´a Wines of Portugal 2011 Dom Martinho Red (Alentejano)

description: Mainly Touriga Nacional with 30% Cabernet Sauvignon, this is a structured wine. The perfumes of the Touriga are balanced by the tannins of the Cabernet to give a wine that's dense and firmly full in the mouth. Wood-aged, it has stylishness and a good promise for aging. Drink from 2018.
designation: Follies Fonte Nossa Senhora da Vandoma
title: Aveleda 2011 Follies Fonte Nossa Senhora da Vandoma Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Bairrada)

description: Lightly wood aged, this wine is soft and creamy. It has a touch of spice as well as lively lemon and orange-zest flavors, with a crisp tang of acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Quinta do Gradil Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Named after the sea just across the hills from Chocapalha, this is a forward, attractively fruity wine. It is all about red fruits, light tannins, refreshing acidity and immediate drinkability.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2010 Mar de Lisboa Red (Lisboa)

description: Vines grown on sandy soil yield a wine that is accessible now. Full, soft and ripe with red berry fruits, the palate is marked by gentle tannins and an attractive burst of fruity acidity. Drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Dona Helena Colheita Tinto CastelÃ£o (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: This wine is firmly tannic, while promising fine fruitiness as it develops. The acidity and black fruits are about to break through the imposing tannic edifice. This wine will be best from 2017.
title: Aveleda 2013 Follies Nossa Senhora da Vandoma Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Bairrada)

description: This accessible, red-fruited wine has layers of fresh acidity, soft tannins and an immediate smoothness, with subtle hints of minerality. Lively acidity and fresh fruit flavors are left to linger on the finish.
title: Symington Family Estates 2012 Altano Red (Douro)

description: A smooth, creamed apple-wine, ripe and delicious. It has a sweet feel to it, the acidity just giving a bite. A great apÃ©ritif.
title: Campolargo 2010 Entre II Santos White (Bairrada)

description: Tight and mineral, this is firmly structured, a solid wine that speaks of the dark granite soil of the region. With vineyards against Portugal's highest mountain range, this is a dark, always dry and tannic wine.
title: Casa da Passarella 2011 Somontes Colheita Red (DÃ£o)

description: It may be a second-rate grape in France, but in Portugal Alicante Bouschet has really come into its own. This is a ripe, smooth wine, with dark plum skin tannins, red peppers and intense concentrated spice. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2006 Alicante Bouschet (Alentejano)

description: From a 34-acre vineyard on the high plateau above the Douro river, this wine is delicious, fruity and creamy. It has a crisp, fresh feel, light and bright while also full of ripe white fruits, apples and pears. Drink now.
title: CARM 2016 Vinha da Urze Branco White (Douro)

description: Ripe and tropical, this is a full wine that captures the warmth of the Alentejo. The acidity offers some freshness along with the citrus edge, but the fruits are much more tropical, rich in mango and lychee spice.
title: Herdade do EsporÃ£o 2007 Defesa White White (Alentejano)

description: A smoothly textured wine, with herb and black currant flavors, rounded by vanilla spice from wood. The aftertaste is tightly acid, but remaining rich. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2006 Red (Ribatejano)

description: This second wine from Duorum brings out ripe fruits, firm still young tannins and some concentrated acidity. It has touches of minerality along with bright red fruits and bold streaks of acidity. The wine is young although it is ready to drink now.
title: Duorum 2014 Tons de Duorum Red (Douro)

description: A cool, crisp and fresh wine that also has enough weight to go well with food. It has lively lemon, plum and red apple flavors. A touch of steely character lends great shape to this ready to drink wine.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Azul Portugal White (Tejo)

description: Viosinho and Viognier are the principal grapes in this blend. It is fresh and very crisp. Lively acidity with a lightly perfumed character and touches of apricot. Drink now.
title: JosÃ© Maria da Fonseca 2015 Periquita Branco White (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: This medium-sweet sparkling wine is soft and rounded. It has an attractive mousse, with some fresh acidity to give the sweetness a lift. The aftertaste is clean and fruity.
title: Aveleda NV Casal Garcia Medium Dry Sparkling (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a sweet sparkling wine that's based around the red grapes of Vinho Verde. It is light and fruity, surrounded by a ripe strawberry flavor and attractive acidity. Drink now.
title: Aveleda NV Casal Garcia RosÃ© Sparkling (Vinho Verde)

description: A big-hearted wine, displaying ripe red berries lifted by a lively acid undercurrent. It has gentle tannins and a full, juicy aftertaste. Drink now and enjoy with barbecue.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Brigando Red (Lisboa)

description: This is an open, soft and ready-to-drink wine. With red fruits, soft tannins and bright acidity that demands food, its warm, easy and approachable.
title: JosÃ© Maria da Fonseca 2013 Periquita Original Red (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: The local Beira grape, Maria Gomes, makes a star turn in this apricot and peach flavored wine. The ripe fruit is cut by fresh, crisp lime juice, adding crispness. A final tang of orange completes the picture.
title: Luis Pato 2013 Maria Gomes (Beira Atlantico)

description: A ripe and creamy blend of FernÃ£o Pires and Arinto, this is both fresh and richly textured. It has weight as well as a smooth texture, full in the mouth while also tangy. Already delicious, it will also age, so drink until 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Azul Portugal White (Tejo)

description: Fresh and lightly sparkling, this is a crisp, citrus-driven wine. Its acidity is just right, fruity while well integrated. Some sweetness at the end makes it fine for apÃ©ritif drinking.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2013 Grande Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: Rede is at the cooler western end of the Douro vineyards, known for its table wines rather than Ports. This ripe, toasty wine has a generous tannin and fruit structure. Red berry fruits dominate the texture, along with a lightly mineral character. The wine could age, so drink from 2016.
title: Quinta da Rede 2011 Rede Tinto Colheita Red (Douro)

description: This rich, delicious blend of CastelÃ£o and Alicante Bouschet is soft and juicy, with black and blue berry flavors, dusty tannins and a fine, jammy aftertaste.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2008 Catapereiro Red (Tejo)

description: Ripe and juicy, maybe a little rustic round the edges, certainly fruity. Red berry flavors dominate along with an edgy center of tannin, while juicy acidity completes this attractive wine.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2008 Samora Red (Tejo)

description: This attractive, fruity wine comes from vineyards in the Douro Superior region close to Spain. It is a fresh wine with red berry fruit flavors and bright acidity. It is still young although the fruitiness is enough to give a bright wine that is ready to drink now.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Castello d'Alba Red (Douro)

description: Produced from 100% Touriga Nacional, this is a crisp, dry wine, full of red-currant fruits and with a tang of citrus. This attractive wine is ready to drink.
title: CARM 2016 Vinha da Urze RosÃ© (Douro)

description: This soft, caramel flavored rosÃ© is produced from the native CastelÃ£o grape in coastal SetÃºbal south of Lisbon. With rounded red fruits and light acidity, it is dry and destined to pair with food.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Azul Portugal RosÃ© (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: A firmly tannic wine with a powerful structure, this is rich and well concentrated, with a solid character that supports the generous black fruits. Juicy and with good acidity at the end, the wine will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Caves Velhas 2015 Magna Carta Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Quinta da Lapa has plantings of the rare Tamarez grapes that have gone into the blend of this wine along with Arinto. It is perfumed, ripe and fruity with a touch of spice and citrus and yellow fruit flavors. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2014 Reserva Branco White (Tejo)

description: This is a perfumed wine that has just pure berry fruits, red plums and spice from tannins. There's no wood aging here, but the wine succeeds because of its delicious ripe fruits and balancing sweet acidity.
title: DÃ£o Sul 2006 Monte da Cal Red (Alentejano)

description: A ripe blend of fresh apple and lemon fruits give this wine is crisp, dry character. It is packed with acidity, orange and lemon zest and has a lively aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Raza 2015 Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: A rounded wine with spiced pear and citrus fruits, this is juicy and full bodied. A touch of textured minerality gives a sense of structure. It's still young and needs aging. Drink from 2015.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Grand'Arte Alvarinho (Lisboa)

description: A blend of two really local grapes, SÃ­ria and Fonte Cal, this is a fresh, mineral and citrus driven wine. It is so light and crisp with acidity that shoots though the wine. From high altitude vineyards, it has a refreshing, cool aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Beyra Branco Colheita White (Beira Interior)

description: A full-bodied, rich wine that combines extra juiciness with delicious red-berry fruits. It is structured while being immediately attractive. It's a great wine to go with pasta dishes.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2009 Portal da Aguia Red (Tejo)

description: This is a smooth, ripe wine with just enough tannin to give it structure. The main character is rich, full of black plums and blackberriesâ€”ripe and generous. It has a wonderful juicy aftertaste.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Great Bustard Red (Alentejano)

description: Produced from 100% Touriga Nacional, this is a crisp, dry wine, full of red-currant fruits and with a tang of citrus. This attractive wine is ready to drink.
title: CARM 2016 Vinha da Urze RosÃ© (Douro)

description: From a 34-acre vineyard on the high plateau above the Douro river, this wine is delicious, fruity and creamy. It has a crisp, fresh feel, light and bright while also full of ripe white fruits, apples and pears. Drink now.
title: CARM 2016 Vinha da Urze Branco White (Douro)

description: This lightly wood-aged wine is slightly austere in style, with plum and blackberry tones providing weight. Some tannins and acidity accompany its fine, fruity core, giving a more serious note to this wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Pedra Cancela 2010 SeleÃ§Ã£o do EnÃ³logo Red (DÃ£o)

description: Made from fruit that's sourced from the BuÃ§aco Mountains in the east of Bairrada, this wine is rich and elegant, and its juicy fruit provides a counterbalance to the structure. With its youthful fruitiness, this is worth aging for another 2â€“3 years.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2008 Azul Portugal Red (Bairrada)

description: A ripe blend of local Douro white grapes, this is attractively soft and fruity. It has a warm, creamy texture that encompasses the young fruits. With acidity and a crisp aftertaste, the wine is ready to develop for a few more months. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2016 Porrais Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a fruity wine showing a touch of wood aging alongside juicy red fruit flavors. A blend of Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Alicante Bouschet, this wine has a bright youthful color and fresh acidity at the end. Drink now.
