title: Quinta da Lapa 2013 Selection Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: While there is some bitterness in this wine, it also has forward black fruits and a great sense of juicy acidity. It needs a little time, so don't drink before 2016.
title: Herdade dos Coelheiros 2011 Vinha da Tapada Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a light wine with plenty of acidity and soft tannins that come together in a juicy, crisp, red fruit-flavored medley. Ready to drink.
title: Fiuza 2015 Oceanus Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon Red (Tejo)

description: With hints of minerality typical of any wine from the DÃ£o, this has tight, yeasty notes that contrast with its crisp, bright apple fruit. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2013 Cabriz Bruto Sparkling (DÃ£o)

description: A structured wine, this reflects the granite soil of the DÃ£o. Fruit from seven vineyards is blended to make this firm, tannin- and black-currant-driven selection. Perfumes from the Touriga Nacional lend lift to the finish.
title: Casa da Passarella 2009 Colheita Red (DÃ£o)

description: Named after the sea just across the hills from Chocapalha, this is a forward, attractively fruity wine. It is all about red fruits, light tannins, refreshing acidity and immediate drinkability.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2010 Mar de Lisboa Red (Lisboa)

description: The Moscatel in this blend gives an attractive floral perfumed character that balances the crisper FernÃ£o Pires. It is a fruity, light-hearted apÃ©ritif-style wine that is ready to drink.
title: BacalhÃ´a Wines of Portugal 2013 JP AzeitÃ£o Branco White (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: Attractive and fruity, this is bright and crisp. It does have some weight and a backdrop of ripe strawberries. But it's the fresh acidity that gives lift and freshness. Drink now.
title: Casa da Passarella 2013 Somontes RosÃ© (DÃ£o)

description: A firmly tannic wine with a powerful structure, this is rich and well concentrated, with a solid character that supports the generous black fruits. Juicy and with good acidity at the end, the wine will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Caves Velhas 2015 Magna Carta Reserva Red (Douro)

description: An elegant, understated wine that shows balanced red fruits, vanilla and touches of chocolate. Its attractiveness lies in the balance, with structure and acidity keeping the exuberant fruit flavors in check. Worth aging for 1â€“2 years.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2005 Palha-Canas Red (Estremadura)

description: With its light prickle on the tongue, this is as fresh as possible. It's clean, packed with green and citrus fruits, and boosted with some textured richness. Drink at once.
title: Solar de Pinheiro 2012 PaÃ§o de SÃ£o LourenÃ§o White (Vinho Verde)

description: This raspberry-flavored wine is soft and ripe. While it is fruity, it also has a nutty character that gives it a rich taste. It's dry and in a style that will make it better with food than by itself.
designation: Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte de BaÃ­a
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte de BaÃ­a RosÃ© (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: The grape is local to the Vidigueira region of the southern Alentejo. Coming from cool vineyards, the wine has a fresh character that is balanced by the ripe melon and juicy pear fruits. It has a crisper end and is ready to drink.
title: Ribafreixo 2015 Pato Frio AntÃ£o Vaz (Alentejo)

description: A ripe and structured wine, this has bold black fruits and balanced tannins that still need to soften. It has good potential with rich fruits and a tight mineral texture. Drink from 2018.
title: Sobredos 2012 Aneto Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This is crisp and fresh medium-sweet wine. It is bright with red-currant acidity and ripe with a strawberry and cream flavor. The wine is clean, lively and, of course, ready to drink.
title: Aveleda NV Casal Garcia RosÃ© Sparkling (Vinho Verde)

description: The blend of FernÃ£o Pires and Arinto is a classic for the region. It gives a light and perfumed wine with a creamy texture and plenty of balancing acidity. Bright and fruity, the wine has just a final tang to add crispness. Drink now.
designation: Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte da BaÃ­a Branco
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte da BaÃ­a Branco White (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: A light, crisp blend of Merlot and Syrah, this is soft and gently fruity. Raspberry and red-currant flavors shine easily through this simple wine.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Samora RosÃ© (Tejo)

description: Tinta MiÃºda, known as the rare Graciano grape in Spain, is not often found in Portugal. Here it makes a ripe, juicy and jammy wine that's soft, with only a minimum of tannins to keep it together. It has a typically warm character and is ready to drink.
title: Fiuza 2015 Tinta MiÃºda Red (Tejo)

description: Named after local nobility in the city of Borba, this is a popular brand in Portugal. In its white manifestation, the wine is soft, very clean, with pear and cinnamon flavors, the texture just moving toward fat, but working well as a food wine.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2006 MarquÃªs de Borba White (Alentejo)

description: This simple, open and fruity wine has gentle tannins. It is all about ripe berries and acidity. Made to be drunk young for its fruitiness, it is ready now.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2015 Beyra Colheita Red (Beira Interior)

description: From vines grown in the upper Douro Superior, this is crisp while also having ripe apple and apricot fruitiness. It is a lively wine, tangy with orange zest and a touch of spice. Drink now.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2016 Castello d'Alba Branco White (Douro)

description: Yellow fruits and apple juice combine in this fresh, mineral-driven wine. It's tangy, tight with acidity while allowing room for pineapple and tropical flavors at the end. It's ready to drink but will be better in 2016.
designation: Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Album
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Album AntÃ£o Vaz (Alentejano)

description: There is an attractive, light prickle on the tongue of this fresh, crisp and fruity wine. It is dry, tensely tangy with a green, zesty character. Drink now.
title: Wine with Spirit 2014 Seafood & Co White (Vinho Verde)

description: In this blend of Shiraz and Trincadeira, both grapes contribute red fruits, soft tannins and fresh-faced acidity. With no complicationsâ€”just bright, juicy fruitâ€”the wine is ready to drink.
title: Falua 2013 Tagus Creek Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This blend of this wine is popular in Alentejo with Syrah now part of the repertoire. The wine is warm, with a ripe character and a sunny feel. Its structure and acidity keep the wine balanced. Drink now.
title: Falua 2014 Tagus Creek Shiraz-Trincadeira Red (Alentejano)

description: A fresh-faced wine, bright with berry fruits, a light layer of tannins and a soft, easy texture. There is some stalkiness but this is great as a delicious, easy wine.
title: Cortes de Cima 2009 ChaminÃ© Red (Alentejano)

description: Lemon and freshly squeezed lime give this attractive wine a crisp, bright texture that is rounded out at the end with perfumed flavors from the Moscatel in the blend. This fruity, textured wine needs a few more months before drinking. Drink from late 2015.
title: Duorum 2014 Tons de Duorum White (Douro)

description: Arintoâ€”the signature white grape of Lisboa â€”makes this crisp wine that's tangy, zesty and alive with citrus fruitiness. It is a delicious white to drink young.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2015 Arinto (Lisboa)

description: This blend of Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon is surprisingly soft and ripe, considering the tannic nature of the grapes. Instead it has fruity black currant flavors and plenty of forward acidity. Ready to drink now, its tannins just form the background.
title: Fiuza 2015 3 Castas Red (Tejo)

description: Made from CastelÃ£o grapes, this crisp wine has red fruits that burst out of the glass and give a lively aftertaste, with tight acidity. Drink now.
title: Manzwine 2015 RosÃ© (Lisboa)

description: The Reserva version of Mural makes a powerful statement. Dark in color and packed with concentrated fruit, it is full of tannins as well as brooding black-plum flavors. Spice and juicy acidity complete the ensemble. It's a solid wine that needs to age to soften the tannic structure. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta do Portal 2011 Mural Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is an attractive wine, dominated by the typical Baga grape from Bairrada. Its tannins are tamed and rounded out producing rich black fruits and fine balanced acidity. The wine is ready to drink, although it will be even better from 2017.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Azul Portugal Red (Bairrada)

description: Earthy, youthful aromas lead to a wine that's ripe while still finding its fruity character. The potential for the citrus and apricot flavors is there and should develop by mid-2015.
title: Quevedo 2013 Oscar's Branco White (Douro)

description: Grown in high-elevation vineyards at 1,800 feet, this crisp white is a blend of five of the familiar Douro varieties, emphasizing brightness as well as soft fruitiness. Its acidity and white stone-fruit flavors are already well integrated, giving a balanced, lightly mineral wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2016 Sete Vales Branco White (Douro)

description: The wine is juicy and rich. Its soft texture comes from fermentation in tanks that recycle CO2 to give a gentle extraction. The result is rounded, smooth, full of black fruits and with plenty of crisp acidity to finish.
title: Quinta do PÃ´pa 2015 Contos da Terra Red (Douro)

description: Aged for two years in wood, this ripe wine is rich and structured. It has the firm tannins and minerality typical of the DÃ£o while also having balanced fruit and acidity. It is firm, although ripe, and ready to drink.
title: Borges 2013 Reserva Tinto Red (DÃ£o)

description: This is a soft and fruity wine that is full of red berries and balanced acidity. It has some tannins, while wood aging has given extra richness. The finish is fresh, bright and juicy. Drink from 2016.
title: Falua 2013 Conde de Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Red (Tejo)

description: This wine is produced from two of the quintas owned by Ramos-Pinto. It's fruity and crisp, packed with bright fruit and lively acidity, and finishes on tangy citrus with a riper, creamy texture. Drink from late 2017.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2015 Duas Quintas Branco White (Douro)

description: The local Baga grape, better known for producing structured red wines, also lends itself to fruity sparkling rosÃ©. Bright acidity gives this crisp wine its tangy, red currant character. Drink now.
title: Adega de Cantanhede NV MarquÃªs de Marialva RosÃ© Bruto Baga (Beira Atlantico)

description: A sweet rosÃ© that is light and fresh from the crisp raspberry acidity. It is bright and fruity, ready to drink.
title: Quintas de MelgaÃ§o 2014 Lagar RosÃ© (Vinho Verde)

description: With some earthy, rustic flavors the wine seems to have missed out on some of its fruit. It is more about structure and firm tannins with only hints of juicy fruit behind.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Monta da BaÃ­a Red (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: Rich, smooth, with great wafts of creaminess to go with a judicious amount of toast. White plum and pear flavors precede a finish with impressive concentration and delicious acidity.
title: BacalhÃ´a Wines of Portugal 2009 Catarina White (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: This is a spicy wine that is full of juicy red-berry fruit notes. It is soft and gentle, with a core of dry tannins that gives the wine structure. Young and fruity, it is ready to drink, but will also age. Drink until 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Companhia das LezÃ­rias Catapereiro Red (Tejo)

description: In praise in the Loureiro grape, this dry wine has lively acidity while also having a ripe full texture of apples and pink grapefruit. The wine is crisp and intensely fruity. Drink now and until early 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Maria Bonita Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: This rich blend of Alicante Bouschet, Touriga Nacional and Alfrocheiro is all fruit without any oak aging. That gives the wine a ripe black-fruit character, balanced with acidity and a light touch of spice. Drink this attractive wine now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Pouca Roupa Red (Alentejano)

description: This dry rosÃ© is made, as are most of the wines from this producer, from Merlot. It gives a soft, smooth and lightly caramel flavored wine though with plenty of acidity to keep it crisp. Drink this wine now.
title: Nelson Neves 2016 Neves Colheita Merlot RosÃ© (Bairrada)

description: A classic Douro blend of Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz makes a harmonious wine that has ripe berry fruits and a soft structure. It is a stylish wine with a fresh fruity aftertaste. Drink now.
designation: Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Colleja
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Colleja Red (Douro)

description: This is big, ripe, chocolate and dark-fruit flavored wine that shows concentrated tannins and dense wood. Blackberry tones are starting to push through to give this impressive wine balance and a serious future. Drink from 2017.
title: Caves Velhas 2013 Romeira Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This oak-aged blend of Malvasia, FernÃ£o Pires and Viosinho is soft with light green and citrus fruits. There is a creamy texture as well as a touch of spice from the wood. Drink this now.
title: Adega Vila Real 2016 Reserva White (Douro)

description: A fresh, fruity wine that also has some richness. With flavors of peach, canned pineapple, and a touch of greener herbaceousness, it's balanced and rounded. Wait until late 2014 before drinking.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Herdade de Catapereiro White (Tejo)

description: Just lightly structured, this is a delicious, fruity wine. With soft tannins and rounded black fruits, it's fresh and fragrant. Wood flavors support the fruitiness. Full-bodied and ripe, it's ready to drink.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2012 Pancas Red (Lisboa)

description: A smooth and fruity wine that has soft tannins and a rich, juicy character. It is full of damson and black plum fruits, ripe and jammy at the end. Drink now.
title: BarÃ£o de Vilar 2012 Red (Douro)

description: With the smooth Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz making up the body of this ripe wine, it has a generous, fruity character. The tannins are a support to this fine fruit and rich aftertaste. Drink this young wine now for its fruit or wait until 2018 for it to soften and round.
title: Casa de Cambres 2015 Colheita Red (Douro)

description: Everything is in place in this structured wine that's packed with big berry fruits that give a delicious succulence. At the same time, the tannins offer richness and concentration. It's almost ready to drink.
designation: Quinta de SÃ£o JoÃ£o CuvÃ©e RB
title: Pinhal da Torre 2010 Quinta de SÃ£o JoÃ£o CuvÃ©e RB Red (Tejo)

description: While the Arinto is normally found further south in Lisboa, this wine comes from vines that have the same ocean influence. That keeps it fresh even through the oak aging, so the wine is both rich, toasty and cut with attractive citrus acidity. This one is still young and will be better from 2017, although it is ready to drink now.
title: Adega de Cantanhede 2014 MarquÃªs de Marialva Reserva Arinto (Bairrada)

description: Fruity and aromatic, this blend of FernÃ£o Pires, Arinto and Sauvignon Blanc is fresh with attractive acidity and also riper tropical fruit and pear flavors. It has a mineral texture that gives the a fine structure. Drink now.
designation: Companhia das LezÃ­rias Herdade de Catapereiro
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Companhia das LezÃ­rias Herdade de Catapereiro White (Tejo)

description: The wine is ripe and perfumed. It suffers from high alcohol that comes through in the peppery edge to the otherwise full-bodied black fruits. The wine is balanced, now mature and with an intense juicy aftertaste.
title: Marcolino Sebo 2012 QP Syrah (Alentejano)

description: This is a soft, fruity and lightly crisp wine. It has citrus and warm yellow-fruit flavors and tangy orange peel acidity. Drink this fresh and light wine now.
title: Cortes de Cima 2014 ChaminÃ© White (Alentejano)

description: This simple, ripe and fruity wine is soft and juicy. Its red fruits, balanced acidity and blend of Trincadeira and AragonÃ¢s are totally ready for instant drinking.
title: Herdade do EsporÃ£o 2016 Monte Velho Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a rich wine, full of dark fruits and generous tannins. It has swathes of spice as well as the firm black-plum-skin and blackberry flavors. The dense texture and the acidity suggest a few more months aging, so drink from early 2018.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Ramos Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Winemaker Leonor Freitas runs her vineyard just south of Lisbon. This soft, fruity blend is light in both tannins and acidity. It's fresh in character, giving a ripe wine that is ready to drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Monte de BaÃ­a Red (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: With Anselmo Mendes, the Vinho Verde master, as consultant, this is a coastal Lisboa wine that has plenty of the crisp texture that comes from the Alvarinho in the blend. There is a perfumed touch from Viognier, giving the wine crispness as well as a rich background. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Adega MÃ£e 2016 Dory White (Lisboa)

description: A blend that includes Merlot, this wine is ripe while also structured. The tannins go along with the black fruits and acidity. It has a crisp, juicy finish that makes it ready to drink now.
title: Campolargo 2013 Vinha do Putto Red (Bairrada)

description: The wine has a rustic, barnyard character that will maybe blow off. For now, the fruit is subdued and layered with dry tannins and acidity. It could develop, so wait until 2017.
title: Cortes de Cima 2014 ChaminÃ© Red (Alentejano)

description: A smooth and ripe wine, packed with black fruits and some firm tannins that lend support. It is structured, juicy and full of strong spice, with dense texture. It should age a while longer, so drink from 2017.
title: Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel 2013 Herdade da Pimenta Pimenta Preta Red (Alentejano)

description: A ripe, spicy and juicy wine that has good acidity and balanced tannins. It's a blend: the smooth character of the Aragonez (aka Tempranillo) combines with the more tannic firmness of Cabernet Sauvignon. Together, they produce a fruity, structured wine that is ready to drink.
title: Falua 2012 Tagus Creek Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Firm, earthy and fruity, this is a chunky wine, with a core of tannins to go with the fruit. It is not for aging, its black berry juice demanding attention now. A great barbecue wine.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2009 ChÃ¢o das Rocas Red (Setubal)

description: Refreshing and crisp, this is a light, citrus-flavored wine. Great shots of acidity course through the wine to give an intensely fresh and fragrant aftertaste.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2013 White (Tejo)

description: It's called Assemblage because the wine is a blend of Touriga Nacional and Cabernet Sauvignon. This big wine, with its dense structure, texture and superripe fruit, is certainly rich. The tannins and the acidity do hold everything in check. But it's not a wine for aging.
title: Quinta de Pancas 2003 Assemblage Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Estremadura)

description: A full wine, balanced with an attractive citrus character and some creamy texture. There is also an edge of tannin that makes it a good, fresh, food wine.
title: PoÃ§as 2006 Coroa D'ouro Reserva White (Douro)

description: This is a rustic wine with very ripe fruit that gives a red jelly flavor. It is simple, with a dry edge and acidity, ready to drink now.
title: Solar de Cambres 2014 Casa de Cambres Colheita Red (Douro)

description: This is a highly perfumed, fruity wine with ripe melon and spiced apple flavors. It is crisp, tangy and attractively textured with fine acidity. Drink now.
title: Solar de Cambres 2015 Casa de Cambres Colheita Branco White (Douro)

description: The three grapes (castas) are Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. The blend makes a satisfyingly structured wine with some firm tannins as well as ripe fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Fiuza 2016 3 Castas Red (Tejo)

description: Touriga Franca, Tinta Roriz, CasteÃ£o and Syrahâ€”the four grapes in this blend are gently wood aged. That has smoothed out the already gentle tannins, giving the wine a creamy ripe texture enhanced by red fruit flavors. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Conde 2015 Quinta Vista Red (Lisboa)

description: The Arinto is a local grape as far as Lisboa is concerned, and this wine seems right at home here. Made from old vines, it is fresh, tangy and destined to be drunk young with locally-caught Atlantic Ocean fish. The wine has a pure, clean, perfumed aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2014 Arinto (Lisboa)

description: The entry-level white wine from this young Douro estate is ripe, juicy with tropical fruits and a lightly oxidative character that gives it extra richness. The wine has plenty of acidity as well as citrus crispness. It finishes with a creamy texture. Drink now.
title: Quinta do PÃ´pa 2016 Contos da Terra White (Douro)

description: This is a smooth, rich and rounded wine. It is full of blackberry fruits, sweet tannins and spices. Bold flavors are right up front, solid and chunky. Drink now and until 2018. Screwcap.
title: Casca Wines 2011 Cape Roca Fisherman Red (Tejo)

description: This is a rich style of Vinho Verde, smooth and ripe. Apricots and marmalade oranges dominate the flavor profile, while the citrus character pushes through strongly at the end. It's very fresh and could probably age until mid-2015.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2013 Colheita Seleccionada Avesso (Vinho Verde)

description: A four-way blend creates ripe fruit and generous tannins in an easy smooth wine. Ripe berry fruits are balanced by the acidity with touches of wood and spice giving a complete wine that is ready to drink.
title: Adega MÃ£e 2015 Dory Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: Gentle wood aging has given this single-vineyard wine its smooth texture. At three-years-old, it is ripe, balanced and rounded. The juicy red fruits are already delicious, juicy and full of bright flavors. It is ready to drink.
title: BacalhÃ´a Wines of Portugal 2014 Quinta da Garrida Red (DÃ£o)

description: Oscar Quevedo is one member of a new generation of winemakers bringing a breath of fresh air to the Douro. His everyday wines, like this one, are friendly, fruity and delicious when consumed young. This is a great wine for barbecue.
title: Quevedo 2010 Oscar's Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This is perfumed, soft, warm and ripe, with smooth peach and mulberry flavors that are offset by a citrusy tang. It's a fine apÃ©ritif.
title: Herdade Grande 2011 Verdelho (Alentejano)

description: Fresh, with considerable acidity, this is as crisp as it gets. Apple and lemon juice dominate the flavors, with just a light touch of softness to calm the acidity.
title: Borges NV Fita Azul Attitude Reserva Bruto Sparkling (Vinho Espumante de Qualidade)

description: A curiously spicy, herbal wine that seems to have lost its fruit. There is a bitter edge that may soften over the next few months.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2016 Herdade dos TemplÃ¡rios Touriga Nacional RosÃ© (Tejo)

description: Sometimes it seems the Portuguese winemakers make random blends. This 50-50 blend of Pinot Noir and Touriga Nacional is a case in point. Yet, the first grape softens the second to make a wine that is easy, ripe and ready to drink. The finish, with its touches of toast, is well balanced by acidity. So the random works. Drink from 2018.
designation: Terra de Touros Pinot Noir-Touriga Nacional
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 Terra de Touros Pinot Noir-Touriga Nacional Red (Tejo)

description: This wine shows juicy, ripe fruit without much structure. Full of red fruit, smoke tones and considerable acidity, this is a drink-now sipper.
title: Quinta Vale do Armo 2010 Vila Jardim Red (Tejo)

description: Part of a range of wines that showcases the different styles of Portugal's regions, This wine is smooth, creamily textured and with a warm ripe character. It has pineapple and mango as well as crisper lemon flavors to give a rich wine that is still poised and finely balanced. Drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Azul Portugal White (Palmela)

description: This is a powerful, dense and richly fruity wine, a blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah. With spice, sumptuous blackberry fruits and generous tannins, it's just reaching maturity. Offering great structure and immediate appeal, it is juicy, ripe and ready to drink.
title: Pinhal da Torre 2008 Quinta do Alqueve Red (Tejo)

description: With some fermentation in barrel, this wood-touched wine is rounded as well as fruity. Citrus and pineapple flavors give liveliness, with acidity cutting through the spice. Drink now.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Mula Velha Reserva White (Lisboa)

description: This simple, fruity, red-berry-flavored wine has bright acidity along with soft tannins. It's a great barbecue style of wine, fruity and ready to go with grilled meat.
title: PoÃ§as 2014 Coroa d'Ouro Red (Douro)

description: This is a ripe, generous wine. The structure typical of Touriga Nacional is submerged in the perfumed blackberry and ripe plum flavors. It's a big wine, with tannins softly cushioned in the rich fruitiness. Drink from 2018.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2015 BridÃ£o Colheita Seleccionada Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: This soft wine is a blend of two local white grapes: SÃ­ria and Fonte Cal. Intense acidity and a cool-climate feel from the high- altitude vineyards make this crisp, with grapefruit and lemon flavors. Drink now.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2016 Beyra Branco White (Beira Interior)

description: Fresh and fruity, the wine is ripe, soft and with attractive red berry fruits over acidity. Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon make a happy blend of fruit and gentle structure. Drink now.
title: Encosta do Sobral 2013 Selection Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: A sweet style of white Port, almost tawny in character, with nuts, acidity and old fruit flavors. Crystallized red fruits add an extra element. Drink by itself, or as long cocktail with tonic.
title: Rozes NV Porto White Reserva  (Port)

description: This wine is full and richly fruity. It has a cool feel to it from the proximity of the vines to the ocean, which gives a mineral, crisp character that adds tang to the texture. Acidity lifts the ripe fruit, allowing it to age a few more months. Drink from late 2017.
title: Adega MÃ£e 2015 Dory White (Lisboa)

description: A blend of two local grapes, Maria Gomes and Bical, this soft, resiny wine has an intensely dry character. Apples as well as raisins give an intriguing set of flavors. Drink from 2015.
title: Caves AlianÃ§a 2013 AlianÃ§a Reserva Branco White (Bairrada)

description: This wine is soft and juicy, with ripe red fruits balanced by acidity. A firmer backdrop offers serious tannins and dark-coffee flavors. The wine needs a few more months, so wait until 2018.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2015 BridÃ£o Colheita Seleccionada Trincadeira (Tejo)

description: Named after a local landmark, this is rich for a Vinho Verde, a soft blend of Alvarinho and Trajadura that brings out white fruits as well as a more citrus character. It's very aromatic, fruity and worth keeping a few months.
title: Quintas de MelgaÃ§o 2012 Torre de Menagem White (Vinho Verde)

description: A dry Vinho Verde that has crisp citrus as well as riper yellow fruits. A blend of Alvarinho with Trajadura, it comes from the north of Vinho Verde. It's perfumed, fresh and crisp while showing a full texture. Drink starting in late 2014.
title: Quintas de MelgaÃ§o 2013 Torre de Menagem Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: The wine is rich, bringing together two great white grapes. Both give the ripe smooth texture, while the Alvarinho also brings in its crisper charms. Pear and green-plum flavors dominate this intense and concentrated wine. Drink from late 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 DFJ Alvarinho-Chardonnay White (Lisboa)

description: Pure Touriga Nacional gives a perfumed, ripe and richly juicy wine. Tannic structure offers a base for the acidity and black currant fruit, but it's soft enough to drink now.
title: Quinta Vale do Armo 2011 Vila Jardim Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: A pale yellow-colored wine, it's full of ripe white peach, melon and plums. It's rich but also shows bright acidity and a touch of citrus. It's an easy wine to drink nowâ€“2016.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2013 Pancas Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Light, crisp and fruity, this is a bright, citrus driven wine. It is dry, full of ripe apricot and grapefruit flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Maria Bonita Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: A fruity wine, with juicy red fruits and a balance of light, dry tannins. The wine is dusty, firm, showing some earthy barnyard character. The aftertaste brings out acidity.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2010 Companhia das LezÃ­rias Catapereiro Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Fruity and smooth with bright red fruit and the lightest touch of tannin, this CastelÃ£o-dominated blend has a shot of acidity to keep it all crisp. Drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Azul Portugal Red (Tejo)

description: A smooth and rich wine that is already delicious. It has ripe berry fruits, soft tannins and a full, juicy feel. A streak of acidity cuts through this generous wine. Drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Companhia das LezÃ­rias Catapereiro Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: This estate wine is soft, smooth and ready to drink. With its ripe red fruits and gentle tannins it is a fruity, generous wine, rich in juicy acidity and with a crisp aftertaste of acidity. Drink now.
title: Global Wines 2014 Casa de Santar Red (DÃ£o)

description: This is a ripe, creamy blend of Arinto, Viognier and Verdelho. A lightly perfumed character as well as a crisp texture. Yellow fruit and bright acidity are in fine balance. Drink now.
title: Tahora 2015 Ares de Medeiros Branco White (Alentejano)

description: A rounded, soft wine, hinting at some minerality, with a white stone fruit flavor, crisply citrus. The wine only gradually shows more fruit flavor, the roundness then freshened up with acidity. There is a good final balance.
title: Herdade Grande 2007 Condado das Vinhas White (Alentejano)

description: A finely balanced wine, uniting toast and wood flavors with ripe plums in a harmonious whole. There are spice, soft tannins and light acidity. Elegant rather than powerful, this is an excellent food wine.
title: Falua 2006 Conde de Vimioso Red (Ribatejano)

description: Tightly herbal and packed with green fruits, this is a full and ripe wine. It is still very young with its initial fruit flavors still intact. It will calm down over the next few months and be better to drink from 2017.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2015 Espirito Lagoalva Sauvignon-Arinto White (Tejo)

description: This is a soft wine, lightly spicy and toasty. With its stalky red fruits and gentle tannins, it is an easy wine to drink with its young fruit and crunchy aftertaste.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2013 Red (Tejo)

description: Ripe and juicy, this concentrated wine also has good freshness. It's rounded, rich, full of black currant fruitiness. Drink now or age until 2018.
title: Henrique JosÃ© de La Puente Sancho Uva 2012 Terras d'Uva Red (Alentejano)
winery: Henrique JosÃ© de La Puente Sancho Uva

description: The blend of FernÃ£o Pires and Arinto produces a rich and creamy wine with pear, ripe apple and apricot flavors. A floral character gives extra piquancy.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2010 Companhia das LezÃ­rias Catapereiro Branco White (Tejo)

description: Six months in wood has given this wine a smooth character that has filled out the grape's natural tannins. It is a rich wine with red berry fruits that have a fine violet perfume. The wine is structured and firm, ready to drink from late 2016.
title: Marcolino Sebo 2013 QP Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: Forward, fruity and crisp, this is an attractive wine. It's red berry flavor and bright acidity is layered with smoky tannins. Not for aging, so drink over the next 2-3 years.
title: Cortes de Cima 2011 ChaminÃ© Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a smooth, creamy wine, with apple and pear aromas and flavors, as well as a crisp texture. It's full-bodied, very fruity and ready to drink, with bursting freshness and lingering acidity.
title: Quevedo 2012 Oscar's Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a perfumed wine, its freshness leaping from the glass. It has crisp green and white fruits, lively acidity and a light, tangy character. The finish shows more richness and a dry, textured feel.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2012 White (Tejo)

description: Fresh and fruity, the wine is ripe, soft and with attractive red berry fruits over acidity. Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon make a happy blend of fruit and gentle structure. Drink now.
title: Encosta do Sobral 2013 Selection Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: The wine shows its youth with firm, mineral tannins and only a light hint at the fruit. It does have plenty of acidity so it will develop a fresh, fruity character in a few months. The aftertaste is firm and still needing time. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta da Rede 2014 Rede Colheita Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Ripe, rich and creamy, this is a dense wine from the lees aging. Spice and a touch of toast come from the wood aging that smooths the wine and gives it extra complexity. This is a rich wine, with a tangy aftertaste, that is ready to drink.
title: Borges 2015 Reserva White (Douro)

description: Soft, rich and rounded, this is a concentrated wine that boasts dark plum and berry fruits along with a tight, mineral acidity. The tannins are already well integrated, making this a wine that is already ready to drink. Drink until 2019.
title: PoÃ§as 2011 Coroa d'Ouro Red (Douro)

description: With a high percentage of Malvasia in the blend, the wine has an attractive floral character that softens and fills out the mineral texture. It is crisp while ripe, finishing with vibrant acidity. Drink now.
title: PoÃ§as 2015 PoÃ§as White (Douro)

description: With its light prickle on the tongue and mineral texture, this is a crisp, dry wine. It is floral with pineapple and bright apple flavors. The acidity and the tangy orange zest all add to the freshness of the wine. Drink now.
title: Vila Nova 2015 White (Vinho Verde)

description: Lush, ripe wine, full of black fruits and a generous texture. The wine is soft, just a hint of dryness to give it weight and density. Berry fruits, black plums and acidity promise some aging.  Drink from 2014.
title: Cooperativa Reguengos de Monsaraz 2012 Monsaraz Red (Alentejo)

description: Very tropical and aromatic, this is a powerfully rich white. It is tangy with sweet oranges, layered with pineapple and apricot. There is a spicy, peppery character that comes from the alcohol.
designation: Serras de AzeitÃ£o SelecÃ§Ã£o do EnÃ³logo
title: BacalhÃ´a Wines of Portugal 2012 Serras de AzeitÃ£o SelecÃ§Ã£o do EnÃ³logo White (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: A big, ripe and juicy wine that has open, soft tannins and layers of black fruits. Bold and forward, it's ready for drinking nowâ€“2018.
title: Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel 2011 Pimenta Preta Red (Alentejano)

description: A blend of Tinta Roriz and the local Jaen, this wine has both fresh fruits and dry tannins. The fruits are going to prevail, giving red berry fruit flavors with fresh, cool acidity. The tannins will be there to sustain the fruit. Drink from late 2016.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Beyra Colheita Tinto Red (Beira Interior)

description: A bright crisp wine with attractive acidity and citrus flavors. Off dry, packed with fruit and with a gentle mousse, it is ready to drink.
title: Aveleda NV Casal Garcia Sparkling (Vinho Verde)

description: This crisp, citrus and pear-flavored wine from native Portuguese grapes is very ready to drink with its bright acidity, mineral texture and juicy aftertaste. It is a fine apÃ©ritif wine that's fruity and fresh.
title: BacalhÃ´a Wines of Portugal 2016 Alabastro Roupeiro-FernÃ£o Pires-AntÃ£o Vaz White (Alentejano)

description: While the wine is soft and almost ready to drink, it does also have the Douro mineral texture and dry tannins. The Tinta Roriz (Tempranillo) dominates, giving the wine its round and rich character. Drink now or wait until 2016 for the tannins to soften further.
title: Caves AlianÃ§a 2013 Foral Red (Douro)

description: There is a solid, tannic core in this Baga-dominant blend. It gives a smoke and blackcurrent flavored wine, with a firm layer of dry tannins and intense acidity. The wine is well structured, but needs time to age. Drink after 2016.
title: Campolargo 2010 Entre II Santos Red (Bairrada)

description: A local blend of Arinto and FernÃ£o Pires, the wine is soft, fruity with pear and melon fruit. It has gentle acidity and a crisp texture that gives a lift to the aftertaste. Drink now.
designation: Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte de BaÃ­a Branco
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte de BaÃ­a Branco White (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: There is plenty of juicy acidity in this wine even though the fruit has a strangely steely character. The tannins give it a firm character that needs to soften.
designation: Herdade da Fonte Coberta Ouro do Monte Reserva
title: Santos & Santos 2013 Herdade da Fonte Coberta Ouro do Monte Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Flavors of pear and white peach drive this clean, fruity wine. It has a tang of citrus and acidity that adds a lively edge. Ready to drink now.
title: Cortes de Cima 2011 ChaminÃ© Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This electric pink colored wine is both too rich and too heavy. It only survives because of a fresh streak of acidity that comes through at the end. Otherwise, it is too much.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2014 RosÃ© (Tejo)

description: Earthy, youthful aromas lead to a wine that's ripe while still finding its fruity character. The potential for the citrus and apricot flavors is there and should develop by mid-2015.
title: Quevedo 2013 Oscar's Branco White (Douro)

description: A salmon-colored wine, very fresh, with a full palate that carries flavors of strawberries and red currants. The wine is dry, but with the smooth caramel texture, it seems sweeter and softer.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2007 Touriga Nacional-Raboso RosÃ© (Ribatejano)

description: Blackberry and ripe black currant flavors are interspersed with acidity and a juicy texture. The wine has a dry, tannic core, with flavors of old wood that spoils the general fruitiness of the wine. Drink now.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2012 Red (Tejo)

description: Soft and smooth, this is a ripe wine. This Alvarinho, planted east of Lisbon, is far south of its normal Vinho Verde region. The wine retains its rich character while adding more tropical fruit flavors. This tangy wine is lightly mineral in texture. It will be ready to drink from the end of 2016.
title: Fiuza 2015 Alvarinho (Tejo)

description: Merlot and Syrah are added to Portuguese varieties to give a solid and fruit-driven wine. Rich berries and generous tannins are dominant partners, with juicy acidity giving balance. It's a wine that is ready to drink, full of fruit and generous.
title: Quinta Vale do Armo 2011 Vila Jardim Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Produced by the cooperative of Santo Isidro de PegÃµes south of Lisbon, this wine comes from the grape variety that's planted across the region. It's an open, soft wine, great for pasta dishes with plenty of ripe fruits and gentle tannins. Drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Dona Helena Colheita CastelÃ£o (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: A Portuguese classic, this fresh and fruity wine comes from a small zone in the heart of the Lisboa region. It is citrus flavored with delicious lime and pear flavors, fine acidity and a bright, zesty aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Caves Velhas 2014 Bucellas Arinto (Bucelas)

description: The meaty, yeasty character here doesn't chime well with the ripe, soft fruit. It is sweet with a full, toffee flavor and only light acidity.
title: Wine & Soul NV 10-Year-Old Tawny  (Port)

description: Its Grand Escolha (equivalent to a Reserve wine) label explains why this is a young, reticent and closed wine. With its firm fruits and tight tannins, it needs several years of aging to reveal what will always be a serious wine.
title: Quinta Vale de Fornos 2008 Grande Escolha Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: The cork label of this rich, smooth wine is a reminder that Alentejo's vines are interspersed with the trees that provide much of the world's cork. The wine has a rich southern character, soft tannins and plenty of blackberry fruits. It is ready to drink.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2016 SÃ£o Miguel do Sul Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a grapefruit- and apple-flavored wine with a lively prickle on the palate. Bright and dry, this is sharpened by a citrus flavor and acidity. Ready to drink.
title: Solar de Pinheiro 2011 PaÃ§o de SÃ£o LourenÃ§o White (Vinho Verde)

description: A sweet style of white Port, almost tawny in character, with nuts, acidity and old fruit flavors. Crystallized red fruits add an extra element. Drink by itself, or as long cocktail with tonic.
title: Rozes NV Porto White Reserva  (Port)

description: A caramel aroma is followed by sweet strawberry fruit from the Touriga Nacional, lending a wine that is freshly fruity and soft.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2011 RosÃ© (Tejo)

description: Bright and fresh, this is a delicate rosÃ©, showing both fruitiness and some structure. Strawberry dusted with pepper lends a spicy berry character throughout. It's not for aging, so drink now.
title: Casa da Passarella 2012 Casa da Passarella O Brazileiro RosÃ© (DÃ£o)

description: Soft and herbaceous, this is a warm wine, its acidity leading to apricot and pineapple flavors. The apple skin texture and the tangy final acidity make it crisp.
title: Quevedo 2011 Oscar's Branco White (Douro)

description: A rich interpretation of the CastelÃ£o grape, the wine is opulent and generous. It has juicy black fruits that are lifted by acidity. The slight tannins are far in the background of this wine that will be ready to drink by the end of 2016.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2013 CastelÃ£o (Lisboa)

description: A ripe wine dominated by tropical pineapple and fresh peach. This warm, lively and fruity wine can be drunk in 2014.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Samora Branco White (Tejo)

description: This is a simple, fruity wine that has ripe black fruits and soft tannins. Made for early drinking, it is aromatic, juicy with a spicy aftertaste.
title: Caves Velhas 2013 TopÃ¡zio Red (Douro)

description: This is a soft, creamy wine with fruitiness and a yeasty edge. Made from Bical, Arinto and Maria Gomes, it's ready to drink.
title: Adega de Cantanhede NV Blanc de Blancs Bruto Sparkling (Beira Atlantico)

description: This is a ripe wine that is all fruit. Red berries and crisp acidity come together in a texture that is gently tannic and very ready to drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2014 Ramos Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: A dry Vinho Verde with a light sparkle that give it a fine lift. With intense citrus and a sliced apple freshness, the wine is refreshing and ready to drink.
title: Obrigado 2015 Vera White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a young yeasty and nutty-flavored wine from the Bairrada region, home to many sparkling wines. It is crisp, with some apple fruitiness, and ready to drink. The acidity keeps it in shape.
designation: Quinta do Encontro Vinha Maria Bruto
title: Global Wines NV Quinta do Encontro Vinha Maria Bruto Sparkling (Vinho Espumante)

description: From a region well-known for its sparkling wines, this is a fruity wine with soft acidity and a ripe apple character. It has a light mousse, creamy rather than crisp. Drink now.
title: Caves da Montanha 2009 Grande CuvÃ©e Chardonnay-Arinto Sparkling (Bairrada)

description: A richly ripe wine, full of tarry, dark tannins and black fruits. Despite its weight and density, it is well balanced, the dark flavors opening out with flavors of licorice, bitter chocolate and spicy wood.
title: J. & F. Lurton 2005 Barco Negro Red (Douro)

description: The blend of local Douro white grapes gives a soft wine that has a fine streak of freshness. Citrus is balanced with white peach and shot through with mineral acidity. Drink this wine now.
title: Quinta da Rede 2015 Rede Colheita Branco White (Douro)

description: A young and fruity wine that is soft with gentle tannins and juicy black currant fruit flavors. It is ripe, fresh and balanced with generous acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Casa de Cambres 2014 Colheita Red (Douro)

description: The Avesso grape is grown mainly in the south of Vinho Verde, in the warmer area nearer the Douro. Green plums and white peach flavors give this a ripe character while the citric edge adds the freshness. Drink this attractive wine now.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2015 Avesso (Vinho Verde)

description: Oscar Quevedo, a new star of the Douro, has produced a stylish wine, suffused with tannins, fresh acidity, solid black fruits and a lively bright feel. It is ready to drink, but could age 3â€“4 years.
title: Quevedo 2008 Oscar's Red (Douro)

description: A blend of FernÃ£o Pires and Arinto, this fruity wine is deliciously refreshing and crisp, with great acidity. It is bright with lemon acidity finished with pink grapefruit. Drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Samora Branco White (Tejo)

description: From a region well-known for its sparkling wines, this is a fruity wine with soft acidity and a ripe apple character. It has a light mousse, creamy rather than crisp. Drink now.
title: Caves da Montanha 2009 Grande CuvÃ©e Chardonnay-Arinto Sparkling (Bairrada)

description: This soft wine is ripe with berry fruitiness. It has a warm sunny character while still demonstrating smoothness and flashing bright blackberry flavor and balanced acidity. Drink now.
title: Falua 2014 Tagus Creek Cabernet Sauvignon-Aragonez Red (Tejo)

description: The wine is rich, bringing together two great white grapes. Both give the ripe smooth texture, while the Alvarinho also brings in its crisper charms. Pear and green-plum flavors dominate this intense and concentrated wine. Drink from late 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 DFJ Alvarinho-Chardonnay White (Lisboa)

description: The wine is dusty, dry with layers of fruit that are still developing. Blackberry fruitiness is embedded in the firm structure of this stylish wine. It has a delicious, juicy aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Azul Portugal Red (Tejo)

description: Fruity, full-bodied wine, with tropical fruits, pear and sweet orange flavors. The acidity is just right, but richness is where this is going.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2007 Marques de Borba White (Alentejo)

description: This is a finely made, easy to drink wine. It is soft, round, with spice and light tannins, a wine that would travel to parties, barbecues and pasta bakes. The acidity from the blackberry flavor keeps it fresh and fruity.
title: Falua 2012 Tagus Creek Shiraz and Trincadeira Red (Alentejano)

description: The name of the wine is, of course, a branding exercise in itself. Luckily, the wine inside the bottle is ripe and enjoyable. It's fruity, soft, gently tannic with juicy red fruits and black plums, all finished with fresh acidity. Drink now. Screwcap.
title: Vidigal 2012 NBNC = No Branding No Cry Red (Lisboa)

description: With vines in the south of the Vinho Verde region, the estate has wines with a warm, ripe character. This example shows a richer side of Vinho Verde while preserving the natural crisp edge. Tropical fruits are balanced with a citrus aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2015 Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: Here's a smooth and juicy wine that has great black fruit aromas and flavors. It has good balance between the dry tannins and firm structure of DÃ£o and the fruity character, meaning it is likely to develop over the medium term. Drink from 2015.
designation: Casa da Passarella A Descoberta Colheita
title: Casa da Passarella 2010 Casa da Passarella A Descoberta Colheita Red (DÃ£o)

description: With great fragrance and just a touch of spiciness, this is full-bodied ripe wine. Along with the more exotic flavors, it has intense apple and nectarine fruit, and a bright, tight texture. Drink now, or age for a year.
title: Casa da Passarella 2012 Somontes Colheita Branco White (DÃ£o)

description: This blend of Arinto and FernÃ£o Pires is soft and bland. Its light fruit and acidity feel open and ripe.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Azul Portugal White (Palmela)

description: This is a soft and crisp wine that shows attractive, tangy orange flavor and has plenty of acidity to keep it as fresh as possible. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 Terra de Touros Arinto (Tejo)

description: There is an earthy element to this ripe and fruity wine. It adds some herbal flavors to the tannins, red fruits and final acidity. Drink this wine soon, and until 2020.
title: Cortes de Cima 2012 ChaminÃ© Red (Alentejano)

description: A wood-aged, rich wine that shows big, ripe fruits and a good spice and toast element from the wood, balanced by white nectarines and currants. It is full, rounded and creamy.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2006 Falcoaria FernÃ£o Pires (Ribatejo)

description: This is a broad, earthy wine showing black fruits and a rich aftertaste. It has spice, juicy acidity and tannins in the background. The fruit is verging on overripe, giving a jammy aftertaste.
title: EspaÃ§o Rural 2014 Alves Vieira Red (Alentejano)

description: The wine is soft and smooth with yellow fruits and a light texture. It is ripe, generous balancing fruit against the rounded perfumed structure. The wine is ready to drink.
title: PoÃ§as 2014 Coroa d'Ouro Branco White (Douro)

description: A blend of four grapes, this structured wine shows big black fruitiness along with fresh acidity. It's still young, bright with acidity and needs time to round out. Drink from 2017.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Companhia das LezÃ­rias Samora Red (Tejo)

description: Generous, fruity and rich, this ripe wine has black chocolate flavors to go with its soft tannins and rounded structure. At the end, acidity gives freshness and blackberry-jelly sweetness.
title: Nelson Neves 2012 Merlot (Bairrada)

description: Named after a local landmark, this is rich for a Vinho Verde, a soft blend of Alvarinho and Trajadura that brings out white fruits as well as a more citrus character. It's very aromatic, fruity and worth keeping a few months.
title: Quintas de MelgaÃ§o 2012 Torre de Menagem White (Vinho Verde)

description: The cork label of this rich, smooth wine is a reminder that Alentejo's vines are interspersed with the trees that provide much of the world's cork. The wine has a rich southern character, soft tannins and plenty of blackberry fruits. It is ready to drink.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2016 SÃ£o Miguel do Sul Red (Alentejano)

description: Blending Encruzado and Malvasia Fina, this lightly wood-aged wine is rich, stylish and full of young fruit flavors. Green plums, apricots and a squeeze of lemon all give their bright character to the palate. There is a firm, mineral texture that promises some aging	 drink from 2017.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2014 Ribeiro Santo White (DÃ£o)

description: This is a blend of Alvarinho and Trajadura, a lively, fruity wine that has just a hint of a prickle on the tongue. It has apple and grapefruit flavors that are fresh and deliciously crisp. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quintas de MelgaÃ§o 2015 Torre de Menagem Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a bright lemon and grapefruit flavored wine that has lively acidity and the lightest touch of mineral texture. It's crisp, refreshing and will be ready to drink from mid-2016.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2014 Duas Quintas Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a soft ripe wine that has yellow fruits alongside crisper red apples and touches of grapefruit. That makes for a balanced light wine that has a fine texture and a fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Monta da BaÃ­a Branco White (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: Just lightly touched by wood this is a bright and fruity wine that is ready to drink. Spice and red-berry fruits dominate, lifted by balanced tannins. Drink now.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2014 Evel Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This blend of Alvarinho and Trajadura is initially crisp and fresh. Gradually, it broadens out into a rich wine with a blend between lemon and yellow fruits that is delicious and concentrated. This tangy wine is developing well, and is ready to drink now although it will age.
title: Quintas de MelgaÃ§o 2014 Torre de Menagem Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a really refreshing style of rosÃ©. Its fruity raspberry and red-currant flavors are shot through with fine acidity and a lively crisp aftertaste. Drink this attractive wine now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Pouca Roupa RosÃ© (Alentejano)

description: This wine is smooth and soft, with an attractive creamy texture and light acidity. Yellow fruits and stewed pears are lifted by a mineral texture. The wine is named after the vineyard rather than after the literal Portuguese meaning of â€œscantily dressed.â€ Drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Pouca Roupa Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Grassy, green aromas give this a herbal, crisp taste. It is tight and tangy, with green fruit aromas and a fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
title: EspaÃ§o Rural 2014 Alves Vieira Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Very Douro in its mineral texture and dry core, it also has a surround of ripe black fruits. It's concentrated and has some aging potential, although it can be drunk now.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2010 Porrais Red (Douro)

description: This is the lightest in a series of wines featuring the Avesso grape. Herbal, crisp and with plenty of acidity, it's also fruity and ready to drink.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2016 Avesso & Azal White (Vinho Verde)

description: Made to drink young, this fruity, softly structured wine is ripe with blackberry fruits. There is a touch of spice from the wood aging and a lining of attractive acidity. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Ribeirinha 2015 ArdÃ³sia Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: This is a fresh and fragrant rosÃ© from the Vinho Verde region. It has light acidity and a red fruit flavor. The lightest prickle gives just that extra lift.
title: Quinta de Gomariz 2011 Espadeiro RosÃ© (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a gentle, ripe wine that has pineapple and peach flavors and fresh fruitiness. It is smooth with balanced acidity and a zesty aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Quartilho Branco White (Tejo)

description: The perfumes of Touriga Nacional dominate this soft, smooth wine. A layer of tannins gives structure, and the ripeness of the fruit creates a delicious, full-bodied wine.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2015 Ribeiro Santo Red (DÃ£o)

description: An herbal wine, crisp and green with an attractive citrus edge. Some yellow fruits show while it is the acidity and taut mineral character that is dominant.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2010 Evel Branco White (Douro)

description: Blackberry jam aromas lead to a fruity wine, soft and juicy. Fresh and rounded, it has balanced acidity and an open, generous character. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2013 Santos da Casa Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a rich, ripe and full-bodied blend that includes Alicante Bouschet to give the dark color. It has structure and juicy blackberry fruits. The tannins, integrated with the fruitiness, are supple and generous. This is a wine to drink soon, from late 2016.
title: Herdade Grande 2013 Audaz Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Made to be consumed young, this is fresh and fruity. It has a layer of tannins that support the red berry and plum fruit tones. The aftertaste is fresh and fruity. Drink now.
title: Evel 2012 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Vineyards just across the hills from the Douro have produced this ripe wine. It has fine acidity that gives freshness to the apple, peach and ripe pear fruits. The aftertaste is bright, tight with minerality and citrus. Drink now.
title: Casa do Valle 2015 Branco White (Vinho Verde)

description: Apricots and peaches dominate this fresh and lively wine. It is ripe and crisp with a herbal texture. Full of up-front fruit, it can be drunk now, with its lightly perfumed aftertaste.
title: Borges 2013 Quinta da Soalheira Branco White (Douro)

description: Grown in the southern part of the Minho, close to the Douro, this Alvarinho is a ripe while still textured and tangy wine. It has fine, fresh lemon acidity that's rounded out by apricot and pear flavors. Drink now.
title: Aveleda 2014 Alvarinho (Minho)

description: This wine is soft, fruity, rounded and red fruit flavored. Soft tannins and black plum skins give the wine a light structure. The wine is developing well and will be ready to drink from 2016.
title: Casca Wines 2014 Cascas Winemaker Selection Red (Douro)

description: This wine is tight and mineral textured. Still young, taut and nervy, orange zest flavors are blended with apple and grapefruit acidity. There is a juicy concentration that develops in the glass and will become more dominant as the wine ages. Drink from 2017.
title: Casca Wines 2014 Monte Cascas Branco White (Douro)

description: This ripe wine is full of apple and pear fruit with a touch of citrus. It is full, the acidity just pointing up the richness. There are almond flavors as well as spice from the wood aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Adega Vila Real 2016 Premium White (Douro)

description: A tropical fruit flavored wine with yellow fruits, pineapple and mango. It is soft and very ripe although still showing some of the fresher acidity that should be in an Alvarinho wine. It's a long way from the cool north of Portugal.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2014 Senses Alvarinho (Alentejano)

description: This ripe and structured wine is poised between rich berry fruits and a solid, dark tannic core. It has great fruitiness that envelops the dry center, showing wood and spice flavors that are coming together well. Drink this fine wine from 2018.
title: Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel 2013 Ciconia Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: For a Vinho Verde, this is smooth. With the a creamy texture along with bread fruit and lime flavors, the wine is soft. There is acidity to give a lift perfectly judged to keep this attractively crisp at the end. Drink now.
title: Quintas de MelgaÃ§o 2016 QM Terra Antiga White (Vinho Verde)

description: A lean style bringing out acidity from the juicy black currant fruits. It has definite tannins supporting the fruit, while it finishes with fresh, perhaps too fresh, acidity.
title: J. & F. Lurton 2008 Barco Negro Red (Douro)

description: This fruity wine is made to be drunk young. It has soft tannins, perfumed blackberry fruit and just enough acidity. Smoothly textured, it's a great barbecue-style of red. The wine is named after the vineyard rather than after the literal Portuguese meaning of â€œscantily dressed.â€ Drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Pouca Roupa Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine, one in a series featuring the Avesso grape, is a blend of two of the major Vinho Verde grapes. Avesso comes from the south of Vinho Verde	 Loureiro is from the central section. The wine is ripe, rounded and full of apple, pear and green-plum fruits. The aftertaste is crisp and tangy.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2016 Avesso & Loureiro White (Vinho Verde)

description: This wood-aged reserve wine has structure and fine dry tannins. Under that the black fruits are still developing. Give it another year in the cellar before drinking.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2014 Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: Smooth and ripe, this is a softly textured, caramel-flavored wine. It does have a dry element, but the main thrust is full of juicy acidity. Ready to drink now.
title: Casal do Conde 2010 Terra ChÃ£ Red (Tejo)

description: A solid, tannic wine that has both great rich fruits and a dry core that needs to soften with age. It tastes powerful without sacrificing a perfumed and floral elegance. This is a serious wine, with a dense texture and potential. Drink from 2016.
title: Kopke 2011 Red (Douro)

description: Simaens has produced a ripe style of wine here. Apple and rich citrus flavors add a delicious touch to tropical fruit flavors. This wine is fit for drinking in the next few months.
title: Borges 2011 Quinta de Simaens White (Vinho Verde)

description: This big, spicy wine is dominated by licorice and heavy toast wood flavors. It is rich and full of black plum skins with only a hint of acidity. The aftertaste is sharp and bitter.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2010 TerraÃ§os do Tejo Red (Tejo)

description: The name is not a Portuguese greeting, but a blending of Alvarinho and Loureiro, the grapes in the wine. It is a rich, juicy wine full of apricot, apple and pear flavors. It has just the right amount of tangy texture and refreshing acidity. The wine is fruity, perfumed and bright.
title: Quinta de Soalheiro 2015 Allo White (Vinho Verde)

description: Almost black in color, this is a concentrated powerhouse of black plum, damsons and dark berry fruits. It is explosively rich and densely structured, with intense juicy fruit.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 Grand'Arte Alicante Bouschet (Lisboa)

description: There is a sunrise pink color to this soft, rounded wine. Made from Palmela's local CastelÃ£o grape, it is fruity, tinged by caramel and a fresh, crisp citrusy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Pegos Claros CastelÃ£o (Palmela)

description: This is a southern and warmer take on Alvarinho than is found in northern Portugal. It brings out the ripe perfumed character of the grape. Apricot and golden plums show both the fruit and the generous texture. Drink this wine starting from late 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Grand'Arte Alvarinho (Lisboa)

description: With its fine tannins and touch of acidity to lift the berry fruits, this is a stylish, wood-aged wine. It is ready to drink with its spice and ripe fruit character.
title: Sanguinhal 2010 Quinta de S. Francisco Red (Obidos)

description: Produced from high altitude vineyards to retain acidity, this is a fruity, crisp and bright wine. It has an herbal character along with lively lemon and quince flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2014 Evel Branco White (Douro)

description: Smooth, soft wine, very accessible and up-front. The stewed fruit flavors and fresh acidity give an attractive lift to this open wine.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2008 Evel Red (Douro)

description: This is a lively, fruity wine, crisp as can be, and finely textured. Drink now for its bright, fresh character.
title: Caves Velhas 2013 CabeÃ§a de Toiro Reserva White (Tejo)

description: The short lees aging has allowed this wine to ripen and fill out. Along with the citrus acidity, it has plenty of fresh apple fruit and a zesty texture. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2016 Monte Cascas Colheita Branco White (Douro)

description: A crisp and fruity blend of Douro grapes, this is packed with raspberry fruitiness, offering delicious acidity at the end. The wine is dry and ready to drink.
title: Casca Wines 2016 Monte Cascas Colheita RosÃ© (Douro)

description: This wine that includes 65% AntÃ£o Vaz conjures up a warm, ripe character from the Alentejo. With its yellow fruits and almond flavors, it's soft although finished with some attractive acidity. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2016 Monte Cascas Colheita Branco White (Alentejano)

description: An attractive rosÃ©, made from 100% CastelÃ£o, the local grape of SetÃºbal peninsula. It is crisp with citrus and ripe with raspberry giving a fine balance and refreshing character. Drink now.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Pegos Claros RosÃ© (Palmela)

description: With a touch of wood aging, this is a bright yet toasty wine. Its fruitiness shows as citrus, pineapple and pear, with a tangy edge. There is aging potential here, to round out the wine and bring out its softer side. Drink from 2015.
title: Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel 2013 Colheita Seleccionada Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This is a spicy wood-laden wine. Considering it is three-years-old, it seems likely that the burnt-wood flavor will remain. That spoils what is otherwise a ripe and juicy wine with fine black fruits.
title: Global Wines 2014 Cabriz Touriga Nacional (DÃ£o)

description: A blend of four grapes, including Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier, the white ChaminÃ© has a full feel to it. An open oily texture also preserves herbaceous crispness and a final burst of acidity.
title: Cortes de Cima 2010 ChaminÃ© White (Alentejano)

description: The Cambres vineyard sits on the hills just to the south of the Douro river, giving a rich, perfumed style of wood-aged wine. This is structured, with a dry core and big black fruits that will soften and come together. Drink this solid, ripe wine from 2017.
title: Casa de Cambres 2009 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: When Aveleda's Guedes family purchased Quinta da Agueira, it came with its own grand house, a 19th century folly (a great term in the British lexicon). So, being fans of follies, the family named this spicy wine after the house. This wine is dense and concentrated, with dark fruit balanced by structured tannins. Drink nowâ€“2022.
title: Aveleda 2012 Follies Casa da Agueira Touriga Nacional (Bairrada)

description: Grand'Arte is the top range from DFJ Vinhos, highlighting wines that express the individual varieties. Labeled Shiraz rather than Syrah, this is a powerful, spicy, rich wine. Solid tannins and dark black fruits are layered with acidity and ripe plums. With its structure, it will age well for a value-priced wine	 drink from 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Grand'Arte Shiraz (Lisboa)

description: The wine comes from the hilltop town of Estremoz in Alentejo, where the streets are paved with local marble. It is an oak-aged wine with touches of spice as well as attractive juicy black-currant fruits. The wine is soft, developing quickly and likely to be drinkable from 2018.
title: Encostas de Estremoz 2016 DJ Escolha da EnÃ³loga Red (Alentejano)

description: Grown in the southern part of the Minho, close to the Douro, this Alvarinho is a ripe while still textured and tangy wine. It has fine, fresh lemon acidity that's rounded out by apricot and pear flavors. Drink now.
title: Aveleda 2014 Alvarinho (Minho)

description: This wine is soft, fruity, rounded and red fruit flavored. Soft tannins and black plum skins give the wine a light structure. The wine is developing well and will be ready to drink from 2016.
title: Casca Wines 2014 Cascas Winemaker Selection Red (Douro)

description: This is a soft blend of five local varieties, offering a generous, concentrated wine. Black fruit tones are balanced by a strong mineral character that brings out a tight texture. From the end of 2016, it will be a fine, ripe and accessible wine.
title: Fontes da Cunha 2011 Mondeco Red (DÃ£o)

description: Assobio is from a single vineyard in the Quinta dos MurÃ§as estate. A powerful, structured expression of Douro wine, it has black fruits, dark tannins, some subtle layers of wood aging and great concentration. Dark and richly fruity, it needs to mature before drinking. Wait until 2017.
title: Quinta dos MurÃ§as 2011 Assobio Red (Douro)

description: A superripe, soft wine, all pear and yellow fruit flavors, touched with apricot juice and light honey and lemon. The wine rolls smoothly with a light texture of pear skins.
title: Fitapreta Vinhos 2008 Sexy Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This is a rich, wood-aged wine with spice, apricot and ripe plum fruits and a mineral texture. It is rounded as well as fresh, crisp with acidity while full in fruits. Drink this delicious wine now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2012 Quinta das Amoras Reserva Branco White (Lisboa)

description: A very firm wine, this shows fine tannins alongside a cool black-currant fruit character. It's solid but young, with pepper, fresh fruit and a bright aftertaste.
title: Moura Basto 2012 Red (Tejo)

description: Earthy wine that has rich, chewy fruit, its tannins a serious element. There is weight as well, the wine ripe, full, with juicy plum flavors.
title: Quinta do Carneiro 2008 Pactus Touriga Nacional (Lisboa)

description: Firmly tannic, it's based entirely on the rich structure of Alicante Bouschet. It has an interplay of dark fruits, spicy wood-aging and acidity. They are combining well to give a well-structured wine that's ripe and juicy. Drink from 2017.
title: Fiuza 2012 Premium Alicante Bouschet (Tejo)

description: This blend of Trajadura and Alvarinho comes from the far north of the Vinho Verde region. The wine is cool and perfumed with apricot as well as creamed pear flavors. Drink the wine now.
title: Quintas de MelgaÃ§o 2016 Blue White (Vinho Verde)

description: On the lean side, this is a dry, tannic wine with more structure than flesh. It's firm, with a strong sense of wood aging followed by some acidity. It could soften in 3â€“4 years.
title: Caves Velhas 2012 TopÃ¡zio Red (Douro)

description: This fruity wine is made to be drunk young. It has soft tannins, perfumed blackberry fruit and just enough acidity. Smoothly textured, it's a great barbecue-style of red. The wine is named after the vineyard rather than after the literal Portuguese meaning of â€œscantily dressed.â€ Drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Pouca Roupa Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Avesso is the hallmark white grape from the south of the Vinho Verde region. This wine is deliciously crisp, with a touch of oak to add spice. It is full of ripe apples, with an aftertaste that brims with acidity.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2016 Avesso Superior Avesso (Vinho Verde)

description: This blend of FernÃ£o Pires, Arinto, Sauvignon Blanc and, unusually, Marsanne is ripe, with a deliciously perfumed character. Acidity and bright fruit give crispness that contrasts with the rich texture. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2016 Vinho Branco White (Tejo)

description: While this wine is dry and firm, it is also full of ripe black-plum-skin flavors and juicy acidity. The two together have produced a wine that should be ready to drink from 2018.
title: BarÃ£o de Vilar 2012 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is a delicious wine, where the richness of Chardonnay dominates the fresher character of Arinto, resulting in a creamy, full-textured wine with touches of vanilla and ripe yellow fruits. It's well balanced, with the ripe acidity showing well at the end.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2012 Margarides White (Tejo)

description: Citrus and ripe yellow fruits weave harmoniously throughout this warm, rich wine. There is no wood, just generous fruitiness and acidity in a creamy texture. It is approachable now, although it will be better from 2016.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Grand'Arte Chardonnay (Lisboa)

description: You want rich fruit, here it is. The wine is soft, with dense, sweet plum flavors followed by milk chocolate smoothness. Drink now. Screwcap.
title: Casca Wines 2009 Cape Roca Fisherman Red (Tejo)

description: Planting Alvarinho in the Lisboa region, many miles south of its native Minho, could be risky. But winemaker JosÃ© Neiva Correia took a chance on the ocean-climate similarities and the result is a wine that's as fresh and crisp as possible. Citrus, green plums and lively acidity all come together in a wine that has a bright, spicy aftertaste.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Aluado Alvarinho (Lisboa)

description: Already delicious, this wine is piled high with blackberry fruits and sweet tannins that are supported by spicy wood flavors. It's soft and velvet in texture, very ready to drink now.
title: Terras de Alter 2012 Terra D'Alter Red (Alentejano)

description: This is stylish Douro, a wine that reveals minerality, red berry fruits with tannins and acidity that cut through the structure. This wine is ready to drink.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2007 Evel Tinto Red (Douro)

description: With a preponderance of Touriga Nacional and Tinta Roriz, this ripe, smooth wine comes from the central Douro in PinhÃ£o. It is fruity, with attractive red fruits and acidity. Tannins are gently in the background, leaving the fruit right up front.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2014 Carvalhas QV Red (Douro)

description: This is a rich, smoothly textured wine. Pear and apricot fruits are blended with shots of lemon to give a perfumed wine that has a lightly spicy character. Drink this ripe wine from 2017.
title: Quinta dos MurÃ§as 2015 Assobio Branco White (Douro)

description: This wine is finely balanced, ripe with plenty of fruit and crisp with an edge of acidity. Its blackberry fruit and attractive tannic structure make this a wine that is ready to drink.
title: JosÃ© Maria da Fonseca 2014 RipanÃ§o Private Selection Red (Alentejano)

description: Light tannins are dominated by the black cherry and ripe berry fruits. Acidity and a fresh character make this wine accessible and ready to drink.
title: Casca Wines 2013 Santos da Casa Red (Douro)

description: This blend of Syrah, CastelÃ£o and Aragonez has the typical cool feel of a wine from coastal Lisboa. It offers firm tannins, stalky black currant fruits and bright acidity, all packaged in a smooth texture with a soft, juicy aftertaste.
title: Casca Wines 2014 Bote Red (Lisboa)

description: This  Alvarinho, grown in the southern part of the Vinho Verde region, has richness as well as typical peach and pear flavors. The acidity comes through with its citrus edge to give a crisp aftertaste to a ripe-fruit flavored wine.
title: Aveleda 2012 Alvarinho (Minho)

description: This wine gets its name from the fossils that abound in the landscape of the vineyards. A blend of Arinto, Viognier and Chardonnay, it is ripe and perfumed. The texture is smooth, but with a mineral edge. Yellow fruits dominate the flavor profile that's balanced with acidity. Drink the wine now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Stones & Bones White (Lisboa)

description: Very Douro in its mineral texture and dry core, it also has a surround of ripe black fruits. It's concentrated and has some aging potential, although it can be drunk now.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2010 Porrais Red (Douro)

description: A bright, lemon flavored wine with tight acidity and an attractive mineral texture. It is floral, zesty and very ready to drink.
title: Vila Nova 2015 Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: With Syrah and Aragonez (Tempranillo) forming the blend, it's no surprise that this is an aromatic, smoothly tannic wine. The earthy aromas blow away to give a wine with structure, flavors of blueberries and raspberries plus a dense, tarry aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
title: Adega MÃ£e 2012 Dory Red (Lisboa)

description: A ripe, smooth wine, dominated by juicy Trincadeira that has been tamed by 12 months wood aging. There's great spice, toast, dark berry fruits and good concentration. The tannins and the fine acidity promise aging potential.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2004 Adegaborba.pt Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: For a Syrah, this is soft, offering more of the smooth tannins than any bigger structure. It does have weight, with a dusty character and some juicy sweet plums and raisins, leavened by acidity.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2009 Senses Syrah (Alentejano)

description: This finely structured wine from the Quinta dos Murcas estate has ripe flavors of spice and red berry. Its warm feel is shot through with acidity for the perfect amount of tension. You can drink this now, but it would benefit from another year of aging.
title: Quinta dos MurÃ§as 2009 Assobio Red (Douro)

description: A ripe, smooth wine that is lightly textured and rich. It has a crisp line of acidity to cut through the spice, the orange and the apple fruitiness. There is no hint of the high alcohol on this fragrant, fruity wine. Drink now.
title: Herdade do EsporÃ£o 2012 V Verdelho (Alentejano)

description: A young and fruity tawny that has dried fruits and fresh black fig and toffee. It is a smoothly textured wine, the spirit fully integrated into the sweetness and richness. Drink now.
title: Martha's Wines NV Martha's Slim Collection Tawny  (Port)

description: Very soft, perfumed with bright red cherry fruits, this is a lively rosÃ©, light and bright, lilting on the mouth, finishing with mineral acidity. Screw cap.
title: Casca Wines 2009 Cape Roca Fisherman RosÃ© (Tejo)

description: A dark, ripe and fruity wine that is full of dense red-fruit aromas and spicy tannins. The palate offers ample freshness, with crisp, juicy red berry fruit up front. Drink now and until 2017.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Samora Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: This wine has structure and ripe black fruits. It is made to be drunk young, with plenty of berry fruits and soft tannins. Drink from 2019.
title: Quinta do Portal 2015 Tinta Barroca (Douro)

description: This wine comes from Moscatel GraÃºdo, the most fragrant of the Moscatel family. Certainly very perfumed, it's dry with attractive acidity, and a crisp, floral and lightly spicy character.
title: Casal do Conde 2012 Quinta da Arrancosa Moscatel GraÃºdo (Tejo)

description: A black-hued blend of Aragonez, Touriga Nacional and Trincadeira, this is powerful, rich and firmly packed with tannins as well as dense plum and wood flavors. Accents of spice and mint add complexity. The wine will benefit from 2â€“3 years of aging to soften and round out, but it's drinkable now.
title: Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel 2011 Ciconia The Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This pure Shiraz gives a wonderfully perfumed wine that is both spicy and packed with dark, dense fruits. Blackberries are supported by soft tannins and a touch of caramel from wood aging. It's solid, firm while also fruity and should age. Drink from 2016.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Grand'Arte Shiraz (Lisboa)

description: A complex blend of four grapes, this wine is rich, rounded and ripe. There is a juicy character to it, with spice and some firm, extracted tannins in the background. At this stage, it is still too dry and tannic and the wine needs time for the black fruits to come forward. Drink from 2017.
title: Herdade dos Machados 2013 Morgado da Canita Red (Alentejano)

description: This rich, wood-aged wine abounds with spice and ripe pear, peach and mango fruits. The dense texture comes from aging on the lees for four months, adding to the richness and spicy character. Drink this wine now, but it will be better in 2015.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2012 Reserva White (Tejo)
