description: Produced from Alvarinho grown in the southern Minho region, near the Douro Valley, this is a particularly crisp and fruity wine. Great streaks of acidity give it a fresh character. It needs to age a few months to round it out	 drink from 2015.
title: Aveleda 2013 Alvarinho (Minho)

description: With its dark color and firm tannins, this dense wine from 2,000-foot-high vineyards belies its light alcohol to give rich structure. It is fresh as well, with black currant juiciness coming through the spice and structure. It's still young, juicy and needs to age. Drink from 2015.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2012 Quinta do Cardo Red (Beira Interior)

description: This blend of Syrah and Touriga Nacional is rustic with some hard tannins and intense acidity. Since it is still young, the wine could soften but it seems to be more about its structure than its fruit.
title: Santos & Santos 2015 Quinta da Cidadoura Red (Lisboa)

description: The Encruzado and Malvasia blend is both fruity and intensely perfumed. It has a touch of lychee as well as crisper grapefruit. Drink the wine starting now.
title: Vinihold 2016 Altimo Branco White (DÃ£o)

description: Half-and-half Alvarinho and Trajadura, the wine is dry, crisp and with just a touch of fizz. Grapefruit and lemon flavors mingle with softer apples to give a bright and lively wine that is just made for summer food. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lixa 2016 Aromas das Castas Grande Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: This blend, with 50% Touriga Nacional, is deliciously crisp while also ripe. It has a softly tannic texture that gives it a zesty character. The aftertaste is bright and fruity.
title: Quinta dos MurÃ§as 2016 Assobio RosÃ© (Douro)

description: Smoky, meaty aromas, with bacon flavors, bitter coffee and spice. It is rustic, its texture ragged around the edge. A wine that demands spicy barbecue food.
title: PaxÃ¡ Wines 2009 Tinto Red (Algarve)

description: The historic Santar estate is one of the oldest in the DÃ£o region. The estate wine is structured, mineral, dark in character and firm in tannins. At the same time, rich black fruits are waiting to burst out, bringing with them ripeness and balanced acidity. It's a serious wine for aging	 drink from 2018.
title: DÃ£o Sul 2012 Casa de Santar Red (DÃ£o)

description: The wine is full of acidity and with stalky fruit. There is a sharp edge that detracts from the otherwise fruity character of this light crisp wine. This is ready to drink now.
title: Vinihold 2015 Altimo Red (Douro)

description: Full and ripe, this is a lemon and crisp apple flavored wine. There is a hint of toast from the six months in barrel that also adds a little pepper. Fine acidity and a tangy texture suggests it could age. Drink this wine from 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Scancio Reserva Alvarinho-Chardonnay White (Lisboa)

description: A fruity style of Douro wine, perhaps missing the tannins but with generous black fruits and ripe berry flavors. Acidity and a streak of minerality combine to give the final tight texture. Drink now.
title: Borges 2012 Quinta da Soalheira Red (Douro)

description: A fruity and aromatic wine that is a blend of Syrah and CastelÃ£o. It has bright red fruits and a soft, ripe character. Berries and acidity complement the round finish.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Samora RosÃ© (Tejo)

description: This is a firm and serious wine, with dark tannins behind the rich black fruit tones. The solid structure is likely to smooth out with time to give a ripe and juicy wine. Drink from 2015.
title: Roquevale 2011 Tinto da Talha Red (Alentejano)

description: A fruity blend of FernÃ£o Pires and Arinto, the two most familiar white grapes of the region, this wine is soft and creamy. The acidity and the green fruits are already refreshing. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Ribeirinha 2016 ArdÃ³sia Branco White (Tejo)

description: A blend of Gouveio and Verdelho, this is a spicy, perfumed wine that has fine, lively acidity to go with its honey, lemon and pear flavors. To drink now, although the mineral edge suggests aging potential.
title: Herdade do EsporÃ£o 2010 2 Duas Castas Gouveio-Verdelho White (Alentejano)

description: It's unclear why this wine's bottle has to be so heavy. After all, the wine inside is ripe, fruity and very ready to drink, certainly not for aging. Black fruits have matured into a leather texture and smoky flavors. The wine is ripe and full in the mouth with just a touch of pepper at the end from alcohol. Drink now.
title: Marcolino Sebo 2010 QP Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: A mineral textured wine with stone fruits and attractive fresh acidity, it has a lively citrus character that comes out of the bright citrus and green plum fruits. The wine is ready to drink.
title: H. Abrantes Douro Wines 2013 Vargosa Branco White (Douro)

description: Part of a series that showcases major grape varieties, this wine brings out the creamy, green and apple-fruit character of the Chardonnay. It conveys hints of tropical fruits and a ripe apricot flavor. Balanced acidity lifts all this rich fruitiness. Drink from late 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Grand'Arte Chardonnay (Lisboa)

description: Dry and stalky, this wine from the eastern Alentejo is structured and firm. It has ripe black fruit flavors along with acidity, both of them dominated by tannins from the fruit. The wine needs to age	 drink from 2017.
title: Herdade dos Machados 2013 Santos Jorge Red (Alentejo)

description: Ripe, spicy and full both of ripe fruits and tannins, this is a full-bodied wine that brings out the minerality and structure of a Douro wine. It has plenty of red fruits to balance these tannins, resolving into the wine that is firm but ready to drink.
title: Adega Vila Real 2015 Premium Red (Douro)

description: The wine is spicy, fruity with soft tannins and plenty of ripe red berries. Its dry core gives it shape along with a firm anchor for the generous fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Conde 2016 Canoa Red (Lisboa)

description: Simaens has produced a ripe style of wine here. Apple and rich citrus flavors add a delicious touch to tropical fruit flavors. This wine is fit for drinking in the next few months.
title: Borges 2011 Quinta de Simaens White (Vinho Verde)

description: Vines in the southern Amarante region of Vinho Verde give this wine its ripe melon and apple flavors. It is tangy, bright with ripe fruit and with a lightly mineral texture. Drink now.
title: Quinta da CalÃ§ada 2015 Portal da CalÃ§ada Reserva White (Vinho Verde)

description: An impressive wine that is packed with notes of rich fruit, toast and vanilla. It has weight to its apple, peach and intense spice flavors. The style is like a ripe Chardonnay, just with extra acidity. Ready to drink, but could age for another year.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2008 Falcoaria Branco FernÃ£o Pires (Tejo)

description: A cherry pink, red-cherry flavored wine that has soft, clean fruit and acidity. It's pure fruitiness, easy to drink although with a heft of alcohol that contrasts with its light style.
title: Herdade do EsporÃ£o 2013 Vinha da Defesa RosÃ© (Alentejano)

description: With attractive lemon flavors within a smooth and rich wine, this is both bright and ripe. It's aromatic and full in the mouth, showing apple, peach and mineral tones. Drink from 2015.
title: Kopke 2013 White (Douro)

description: From a single vineyard, this wine has structure and dense tannins. It is still young and the lean stalky character needs time to open up. Look for the black currant fruit to become richer over the next year and drink from 2017.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Quartilho Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: This is a soft fruity wine with stalky blackberry fruits. Like many wines from the Tejo region it has a light structure that is built around easygoing fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Red (Tejo)

description: Fresh, fruity and crisp, this is an attractive, refreshing wood aged wine. It has citrus and crisp apple and riper apricot flavors, bright with acidity and needing a few more months to age. Drink from late 2016.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2014 BridÃ£o Reserva Branco FernÃ£o Pires (Tejo)

description: Soft, ripe and juicy, this wine is full of ready-to-drink fruit housed by soft tannins from light wood aging. Mainly fruit-forward in style, a bright acidity kicks on the finish to balance the palate out.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2012 Carvalhas QV Red (Douro)

description: A perfumed, ripe wine, attractively flavored with citrus, peach and melon, this is a wine for drinking young, a warm day wine, or as an apÃ¨ritif. The crisp structure adds to its mouthwatering character.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2007 Grand' Arte Chardonnay (Estremadura)

description: Although it's young, this wine has seen some time in oak, which has given it a ripe fruity character balanced by toast. It's rich and full with balancing acidity and a spicy aftertaste. It needs to age a few months, so drink from 2016.
title: Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel 2014 Colheita Seleccionada Branco White (Alentejano)

description: While this is lightweight for a Douro wine, it does have a backbone of tannin. It is warm, with its damson jelly flavors giving a reassuring winter feel. The texture shows dusty tannins and a final juicy character. Screwcap.
title: Vidigal 2008 Red (Douro)

description: This is a soft, fruity and easy wine. With simple tannins and black currant fruit laced with spice, it's made to be drunk now.
title: Vicente Faria Vinhos 2015 Animus Red (Douro)

description: This pleasant, fruity wine has lemon-lime crispness. Hints of apricot flavor prove the Alvarinho grape is far from its northern Portuguese homeland. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2015 Senses Alvarinho (Alentejano)

description: Bold, ripe and fruity, this is a young wine that will be ready to drink soon. It has blackberry notes laced with bright acidity to balance the rich palate. Already delicious and approachable, this is a generous wine with a fresh aftertaste.
title: Herdade PaÃ§o do Conde 2013 Herdade das Albernoas Red (Alentejano)

description: Named after the crows that fly on the Campolargo estate, this is a warm, ripely fruity wine with sweet flavors and soft tannins. It is ready to drink, a delicious winter warmer.
designation: Os Corvos da Vinha da Costa
title: Campolargo 2008 Os Corvos da Vinha da Costa Red (Bairrada)

description: A perfumed and crisp citrus wine that is light and fruity. It is soft and smooth with a light creamy texture and refreshing acidity. Ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 FernÃ£o Pires (Tejo)

description: Soft, ripe and fruity, this is the entry-level wine from Herdade da Farizoa in Alentejo. With its spice, soft tannins and blackberry juice flavor, it's a fresh wine that can be drunk now through 2019.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2013 Farizoa Red (Alentejano)

description: This manages to be rounded and crisp at the same time, giving an intense citrus flavor and a soft texture, with just a touch of honey on the finish.
title: Quinta de Gomariz 2011 Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: There is a good balance in this wine between fresh berry fruits and a firmer structure so the tannins are present while never hiding the attractive fruitiness. Simple and one-dimensional, it is still attractive and ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2013 Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: Azal is a comparatively rare grape to be vinified on its own, so this example is something of a curiosity. It has plenty of acidity and is a refreshing, appley wine suited for summertime drinking, very chilled.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2013 Colheita Seleccionada Azal (Vinho Verde)

description: Produced from vines grown in a boulder and fossil strewn vineyard, this is a rich smoky wine. It has a deep color from the Alicante Bouschet in the blend, with firm tannins and dark juicy plum skin flavors. It's going to be a ripe rich wine as it develops. Drink from 2017.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Stones & Bones Red (Lisboa)

description: Part of a series that showcases major grape varieties, this wine brings out the creamy, green and apple-fruit character of the Chardonnay. It conveys hints of tropical fruits and a ripe apricot flavor. Balanced acidity lifts all this rich fruitiness. Drink from late 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Grand'Arte Chardonnay (Lisboa)

description: The wine has the character of a perfumed Moscatel from SetÃºbal, but is in fact from FernÃ£o Pires. It has a richâ€”never heavyâ€”feel to it, flavors of caramel and smokiness from wood aging. Consider this as an apÃ©ritif, rather than as a dessert wine.
title: Quinta da Alorna NV Abafado 5-years FernÃ£o Pires (Vinho Licoroso)

description: A fresh, bone-dry rosÃ©, packed with acidity, red currants and a touch of caramel. The wine is light, summery, good for apÃ©ritif or food.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 Grand'Arte RosÃ© Touriga Nacional (Estremadura)

description: A dry rosÃ©, dominated by caramel and raspberry fruit flavors. It has attractive acidity, but the texture does feel heavy, leaving a dull aftertaste.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2009 Ventozelo RosÃ© (Douro)

description: This is an unusual white made from red Touriga Nacional and white Tamarez. Bright lemon flavors are balanced by notes of apricot and richer fruit tones. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2012 Tamarez White (Tejo)

description: The wine is soft, ripe and fruity. With a smooth line of tannins, it is open and full of black currant and berry flavors. The acidity gives a fine lift at the end. Drink now.
title: Terra Silvestre 2014 BÃ¡toreus Red (Tejo)

description: This wine reflects the fresh, cool character of Lisboa, with its ocean influence. A tangy, steely edge brings out a mineral character to top up the crisp citrus and apple fruitiness. The wine needs until 2016.
title: Adega MÃ£e 2013 Dory Colheita Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Known in Spain as Graciano, this grape produces attractive, fruity wine especially in the Tejo region. This example is ripe with layers of acidity as well as a generous texture. Soft and smooth, it is ready to drink.
title: Fiuza 2015 Red (Tejo)

description: Made from old vines, this rich rosÃ© is full of fruit. It has fine acidity as well as wild-strawberry flavors. The texture, lightly mineral, gives the wine a crisp, tight shape. With a fresh aftertaste, the wine will be just right for food.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas RosÃ© (Douro)

description: There is an attractive spiciness to this clean warm wine. White currants and acidity add to the approachability of a wine that is ready to drink.
title: Herdade do EsporÃ£o 2016 Defesa Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Portugal's popular brand is a lively, fresh, spice- and dried fruit-flavored wine. There are flavors of pound cake and nutmeg surrounding a core of solid, firm tannins. Great with food, this is not for aging.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2007 MarquÃªs de Borba Red (Alentejo)

description: A soft Vinho Verde, with white fruit flavors, only light acidity and some final sweetness. An attractive apÃ©ritif.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2010 Clemens Reserva White (Vinho Verde)

description: A full ripe and refreshingly fruity wine, this is full of grapefruit, apricot and ripe pear flavors. It has a touch of spice and a firmly mineral character. Drink now.
title: Campolargo 2013 Vinha do Putto Branco White (Bairrada)

description: A surprisingly fresh wine for an Alvarinho from the hot Alentejo. It shows crisp acidity, with lime and apricot flavors and a bright, crisp aftertaste.
title: Terras de Alter 2014 Terra d'Alter Alvarinho (Alentejano)

description: Rich and ripe, with soft tannins and black plum flavors. It is round, while still having a core of attractive tannins. The fruit dominates, giving a friendly, accessible wine.
title: Alente 2007 Premium Red (Alentejo)

description: This is a bright pink-colored wine, with caramel as much as fruit flavors. It has a light touch of acidity that gives the wine a lift at the end.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2014 Herdade dos TemplÃ¡rios RosÃ© (Tejo)

description: Ripe and fruity, this is a rich style of rosÃ©. A blend of Touriga Nacional and Aragonez, it is full of ripe raspberry and red plum flavors that are soft and generous, although lacking acidity. Drink now.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2014 Mariana RosÃ© (Alentejano)

description: A delicious citric-dominated wine, very fresh, with a great apple skin texture, bright aciidty and crisp white fruits. It dances easily, lightly, ready to drink now.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2009 Quinta do Cardo White (Beira Interior)

description: This ripe and fruity wine is as reliable as always. With soft tannins and generous red-berry flavors, it is an attractive blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah which have been infused with Alentejo warmth. Drink now.
title: Herdade do EsporÃ£o 2015 Defesa do EsporÃ£o Touriga Nacional-Syrah Red (Alentejano)

description: A surprisingly fresh wine for an Alvarinho from the hot Alentejo. It shows crisp acidity, with lime and apricot flavors and a bright, crisp aftertaste.
title: Terras de Alter 2014 Terra d'Alter Alvarinho (Alentejano)

description: Some slightly sappy elements mingle with cinnamon and blackberries in the aromas of this complex red. Anise and cherry flavors appear on the palate, along with mild bitter chocolate on the finish. Lots of interesting things here in this medium-weight, food-friendly wine.
title: CalÃ§os do Tanha 1996 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This intensely fruity wine is full of crisp acidity, lemon and lime flavors and a tangy, tight, steely texture. The wine is mineral and structured, while remaining fresh and attractively juicy. It's tempting to drink it now because of the freshness, but better wait until 2016.
title: Casa da Passarella 2013 Colheita Branco White (DÃ£o)

description: This attractive wine is full of ripe fruit, with soft tannins and only light acidity. It is developing well. Drink this wine from late 2017.
title: Rozes 2013 Terras do Grifo Red (Douro)

description: With creamy Encruzado and perfumed Malvasia in the blend, this is a deliciously full-bodied wine. There is a smoky character as well as a creamy texture. The wine is young and fruity but ready to drink, although it will be better from 2018.
title: Casa da Passarella 2016 Branco White (DÃ£o)

description: The wine is soft, fruity and only light in texture. So although there are tannins, they are surrounded by superripe fruit. There is a touch of pepper from the alcohol that gives a burning sensation. Drink now.
title: Adega Mayor 2013 Monte Mayor Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Also known for its sparkling wines, the small region of Bucelas, just north of Lisbon, specializes in Arinto. This rich wine brings out the citrus and white fruits of the grape along with an extra depth of flavor that will allow it to age. Drink now, but also wait until 2016.
title: Quinta da Romeira 2013 Prova RÃ©gia Reserva Arinto (Bucelas)

description: Named after the Knights Templar who were headquartered in the Tejo region of Portugal in the Middle Ages, this estate has produced a fruity, soft and rounded white wine. It has an attractively aromatic character from the inclusion of Riesling and Moscatel in the blend. Wait until the end of 2015 before drinking.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2014 Herdade dos TemplÃ¡rios Branco White (Tejo)

description: Rustic, barnyard aromas give a wine that is tight with tannins and tough to handle. It is concentrated, very dry with only hints of rich black fruits. It will probably remain dense and tannic.
title: Casa Santa VitÃ³ria 2013 Reserva Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a soft wine just lightly fruity and with a spicy texture. It is ready to drink.
title: Casa Batoreu 2015 Arinto (Tejo)

description: With many characteristics of the granite-soil based DÃ£o, this is a dense, mineral and dark fruited wine. It has blackberry and plum-skin fruits as well as a firm, tannic core. Even though it's tightly structured now, it is drinkable, but would benefit from another year's aging.
title: Caves AlianÃ§a 2010 Vista Reserva Touriga Nacional (Beiras)

description: A ripe, smooth wine made mainly from Viosinho and Gouveio, this is creamy-textured, rich with yellow fruits. It is cut by crisper acidity and a delicious, refreshing lemon-curd flavor. Drink now.
title: Quevedo 2016 Oscar's White White (Douro)

description: This ripe perfumed wine is soft with attractive melon and kiwi fruit flavors. It is gently textured, spicy and with just enough acidity. There is a touch of pepper at the end.
designation: Companhia das LezÃ­rias Herdade de Catapereiro Single Vineyard Escolha
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Companhia das LezÃ­rias Herdade de Catapereiro Single Vineyard Escolha White (Tejo)

description: It is unusual to find a 100% Tinta CÃ£o because (in regional slang) this vine is a dog to manage due to its wild vigorous nature. The wine with its tight tannins and layers of mint from the wood aging is dense and concentrated if also peppery and very powerful. It works well in the warm Alentejo region, giving a dark firm wine that is ready to drink.
title: Terras de Alter 2012 Morde Tinta CÃ£o (Alentejano)

description: The local white grape of Bairrada, Bical is normally used for sparkling wines, but here makes a light, fruity still bottling. It has a tangy orange-zest texture and crisp apple fruits, finishing with classic acidity. Drink the wine now.
title: Campolargo 2014 Branco ClÃ¡ssico Bical (Bairrada)

description: This is lightâ€”the Ten in the name refers to its alcohol levelâ€”dry, crisp and fragrantly fresh. It is citrus dominant and deliciously refreshingâ€”a wine that livens up the palate.
title: Casal PaÃ§o Padreiro 2011 Aphros Ten Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: Wood-aged wine that shows pedigree and style. It has red berry fruit flavors, firm tannins along with acidity and a dry core. It's a serious wine, for aging over 4â€“5 years.
title: Castello d'Alba 2008 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Rich and ripe, with soft tannins and black plum flavors. It is round, while still having a core of attractive tannins. The fruit dominates, giving a friendly, accessible wine.
title: Alente 2007 Premium Red (Alentejo)

description: This is a dense wine from the Perescuma estate in the southeast Alentejo. It is going to take a while to mature. At the moment, tannins dominate the potential of the black fruits. Oak aging has given this wine extra depth. It's going to be a fine wine, but needs time. Drink from 2018.
title: Perescuma 2014 Red (Alentejano)

description: This big and bold wine exudes power and fruitiness. It has ripe fruits, sweet tannins and a great mix of spice, toasty wood and acidity. Both juicy and structured, it's likely to develop well. Drink from 2016.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2011 BridÃ£o Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: This is a ripe, fruity wine full of wild strawberry fruit. It is soft although with fine acidity and a crisp aftertaste. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa Cadaval 2015 Vinha Padre Pedro RosÃ© (Tejo)

description: This is a deliciously creamy wine with light white fruits and refreshing acidity. With its cool texture and minerality, it is crisp and zesty and ready to drink.
title: Quinta dos MurÃ§as 2016 Assobio Branco White (Douro)

description: From an estate in the far west of the Cima Corgo region, close to Regua, this wine is structured and deliciously ripe in black fruits. It has a solid base of tannins that is allied to perfumed acidity and a hint of wood aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta Seara d'Ordens 2014 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Normally found in the DÃ£o region further north, the Alfrocheiro in Alentejo produces a soft wine with light tannins and juicy acidity. Flavors of cherries and red plums give it a fruity aspect. It is warm, rich and ready to drink.
title: Terras de Alter 2013 Terra d'Alter Alfrocheiro (Alentejano)

description: A darkly tannic wine, this is very firm and dense. Its red-berry fruit palate shows some of the perfume of Touriga Nacional, and its a concentrated wine that needs at least three-years aging.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2010 Cardal Red (Tejo)

description: Proudly boasting that there were no added sulphites in the winemaking process, this is a structured wine, firm with tannins that are backed with some juicy berry fruits. It is made to be drunk young although, in fact, it will be better with another six months of bottle aging, so wait until mid- 2016.
title: Terras de Alter 2014 Terra d'Alter Zero SO2 AragonÃªs (Alentejano)

description: This super-ripe wine is laced with powerful black fruits and spice from wood aging. It is forward and bold, not holding back in flavors and richness. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2015 BridÃ£o Reserva Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: A blend of Aragonez and Syrah, this ripe wine offers red fruits and a soft texture, with just enough acidity to keep it crisp at the end. It is ready to drink.
title: Herdade do EsporÃ£o 2015 Defesa do EsporÃ£o RosÃ© (Alentejano)

description: A soft, gentle wine, this is clean and purely fruity. With ripe pear and apple flavors, it gets a tang of lemon acidity. It's already drinkable, but could age for several more months.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2010 Arinto Arinto (Lisboa)

description: This perfumed, juicy wine is bright with red berries and acidity, while a core of firmer tannins gives structure. Even with this, the wine is forward, ready to drink with its long-drawn fruitiness and acidity.
title: Quinta do Pinto 2012 Vinhas do Lasso Colheita Seleccionada Red (Lisboa)

description: Half-and-half Arinto and FernÃ£o Pires, this ripe wine has lemon and pineapple fruits, along with tangy acidity. A strong herbal character gives lift as well as crispness. Drink the wine from mid-2017.
title: Quinta do Pinto 2015 Vinhas do Lasso Colheita Seleccionada White (Lisboa)

description: A blend of 50/50 Touriga Nacional an CastelÃ£o, this is a firm, structured wine. It has plenty of ripe blackberry fruits that are beginning to fill out and mature. It has a juicy character: ripe and full of sun. Drink now, although the wine will be better from 2017.
title: Caves Velhas 2013 CabeÃ§a de Toiro Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: From vines in the upper Douro region (the Cima Corgo), this is ripe and soft. It has attractive juicy black fruits and soft tannins. There is a juicy, perfumed character from the Touriga Nacional in the blend. Drink the wine now.
title: Caves Velhas 2012 Alma Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Big and fruity, this is a forward and fresh wine. It has all the weight of ripe Touriga Nacional, perfumed and rich with blackberry fruits. A soft tannic background gives structure to the immediately attractive acidity and fruitiness.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2012 BridÃ£o Colheita Seleccionada Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: This is a tight, mineral-driven wine that's very textured. Its fruitiness comes from quince and pear skins with a definite structure. It is young, most likely requiring aging over at least 18 months.
title: Caves AlianÃ§a 2012 Quinta da Garrida Reserva Branco White (DÃ£o)

description: This light and fruity wine has 80% Baga in its blend. It is juicy, full of acidity and bright with red-berry fruitiness. The wine is immediately attractive and ready to drink.
title: Campolargo 2012 Entre II Santos Red (Bairrada)

description: The name means black and white, but this wine, dominated by the local Baga grape, has more to do with black, structured, austerely dense fruit. In its dryness, it is typical of the region, a style that gives acidity and thyme flavors. Very dry aftertaste, great to cut rich food.
title: DÃ£o Sul 2004 Quinta do Encontro Preto Branco Baga (Bairrada)

description: This wood-aged blend of Arinto and Chardonnay is a fine contrast between the round toastiness of the Chardonnay and the fresher, tank-fermented Arinto. It works to give a ripe, full wine that is textured, with ripe apple flavors lifted by acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2014 Reserva Branco White (Tejo)

description: Classic Viognier with its apricot aromas and flavors, this wine is ripe, smoothly textured and with pear as well as yellow fruits. It is soft, rich and ready to drink.
title: Terras de Alter 2015 Terra d'Alter Viognier (Alentejano)

description: Balanced fresh wine, full of mango, guava and pineapple flavors. It has freshness, brightness, along with a refreshing citrus burst.
title: Quinta do Quetzal 2009 Guadalupe Branco White (Alentejano)

description: A blend of Touriga Nacional, Aragon and Syrah, the wine is open, generous and almost ready to drink. It has some firm tannins along with lifted acidity. The black currant fruits are fresh, right up front and give the wine its delicious fruitiness. Drink from late 2016.
title: Adega MÃ£e 2013 Dory Red (Lisboa)

description: In homage to a major product of the region, this wine has a cork label. It has considerable power, an old-fashioned, astringent wine that keeps the typical ultradry tannins as a sign of its ability to age. The fruit is definitely in second place here, although there are concentrated black fruits in the background. Age for 3â€“4 years.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2003 Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: Already showing signs of maturity, this is a full, ripe wine, with licorice and black fruit flavors, hinting also at coffee. The wood gives firm but dusty tannins, leaving an openness to the wine, along with an element of spiciness. The aftertaste is full and dry, with good acidity.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2004 Red (Douro)

description: Bitter chocolate and dried apricots vie with each other in this curious wine. It is certainly too big and rich for its own good, a blockbuster of a wine, but without the complexity that could compensate. What is here are very ripe plums, and a layer of dry, bitter tannins.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2004 SousÃ£o (Estremadura)

description: This is a rich, full-bodied and generous wine. It has great red berry flavors that are supported by a light oak character and freshened with acidity. Although young, it is ready to drink.
title: Fiuza 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: This comes from a field blend of old vines. It has a crisp and herbal character that is still young and still very fruity. Tangy and zesty, the wine is concentrated while also light and bright. Drink from 2017.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas White (Douro)

description: This is a young tawny (in this case, on average five-years-old) that has kept all its fruit and just added perfumed dried fruits and touches of spice and attractive oxidation from the wood aging. The wine is soft, ripe and easy to drink.
title: Borges NV Reserva Tawny  (Port)

description: This is a soft style of DÃ£o, focusing on fruit rather than structure. That gives ripe black-cherry flavors, acidity and a warm open texture. Made from a blend of all the local red grapes, it is rich and ready to drink.
title: Caminhos Cruzados 2014 Titular Colheita Red (DÃ£o)

description: Produced from the Espadeiro, a grape widely used in red Vinho Verde, this is a crisp wine with just a touch of candied sweetness. Strawberry fruit is given a blast of acidity. It is ready to drink.
title: Quinta de Gomariz 2015 Espadeiro Colheita Seleccionada RosÃ© (Vinho Verde)

description: A new wine to join the considerable range from EsporÃ£o, this is an unusual blend of Touriga Franca and Cabernet Sauvignon. It gives a wine with firm tannins as well as bold red fruits and acidity. It should probably age for a few more months, so drink from 2018.
title: Herdade do EsporÃ£o 2015 EsporÃ£o Colheita Red (Alentejano)

description: From an estate in the far west of the Cima Corgo region, close to Regua, this wine is structured and deliciously ripe in black fruits. It has a solid base of tannins that is allied to perfumed acidity and a hint of wood aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta Seara d'Ordens 2014 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is a ripe, creamy wineâ€”a fine example of the richness Alvarinho can attain. It has fine fruitiness, citrus, ripe apple and pear flavors balanced by a mineral texture and acidity. Drink this fine wine from 2018.
title: Aveleda 2016 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: The wine brings out a strongly herbal, tangy character in this perfumed grape. With spice and intense acidity, the wine is still young, still with a closed character. This needs to be drunk from late 2017 or even 2018.
title: Herdade do EsporÃ£o 2016 V Verdelho (Alentejano)

description: A blend of Roupeiro and Alvarinho (the two varieties in the name of the wine), this is a smooth wine, ripe with bright fruit and acidity. It has a crisp flavor that balances the warm fruitiness. Ready to drink, although it will be better from 2017.
title: Herdade do EsporÃ£o 2015 2 Duas Castas White (Alentejano)

description: This classic Portuguese blend from five grapes is rich and opulent. Although the firm tannins need time to soften, the rounded, powerful black fruits are all there along with balanced acidity. Drink from 2019.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2015 Coudel Mor Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: Rounded and ripe, this attractive, rich wine shows wood aging, ripe tannins and a firmer, drier core. Solid and dense, it has good acidity as well as a tight texture. The wine will need further aging, so don't drink before 2016.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2012 Cardal Red (Tejo)

description: This appealing blend of Touriga Nacional and Aragonez gives a fresh, crisp red fruited wine. Just the right amount of acidity produces a light, bright aftertaste.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2013 Mariana RosÃ© (Alentejano)

description: The two grapes here are more commonly found in the Douro. Here in the south of Portugal, they give a softer characterâ€”less mineral more ripe apple and pear fruitiness. The aftertaste does keep the delicious wine bright and lively.
title: Herdade do EsporÃ£o 2016 Duas Castas Roupeiro-Viosinho White (Alentejano)

description: A blend of Sauvignon Blanc and FernÃ£o Pires, this crisp, lightly herbaceous wine has a soft texture and attractive, creamy acidity. Hints of yellow fruits come through deliciously at the end.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Companhia das LezÃ­rias Catapereiro Escolha White (Tejo)

description: The popular MarquÃªs de Borba brand is a soft, ripe, very accessible wine. With a light touch of wood aging, it follows easily through with cherry and red plum fruits, a deliciously mouthwatering aftertaste.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2009 MarquÃªs de Borba Red (Alentejo)

description: Winemaking at the aristocratic Santar estate is run by Global Wines. This rich wine, dominated by the high-quality Encruzado grape, is poised between crisp apple fruitiness and toast from wood aging. At two years old, the wine is just ready to drink although it will be better from 2018.
title: Global Wines 2015 Casa de Santar Branco Reserva White (DÃ£o)

description: Also known as Tinta Amarela in the Douro, Trincadeira gives wines with firm structure while also having a juicy fruit acidity. This wine, with its red berries and red currant flavors fits the bill, a fresh wine that also has weight and density. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2013 BridÃ£o Trincadeira (Tejo)

description: The wine is smooth and creamy, its acidity just pointing up the ripe apple and pineapple fruit flavors. It does have a crisp citrus edge that just freshens the aftertaste. This is a wood-aged wine, the toast giving a light spice and nutmeg character. Drink this attractive wine now.
title: Quinta da Romeira 2014 Prova RÃ©gia Reserva Arinto (Bucelas)

description: The wine is all fruit, so fresh and crisp and light. Sliced apples and sharp lime juice are swirled around with so much acidity that the wine just dances in the glass. This is delicious and ready to drink.
title: Casa de Vila Verde 2014 Pluma Alvarinho (Minho)

description: The heavy bottle is probably a good proportion of the price of this wineâ€”an unnecessary affectation. The wine itself is firm and structured, perfumed with typical Touriga Nacional violet aromas and rich. With its dense texture and juicy black plum fruits, it is still coming together, so don't drink before 2017.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2013 BridÃ£o Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: This is a fresh wine that is balanced between solid tannins and the ripe red berry fruits. Made to be drunk young, it has juicy acidity along with a firm mineral texture. Pure fruitiness shines at the end. Drink from late 2016.
title: Caminhos Cruzados 2013 Titular Tinto Red (DÃ£o)

description: The wine is tannic and structured, with a dry character that masks the juicy black currant fruits that are there at the back. It shows its wood aging in spice and toast. The wine is ready to drink, although it will always be tannic.
title: Herdade da Capela 2011 Vila Alice Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: More commonly found in the DÃ£o region, the Alfrocheiro is sometimes called the Pinot Noir of Portugal for its smooth, red cherry flavors and sometimes earthy character. Those attributes are found in this cherry-flavored wine with its bright acidity and fruitiness. The whole effect is spoiled by a green edge that shows tight tannins at the end.
title: Terras de Alter 2014 Terra d'Alter Alfrocheiro (Alentejano)

description: A full and rich wine, almost too powerful and concentrated. It has great solid tannins, dark plum and chocolate flavors and a dense texture. It does need aging, so drink from 2016.
title: Cooperativa Reguengos de Monsaraz 2011 Alente Premium Red (Alentejo)

description: This full-bodied selection hails from the same region as Vinho Verde, offering creamy apricot and ripe white-fruit notes. It has great depth of flavor, with toast and spice tones as well as fragrant acidity.
title: DÃ£o Sul 2011 Quinta de Lourosa White (Minho)

description: A typical Douro blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Tinta Barroca, this wine is all about bright, crisp fruit. Black and red currant flavors come with tight acidity and a juicy character. Tightly wound now, it needs a few more months to calm down. Drink from 2018.
title: Alves de Sousa 2014 Caldas Red (Douro)

description: Known in Spain as Graciano, this grape produces attractive, fruity wine especially in the Tejo region. This example is ripe with layers of acidity as well as a generous texture. Soft and smooth, it is ready to drink.
title: Fiuza 2015 Red (Tejo)

description: Get past the meaty aromas and the wine is smooth, caramel and spice flavored. The wood flavors are prominent suggesting the wine has been aged well. At the end, berry fruits and acidity come through.
title: Borges NV Porto Tawny Reserve  (Port)

description: This fruity young wine has a ripe spring in its step. It has red-berry fruitiness as well as sweeter candied fruits balanced by an edge of spirit and acidity. This is an easy style of Port, ready to drink at any time.
title: Borges NV Reserva Ruby  (Port)

description: A dense wine that is structured and concentrated, it has black fruits and dusty tannins under juicy acidity. With hints of the wood aging and fine berry fruits, the wine will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Fiuza 2015 Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: Pure Arinto from the Lisbon region, this wood-aged wine is delicious and Chardonnay-like in its richness, with great swathes of apples and cream flavors, layered with toast. This is a great advertisement for a neglected region in Portugal's viticulture.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2005 Morgado Santa Catherina Arinto (Bucelas)

description: Port made from white grapes is a great cocktail base (think white Port and Tonic for a start) as well as a delicious drink in its own right. This wine, well poised between sweet and dry, is a rich golden color, with dried apricot and plenty of fresh citrus to give it a crisp texture. Drink now.
title: Borges NV Reserva Branco  (Port)

description: This wine is fruity, rich and well structured, with tannins that are already integrated with the fruit. Juicy and fruity, it is going to be delicious as it develops. Drink from 2019.
title: Calheiros Cruz 2014 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Get past the meaty aromas and the wine is smooth, caramel and spice flavored. The wood flavors are prominent suggesting the wine has been aged well. At the end, berry fruits and acidity come through.
title: Borges NV Porto Tawny Reserve  (Port)

description: A densely tannic wine, dry with bitter dark cocoa and black fruit flavors. The concentration of fruit and tannin is impressive, and gives considerable complexity of fruit as it powers alongside the dryness. It needs aging for the rough edges to smooth out, probably 2â€“3 years.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2004 Montes Claros Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: With its well-integrated scents of cedar, plum and tobacco, this is a medium-weight wine whose hallmark is its balance. Vanilla and dried spices meld nicely with cherry and plum fruit, finishing smooth, with modest tannins. Drink now-2008.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2000 Cado Red (Douro)

description: This has great fruits and plenty of structure to go with it. Juicy plum flavors complement the dense tannins, mineral structure and concentrated texture. It's a stylish wine that will develop some more. Drink from 2016.
title: Quinta da Rede 2010 Rede Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Tropical fruits are cut with citrus acidity in this warm, ripe wine that has rich fruitiness as well as a crisper texture. The wine is bright while also full and rounded in the mouth. Drink now.
title: Fiuza 2016 Premium Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

description: The Alvarinho grape, more at home in northern Portugal, makes a fine wine in the Alentejo hill country northeast of Lisbon. Here the flavors are tropical: ripe pineapple, a touch of spice and just the right amount of acidity. The wine will be better from 2017.
title: Terras de Alter 2015 Terra d'Alter Alvarinho (Alentejano)

description: This is a full-bodied, ripe and perfumed wine. Rich melon and white peach are balanced with bright lemon and lime to give a warm, generous wine. The acidity keeps everything deliciously in place.
title: Terras de Alter 2015 Terra d'Alter Verdelho (Alentejano)

description: Alicante Bouschet gives a definite farmyard character to this wine. It also offers juicy berry fruits and balanced acidity. The two characteristics put the wine firmly on a food friendly side.
title: Roquevale 2007 Tinto da Talha Grande Escolha Red (Alentejano)

description: The estate, created at the beginning of the last century, has produced a soft wine that has generous tannins, black currant, and red fruits. The acidity and the spice both leave a perfumed aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Casa Batoreu 2015 Red (Tejo)

description: This is ripe and fruity, a wine that is smooth while still structured. Firm tannins are filled out with juicy red berry fruits and freshened with acidity. It's  already drinkable, although it will certainly be better from 2016.
title: Quinta dos Avidagos 2011 Avidagos Red (Douro)

description: Verdelho and Sauvignon Blanc hangs together easily on this herb-dominant wine. The texture has a creamy character, showing green fruits, lively acidity and a bright orange-zest aftertaste.
title: Quinta do Portal 2012 Verdelho and Sauvignon Blanc White (Douro)

description: It is the 30% Alicante Bouschet in the blend that gives the dense color to this ripe wine. Concentrate and rich, the generous berry flavors are balanced by a more restrained acidity and smoky flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Santos & Seixo 2014 Santos da Casa Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Structured and with solid tannins, this is a wood- and spice-laden wine. Its fruit lies somewhere behind all this structure and is likely to remain there.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Dona Helena Reserva Red (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: Rounded but also fruity, this soft wine is perfumed, hinting at white flowers and tropical fruits. While the acidity is low, the fruit is easy, ripe and lightly structured.
title: Caves AlianÃ§a 2006 Galeria Bical (Bairrada)

description: Smooth red-berry fruits give this wine a glow of ripeness. The blend of Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Alicante Bouschet is dense and full of dark berries, with a touch of wood aging to smooth everything out. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Fortissimo Red (Alentejano)

description: The quinta for this wine is on the plateau north of the Douro river. It has produced a red-fruit wine, rich with soft tannins and juicy fruitiness. The wood aging is already well integrated into this bold, ripe wine. Drink now.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2015 Porrais Red (Douro)

description: The fresh acidity typical of FernÃ£o Pires is broadened by wood aging to yield a wine that has peach, apricot and green-fruit flavors, enhanced by floral aromas. There is a final, mineral texture.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2011 Falcoaria FernÃ£o Pires (Tejo)

description: The pink hue is a little flat. That also applies to the palate, with the fruit showing some maturity and hinting at wood aging. It's a rounded style, full in the mouth, with ripe caramel flavors at the end. Drink now.
title: PoÃ§as NV PoÃ§as Pink  (Port)

description: This is a fruity, juicy wine with wood and bright red fruits in equal balance. The entry-level wine made by a grouping of 19 growers, it has concentration along with minerality and acidity. It needs to age further, so drink from 2018.
title: Lavradores de Feitoria 2014 TrÃ¨s Bagos Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Rustic aromas are followed by rough-edged fruitiness in this young wine. It has ripe berry fruits as well as some firm tannins in the background. It is not yet integrated and needs to develop much more. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2012 Porrais Red (Douro)

description: Always an easy, light and fruity wine, this is full of peach and apple flavors. It is lightly textured with tangy orange zest and full of fresh, crisp acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2014 MarquÃªs de Borba Branco White (Alentejo)

description: A blend of Chardonnay and Arinto, this wood-aged wine is rich and packed with both toast and fruit flavors. Vanilla and apple and citrus acidity are generously pulled together by the mineral texture and ripe structure. The wine will be best from 2017.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2015 Reserva Branco White (Tejo)

description: This is a dark- colored, smoothly ripe wine. With wood spice and with plenty of blackberry fruitiness, it's both structured and generous. The acidity it gets from the Touriga Nacional in the blend gives it a crisp aftertaste and the possibility of further aging. Drink now or from 2018.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 Touriga Nacional-Merlot-Syrah Red (Tejo)

description: This is a solid mineral and tannin dominated wine. It has black currant fruits which are still buried by the tense tannins and stalky texture. It therefore needs some time to develop and broaden out. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2011 Pomares Red (Douro)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: Towards the western end of the Douro vineyards, Avidagos is a fine place for table wines. This young, ripe and rounded wine is made to be drunk young. It has great black fruits and acidity that are linked by the firm tannin background. The wine will be ready from the end of 2016.
title: Quinta dos Avidagos 2014 Avidagos Red (Douro)

description: Light wood aging over six months has given this wine a polished character. Along with the rich black-plum fruits and acidity, it is a full-bodied wineâ€”a very Portuguese blend of five varieties. The tannins keep the wine in shape and add to its ripe structure. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Palha Canas Red (Lisboa)

description: This blend of AntÃ£o Vaz and Verdelho is rich and creamy with spice and green plum flavors given a boost by vanilla and ginger flavors. There's a fine perfumed aftertaste from the Verdelho.
title: Luis Duarte 2012 Rapariga da Quinta Branco White (Alentejano)

description: While Alicante Bouschet is probably more at home in the Alentejo, this wine from the coastal Lisboa region still has much of the dark color, solid, dry tannins and intensely juicy wild-berry fruits. It is ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Grand'Arte Alicante Bouschet (Lisboa)

description: This second wine from DÃ£o Sul's Douro quinta shows the bright fruity side of the region. It's a lively, fresh, red fruit flavored wine, with soft tannins and a ready to drink feel.
designation: Quinta das Tecedeiras Flor de Tecedeiras
title: DÃ£o Sul 2008 Quinta das Tecedeiras Flor de Tecedeiras Red (Douro)

description: Pear and tangerine notes give this wine an immediately fruity character. It has bright acidity, with a fresh and crisp palate. The fruit is right up front, with a soft aftertaste.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Andreza CÃ³dega do Larinho White (Douro)

description: This is an open, soft, ripe and fruity wine. With a finely integrated tannic structure and plenty of red fruits and acidity, it is a generous full wine that is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Lab Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: Delicious fresh citrus flavored wine, bright as a button, lively and crisp. Made from Alvarinho, there is a creamy texture with a mineral element, finishing with green plums and banana flavors.
title: BacalhÃ´a Wines of Portugal 2008 Quinta dos Loridos Branco Alvarinho (Lisboa)

description: This is a soft wine with open fruits and gentle tannins. A blend of local varieties along with Syrah, the wine is smoothly textured, generous and ready to drink.
title: Perescuma 2016 Terra Brava Red (Alentejano)

description: This new range of wines from Lagoalva features typical Portuguese tiles (azulejos) on the label. Inside the bottle, this wine is fruity with soft tannins, spice and red-berry flavors. It has a juicy aftertaste that blends with the fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2015 Lagoalva Vinho Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Away from its native vineyard in the north of Portugal, the Alvarinho becomes extra rich and ripe in the hot center. That's the case here with a soft wine that has apple and pear flavors. It is light on the acidity, always fruity and easy to drink with food. Drink now.
title: Herdade das Servas 2016 Alvarinho (Alentejano)

description: There is a rich blend of Aragonez, Touriga Nacional, Trincadeira and Syrah in this full, ripe, black-fruit tinged wine. It is already open and generous, with wood spice tones and a smooth texture. Drink now through 2018.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2012 Mariana Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: The SÃ­ria grapeâ€”a relative of Malvasia and Roupeiroâ€”is only found under this name in the mountainous eastern Beira region. This rendition is aromatic, with a tight, cool texture, tangy acidity and lime zest and apple flavors that give a crisp, fruity aftertaste.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2015 Quinta do Cardo Branco Siria (Beira Interior)

description: Spicy and juicy, this is obviously a wood-aged wine. It offers tannins, red fruits, coffee and a warm, rich character balanced by acidity that cuts through the structure. It needs some aging, so drink from 2016.
title: Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel 2012 AtlÃ¢ntico Gold Label Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: A bold, powerful wine, showing smooth, mature black-fruit flavors and rich tannins. It is soft, solid and powerfully built. Wood aging has given extra roundness and a touch of spice to the palate. Drink this wine now and until 2018.
title: Herdade dos Machados 2007 Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: Still with its firm tannins in place and with layers of wood aging flavors, this is obviously a young wine. It has a background of ripe berry fruits and acidity that will develop over the next two years. It is potentially rich and full. Drink from 2017.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Pegos Claros Colheita CastelÃ£o (Palmela)

description: One of the star grapes of the Alentejo, this is a ripe, full-bodied and deliciously juicy wine. Almost black in color, it is packed with tannins, spice, intense acidity and a fine structure. It could do with some aging, so drink from 2016.
title: Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel 2013 Alicante Bouschet (Alentejano)

description: Viosinho, more often found in the Douro, dominates this ripe and full-bodied wine. Lemon acidity is integrated into the rich yellow fruit flavors to give smoothness and roundness. The intense fruit needs to soften a little, so wait until 2016 to drink.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2013 Branco White (Lisboa)

description: This bright, fruity wine is crisp with acidity from the red-currant flavors. A blend of Aragones and Touriga Nacional, it is light with just a touch of tannin. Drink now.
title: Dona Maria-JÃºlio Bastos 2016 RosÃ© (Alentejano)

description: A blend of Arinto and AntÃ£o Vaz, this is an impressively structured and concentrated wine. Ripe and flowery, with flavors of mango and yellow fruit. The smooth yet tangy structure gives pleasure now, but also promises aging. Drink until 2019.
title: MouchÃ£o 2012 Dom Rafael Branco White (Alentejo)

description: This ripe, creamy wine contains the rare Vital in the blend. That grape gives crisp, tight acidity while the Chardonnay brings out the smoother, richer side of this balanced and fruity wine. Drink now.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2015 Quinta de Pancas Chardonnay-Arinto-Vital White (Lisboa)

description: Dense dusty tannins dominate this 100% Touriga Nacional wine, powering its black fruits and acidity. The serious structure and firm, dry core contrast with the juicy berry flavors that will give a bright character as the wine matures. Drink from 2018.
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2015 Segredos de SÃ£o Miguel Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: This is a ripe, impressively rich wine. With dense tannins, spice and layers of black fruits it is concentrated, wearing its high alcohol easily. It comes from one of the home estates of Casa Santos Lima in the heart of the Lisboa region. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Quinta do EspÃ­rito Santo Red (Lisboa)

description: Blending Touriga Franca, Syrah and Alicante Bouschet, this is an attractive young wine. With both acidity and tannins already integrated into the ripe black fruit, it is a wine to drink young.
title: Terra Silvestre 2015 Red (Tejo)

description: There is a curious petrol aroma to this wine. Even so, the red berry flavor is attractive and fresh, and the acidity is lean.
title: Herdade dos TemplÃ¡rios 2010 Colheita Seleccionada Red (Tejo)

description: Firm and concentrated, it has dense tannins that bring out a bitter, chocolate edge. Wood gives a dark toast character. With all these conflicting elements, it's hard to see the wine's future.
title: Falua 2011 Tagus Creek Reserva Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: This juicy, fruity wine comes from an estate once owned by the Knights Templar. Full of red berry flavors and acidity, it has a light touch along with a layer of tannins and signs of wood aging. It's likely to age quickly. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2012 Herdade dos Templarios Colheita Seleccionada Red (Tejo)

description: Firm layers of wood give a hard initial impression. There are hints of fruit under this plank-like character, but it will need some time to balance out, if at all.
title: Terras de Alter 2012 Terra D'Alter Alicante Bouschet (Alentejano)

description: Winemaker Francisco Olazabal, from Quinta do Vale MeÃ£o, produces this ripe, smoky wine from vineyards above the Douro River. Lab (as in Labrador) is fruity, with a cool element that brings in tannins as well as immediately attractive red fruits. Drink now.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2012 Lab Premium Red (Douro)

description: This second wine from Quinta de Roriz is ripe, structured and rich with plum fruits and sweet tannins. Some minerality brings out the texture, but the main pleasure of this wine is the great smooth fruit. It's ready to drink, although it will be better from 2016.
title: Prats & Symington LDA 2012 Prazo de Roriz Red (Douro)

description: This is a crisp, fresh and fruity wine. With its sliced apple, pink grapefruit and lemon-zest texture, it has both fruitiness and a hint of minerality from the schist of the Douro. Drink now.
title: Lemos & Van Zeller 2013 Rufo Branco White (Douro)

description: With its classic blend of Douro grapes, this is a serious, structured wine from the heart of the valley. It has a leathery edge from dry tannins along with dense black fruit and wood aging flavors. It still needs cellaring, so drink from 2017.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2012 Red (Douro)

description: The Loureiro is the grape of the Lima Valley subregion in Vinho Verde. The texture of the wine is rounded and creamy, although the crisp green fruits give a great bright lift to this delicious, fresh wine.
title: Quinta do Ameal 2009 Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: Because this producer is in the southern Minho region, away from the northern Alvarinho vineyards, the wine is registered as Minho rather than Vinho Verde. But it has the same fine fruit and creamy richness that is typical of this grape. It could age a little longer, so wait until late 2017.
title: Quinta da Lixa 2016 Pouco Comum Alvarinho (Minho)

description: This is the entry-level wine at Passadouro, with generous fruits and black plum flavors. It has spice from the wood aging along with generous tannins that don't detract from the rich nature and open fruits. The aftertaste shows a wine that is ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Passadouro 2013 Passa Red (Douro)

description: The blend of Vinho Verde's two top grapes brings out great swathes of crisp acidity as well as vibrant citrus flavors. The wine is delicious while also tense with minerality. That will soften over the next few months, so drink the wine starting from late 2017.
title: Quinta de Soalheiro 2016 Allo Loureiro-Alvarinho White (Minho)

description: This wood-aged wine is ripe, lightly toasty and definitely spicy. It has a creamy, rounded texture that is rich and zingy, layering acidity with citrus and yellow fruits. Drink this wine from 2017.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2015 Arinto-Chardonnay Reserva White (Tejo)

description: This 100% Alvarinho comes from the grape's heartland in the north of the Vinho Verde region. It is crisp while also having concentrated green and citrus fruits, a rich mineral texture and layers of beautifully refreshing acidity. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Santos & Seixo 2016 Santos da Casa Reserva Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: An earthy wine, softly fruity, with cantaloupe melon and pear flavors. It's simple, attractive, light.
title: Caves AlianÃ§a 2010 Galeria Bical (Bairrada)

description: This is a richly structured wine. With its juicy red fruits and generous structure, it is delicious now. Berry flavors and acidity go with the mineral edge of the texture to create a wine that is packed with acidity, tannins and fruit. Drink now.
title: Casa da Passarella 2014 Tinto Red (DÃ£o)

description: This is a ripe, lemon and orange zest-driven wine. It has a lightly mineral texture that gives structure as well as a cool feel. It's a delicious wine already but will be better by late 2014.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2013 MarquÃªs de Borba Branco White (Alentejo)

description: This blend of Arinto and Chardonnay is crisp and fresh, showing the cool, ocean climate of the Lisboa region in its light, bright texture. It is juicy with peach and pineapple flavors cut by lime-juice acidity. Drink now.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2014 Quinta de Pancas Branco White (Lisboa)

description: A ripe and soft blend of Portuguese grapes with a touch of Viognier, this is a smooth, creamy textured wine. The acidity is just right to give the wine its tight, steely aftertaste. Drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 MarquÃªs de Borba White (Alentejo)

description: Crisp and fresh, the wine is bright and fruity. It has strong green and white fruit flavors that are given a boost by the touch of vanilla. It's a food wine, dry, fragrant and ready to drink.
title: Terras de Alter 2012 Terra D'Alter Siria (Alentejano)

description: This is a deliciously fruity wine with tropical fruit tones, a light mineral texture and fine, crisp acidity. From vines planted at 1500 feet above the river, it is fresh, cool and ready to drink.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2014 Fronteira Branco White (Douro)

description: This hugely structured wine is solid with tannins. It has a dark, dry texture that is still masking the potential of the fruits. It is developing those blackberry flavors slowly and will need some time. Drink from 2019.
title: Herdade Grande 2013 Red (Alentejano)

description: Named after the Portuguese word for the sommelier's tastevin, the wine is rich with juicy red fruits. It has a firm structure that emphasizes the wine's youth showing that it should develop. Densely textured at the end, the wine will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Scancio Reserva Touriga Nacional-Syrah Red (Lisboa)

description: A big, ripe and spicy wine that is full of red fruit notes and gentle tannins. It is open and accessible, its fruit juiciness already a pleasure to taste. There is fresh acidity on the finish. Drink now through 2019.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Companhia das LezÃ­rias Catapereiro Escolha Red (Tejo)

description: Cabernet Sauvignon in the cool Lisboa region has a similarity to Bordeaux. It gives a structured, black currant flavored wine, with firm tannins, a mineral texture and serious acidity. The wine is tight and should age well. Drink from 2014.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2010 Quinta de Pancas Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)

description: This producer, based in the Lisboa region, has branched out into the Alentejo to source this rich, generously ripe wine. With its full-bodied plum and spice flavors, it is soft with a light touch of tannin. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Monte das Promessas Red (Alentejano)

description: Soft and fruity, this has broad red-fruit flavors. Acidity, light tannins and a ripe, perfumed character from the blend of Syrah and Touriga Nacional make it rich and warming.
title: Wine with Spirit 2013 Bread & Cheese Red (Lisboa)

description: The wine is full of the warmth of the Alentejo sun. While it does have a crisp and juicy side, it is the richness and concentration that makes it attractive. Black fruits and toast from the oak aging are balanced and cut through with acidity. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Monte das Promessas Red (Alentejano)

description: Floral, crisp, this wine hints at spice, showing green and yellow fruit acidity, cut grass aromas, and dried apricot sweetness. It is relatively full, but this doesn't detract from the apÃ©ritif-like freshness.
title: Herdade do EsporÃ£o 2007 Verdelho (Alentejano)

description: A blend of Viognier and Arinto, this wine is given another dimension from wood aging. A smoky character adds complexity to ripe apricot and crisp quince flavors. This is juicy and rich while having a refreshing aftertaste.
title: Casa Cadaval 2013 Padre Pedro Reserva Branco White (Tejo)

description: This is a rounded smooth wine. It does have a crisp edge of red currants and acidity but the main flavor comes from the ripe red-berry fruits and touch of caramel. Drink the wine now.
designation: Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel Colheita Seleccionada
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2016 Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel Colheita Seleccionada RosÃ© (Alentejano)

description: A finely ripe wine, full of yellow fruits and spice, with baked apple character that gives the wine extra richness. The fruit is right up front, finishing with light pepper.
title: Quinta das Marias 2015 Encruzado (DÃ£o)

description: Blending Chardonnay and Arinto, this wine has come with a fine balance between a creamy texture and bright acidity. It is ripe, fruity with a soft character that also has an aromatic element. Drink the wine from 2018.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2016 Margaride's White (Lisboa)

description: Produced at the medieval Quinta da Romeira, this ripe, tropical-fruit flavored wine has richness and a smooth texture. Full-bodied and fruity, it shows minerality from the chalk soil as well as a bright, tight fruitiness and balancing acidity.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2012 Prova RÃ©gia Premium Arinto (Bucelas)

description: Tight, taut, crisp and mineral in character, this is the epitome of a lemon-flavored wine. It is totally fresh, bright and full of green fruits and a tangy character. One in a series of single variety wines from Vilacetinho.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2012 Arinto (Vinho Verde)

description: Bright and fruity, this has a good balance of lemon and ripe pear flavors. It is a light wine, crisp but with a richer seam that gives it concentration. A great apÃ©ritif wine, it's ready to drink.
title: Lavradores de Feitoria 2015 TrÃªs Bagos White (Douro)

description: Full of red berries and acidity, this accessible wine has a layer of tannins that does not detract from the general fruitiness. Drink from 2019.
title: Quevedo 2014 Oscar's Red (Douro)

description: The Chardonnay in this blend dominates, giving a rich, generous feel to the wine, full of ripe plum and peach flavors. The Arinto provides fresh acidity that is behind the warm fruits. Full and generous, it is a wine that needs to age	 drink from the end of 2016.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2014 Margaride's White (Tejo)

description: Almost black in color, this densely ripe wine is powered by wood aging and dark tannins. The blend of Syrah, Alicante Bouschet, Aragonez and Cabernet Sauvignon is tough, firm and tannic while also having big, bold juicy black plum flavors. Drink from 2017.
title: Perescuma 2013 Red (Alentejano)

description: Reserva in the case of this wine means both a selection of wines and also aging in wood. That gives this ripe wine full spice as well as apricot flavors. It is a creamy, rounded wine, just lit by acidity at the end. Drink from 2018.
title: Casa de Cambres 2016 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: It's rare to find such a full-bodied red from the same region as Vinho Verde. This ripe and juicy wine is packed with delicious velvet plum flavors. There is acidity, but the wine is so sweet and soft. Drink over the next year.
title: Casa do Valle 2009 Homenagem Reserva Red (Minho)

description: This popular wine is about fresh fruit, vividly displayed with red cherries and red plum flavors, light tannins and easy acidity. To drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2008 MarquÃªs de Borba Red (Alentejo)

description: Encruzado is the DÃ£o's star white grape, able to produce, as here, a wine that combines a great sense of style, some weight, along with the freshest of lemon tints. There is some fullness as well, while the final taste is crisp.
title: DÃ£o Sul 2009 Cabriz Encruzado Encruzado (DÃ£o)

description: There is certainly some of the DÃ£o minerality in the texture of this wine. It's main thrust is berry fruit, which is filled out with some attractive tannins, spice from wood and final acidity.
title: DÃ£o Sul 2008 Casa de Santar Red (DÃ£o)

description: Pure Alicante Bouschet is rare in the cooler Lisboa region, but this wine certainly reveals much of the richness and intense fruit that makes this grape so popular among producers. It is a rich wine, with structure as well as fruit, that is ready to drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Aluado Alicante Bouschet (Lisboa)

description: Arinto is planted widely in the western Portuguese vineyards. It produces crisp, fruity and immediately drinkable winesâ€”bright, breezy and citrus driven. Acidity makes it refreshing, ending with a light, fresh finish.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2012 Arinto (Tejo)

description: A crisp blend of six grapes, the wine is fruity with lemon, grapefruit backed by intense acidity. It has a light tang of texture and a crisp bright character that makes a wine that is ready to drink now.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2016 Lagoalva Vinho Branco White (Tejo)

description: A rich, spicy wood-aged wine, this has as much vanilla as fruit. That gives a strongly toasty character to the wine that needs to soften to bring out the green plum and melon flavors and the acidity. It's obviously a ripe wine, leaving a pepper character from the alcohol at the end.
title: Roquevale 2011 Reserva White (Alentejano)

description: A fine and rich blend of Chardonnay and Arinto, this wine has touches of spice and vanilla as well as crisp, bright fruit tones. Citrus and yellow fruit flavors show strongly through the lacy texture of this wine, which has a cool character from the proximity of the vines to the ocean. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Quinta do Rocio White (Lisboa)

description: A generous blend of Alicante Bouschet, Touriga Nacional, Aragonez and Syrah, this is firm with tannins and packed with ripe blackberry fruits. Six months in wood added a toasty character enhancing the complexity and depth of the wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2016 Superior Red (Alentejano)

description: Rustic in character, this wine shows a bit too much alcohol, manifested by burnt and pepper notes. The acidity works hard to bring balance but ultimately is overpowered by the weight of the wine.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2011 Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: There is much of the perfumed character of Touriga Nacional in this wine that goes with the ripe, juicy black fruits and acidity. At this stage, there is a strong spice from the wood aging and this needs to soften before the wine will be ready to drink. Wait until 2018.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2014 Senses Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: Spicy and ripe, this is a wine that is soft, full in the mouth and with generous tannins. It does have a mineral edge that adds shape to the wine and crispens the black-plum flavor. Drink the wine now.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2013 Porrais Red (Douro)

description: A finely structured wine that brings forward its firm tannins, but also keeps black berry and red plum fruit flavors. It has an edge of leanness, minerality perhaps, its tannins emphasizing dryness. The balance between the structure and the fruit produces a good value wine that is on a knife edge of exciting tension.
title: JosÃ© Maria da Fonseca 2005 Domini Red (Douro)

description: This is a ripe and warm wine, with generous fruits and a structure that is cushioned by the rich black and red fruit flavors. It has light hints of wood aging, shown in the notes of spice and vanilla that have smoothed the tannins and tamed the acidity. Drink this attractive wine from 2016.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Reserva do Monte Red (Lisboa)

description: The wine is structured, flavored with the wood aging as much as the fruit. It has a spicy burnt character that contrasts with the more juicy black currant flavors. Drink from 2017.
title: Terra Silvestre 2013 Red (Tejo)

description: Young Touriga Nacional vines produced this crisp, refreshing wine. With red currant flavor and a light touch of caramel, it's both fruity and full in the mouth. Drink now.
title: Colinas do Douro 2015 Superior RosÃ© (Douro)

description: A smooth, rounded wine, with depth of black berry, dark plum and licorice flavors. It is solid, chunky, powerfully ripe, full of pepper, spice as well as sweet acidity. Very enticing and rich.
title: Fitapreta Vinhos 2007 Fitapreta Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: There is a slight prickle that gives a surprise lift to this dry wine. Along with that is crisp fruit (lemon and apple flavors) and a refreshing amount of acidity. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Raza 2016 Dom Diogo Arinto (Vinho Verde)

description: The wine is ripe and very full in the mouth. With tannins that are enveloped by rich black fruit, it is already drinkable. Dense plum and strawberry flavors are generous, with a touch of pepper. It is ready to drink.
title: Sobredos 2011 Aneto Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This attractive, fruity blend includes perfumed Syrah and juicy Alicante Bouschet. Touches of wood aging add spice and light tannins to this wine that is young but ready to drink.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Mula Velha Premium Red (Lisboa)

description: Ripe apricot and pear flavors give this wine a rich character. It is packed with fruits with a creamy texture and balanced acidity at the end. This crisp wine is ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Aluado Chardonnay (Lisboa)

description: Oak aging in large barrels has served to give this wine an immediate appeal. It's balanced, lightly structured and full of juicy fruits. Black currants, spice and red berry flavors enhance the fruitiness of the wine. Drink from mid-2016.
designation: Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel Colheita Seleccionada
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2014 Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: While this wine shows plenty of wood at this young stage, it also has good fruit and tannins. It needs some time to develop and to integrate the wood. Drink from 2020.
title: Santos & Seixo 2015 Santos da Casa Tinto Red (Douro)

description: The second label of Quinta de la Rosa is a ripe and smoothly fruity wine. Soft tannins and ample acidity harmonize well with the exuberant black fruits. It is big, rich and not needing aging	 drink this rounded wine from 2016.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2013 douROSA Red (Douro)

description: This wine already has delicious red fruits. It is soft, made to be drunk young with attractive fruitiness and light tannins. Drink this wine from 2019.
title: Casa Ferreirinha 2015 Papa Figos Red (Douro)

description: With soft acidity, this is already an attractive, warmly white wine. Orange and tangy citrus flavors are balanced by a light touch of wood aging that gives spice. It needs a few more months, so drink from the end of 2014.
title: Lavradores de Feitoria 2012 TrÃªs Bagos Branco White (Douro)

description: With the typical dark color of this red grape, this is a dense and firm wine. It has rich plum and berry flavors that are dark as well as juicy. Tannins lace the background to this already delicious wine, finishing with refreshing acidity. Drink from 2016.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Aluado Alicante Bouschet (Lisboa)

description: One of Portugal's most popular brands, this is rich, soft, solidly textured. It's a fine blend of five grapes including Syrah and Cabernet, giving a warm, enveloping feel. Acidity offers a balance, leaving a ripe, full flavored wine that needs a few months but is ready now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2012 MarquÃªs de Borba Red (Alentejo)

description: This is a jammy wine, soft and rich. It has juicy red berry fruits and a fully ripe character that's enhanced by spice. The tannins are already well integrated into the texture of the wine that is ready to drink.
title: Caves Velhas 2012 CabeÃ§a de Toiro Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: Light and fruity, this is a crisply citrus wine, soft and fresh. Grapefruit and apricots are both there, showing the crisp and the rich side to this immediately attractive wine.
title: Quintas de MelgaÃ§o 2013 Lagar Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: In the cool, high vineyards of eastern Portugal, the SÃ­ria grape seems to have found a good home. It produces a crisp, fruity wine, with lemon and ripe apple flavors. Textured, tight and delicious, it brings bright acidity and lively fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2014 Quinta do Cardo Siria (Beira Interior)

description: With layers of ripe tannins and generous red fruits, this is an attractive, fruity wine that is ready to drink. It has a smoky, meaty character that contrasts with the fine fruits. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Ribeirinha 2012 Vale de Lobos Red (Tejo)

description: A bright, tight and crisp wine that is is mineral, tangy and refreshing to drink. It hints at the ripe fruits that will develope through 2017.
title: Quinta de Santiago 2015 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: Simple and fruity, this is an immediately approachable wine. Crisp with apple and citrus fruits, it has a light mineral texture and refreshing final acidity. Drink now.
title: Terra Silvestre 2016 Arinto (Tejo)

description: Blending Touriga Franca, Syrah and Alicante Bouschet, this is an attractive young wine. With both acidity and tannins already integrated into the ripe black fruit, it is a wine to drink young.
title: Terra Silvestre 2015 Red (Tejo)

description: This wine is full of pure, fresh and crisp fruits that are delicious, fragrant, perfumed and lively. With a mineral edge, tangy texture and tight final acidity, it's a wine that could age for a few years
title: Quinta do Portal 2012 Colheita Branco White (Douro)

description: Richly ripe wine, dominated by sweet yellow fruit, although with a fine line of acidity that brings a greener element. Wood spice comes through on the finish of this full-bodied wine.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2010 Branco White (Douro)

description: Firmly structured, this has both great tannins and equally big, rich berry and black currant fruits that bring the acidity right up front. It is still young, emphasizing the fruit and freshness. The tannins and wood aging flavors need their chance. Drink from 2017.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2011 BridÃ£o Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: The wine has power, structure and density. Hard initial tannins show that it needs to age, but the black fruits come through richly as it opens up. The strong mineral character gives a firm texture to the wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2010 Parcelas Red (Douro)

description: This is a solid, structured wine, with tannins and vanilla flavors from the new-wood aging. Black-berry flavors come through slowly but they will develop as the wine ages. Drink from 2018.
title: Adega Vila Real 2013 Premium Red (Douro)

description: A reliable and immediately enjoyable wine, this is full of ripe and juicy fruit. With soft tannins and layered acidity, it has a bright and lively finish.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2011 MarquÃªs de Borba Tinto Red (Alentejo)

description: Because this producer is in the southern Minho region, away from the northern Alvarinho vineyards, the wine is registered as Minho rather than Vinho Verde. But it has the same fine fruit and creamy richness that is typical of this grape. It could age a little longer, so wait until late 2017.
title: Quinta da Lixa 2016 Pouco Comum Alvarinho (Minho)

description: A deeply colored wine, reveling in the richness of 2007, a powerhouse of berry fruits, black plums and a layer of soft wood tannins. It certainly has plenty of ripe fruit, but the smoothness of the wine is the key here, a chocolate smoothness that wraps around the powerful fruit.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2007 MarquÃªs de Borba Red (Alentejo)

description: Distinctly mineral in character, this is a tough wine with its tense tannins and firm, very dry fruitiness. Black currant and berry fruits shine through this structure giving a full, juicy character. It's a wine of power and richness, still restrained by its tight, dry texture. Drink from 2018.
title: Casa da Passarella 2011 Colheita Tinto Red (DÃ£o)
