description: This is a ripe structured wine. With red fruits, some firm well integrated tannins, it is rich with a strong mineral edge and final acidity. The wine, full of fruit, is ready to drink.
title: Colinas do Douro 2013 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: A blend of Encruzado and Gouveio, this is a soft, creamy and fruity wine. It has no wood aging, emphasizing the ripe apricot and pear fruits. The aftertaste is crisp and bright.
title: Fontes da Cunha 2015 Mondeco Branco White (DÃ£o)

description: From Sauvignon Blanc grown in the vineyards of the Mateus palace, this is a classic, herbaceous wine with attractive fresh and grassy acidity. The high altitude fruit is bright and crisp.
title: Lavradores de Feitoria 2009 TrÃªs Bagos Sauvignon Sauvignon Blanc (Duriense)

description: This chalky-textured wine has bright, citrusy acidity to contrast its warmer tropical fruit character. Balanced and fruity, it will be ready to drink from late 2017.
title: Quinta Dona Matilde 2015 Vinho Branco White (Douro)

description: Dominated by Touriga Nacional at 60% with the addition of 40% Syrah, this is a ripe, fruity wine. It is full of fresh berry fruits that are sustained by the firm tannic background. It has a ripe feel while also have a light touch of acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2013 Red (Tejo)

description: The wine is richly textured and full of ripe fruits. Crisp acidity contrasts with the warm yellow-fruit and ripe red-apple flavors. It is already a refreshing crisp wine with a fine dense texture. Drink from late 2017.
title: Manuel Carvalho Martins 2016 Golpe Branco White (Douro)

description: This rich, smooth wine is driven by its ripe fruitiness. It is warm and rounded, combining black and red fruit with a harmonizing shot of licorice. Give it a few months, but it is nearly ready to drink.
title: Terra d'Alter 2010 Red (Alentejano)

description: From a series of single variety wines from Vilacetinho, this Loureiro shows the aromatic character that has made this an increasingly popular variety for local producers. It has a delicate perfume, great acidity, and crispness and a very direct apple quality that is deliciously cool.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2012 Loureiro (Vinho Verde)

description: A blend that includes Touriga Nacional and Alfrocheiro, this is a well-structured wine. Tannins and black fruits are seamlessly integrated to give weight and richness. The acidity, the mineral texture and the density all contribute to a wine that will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Casa Anadia 2014 Colheita Red (DÃ£o)

description: A powerful and concentrated wine, this shows the region's dark and tannic side. The black plum and juicy black-currant flavors shine, and wood aging has smoothed the palate, which makes it feel dense and fully mature.
designation: Aguia Moura Em Vinhas Velhas Reserva
title: Wines & Winemakers 2008 Aguia Moura Em Vinhas Velhas Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is a dark-hued wine that brings out the structure and strong minerality of Touriga Nacional in its home region of DÃ£o. It is a powerful and dense selection, still dominated by tannins but offers plenty of perfumed fruit to balance. Drink from 2017.
title: Caves Velhas 2013 Solo Reserva Touriga Nacional (Tejo)

description: A fresh, citrus-flavored wine that is all about fruitiness. It is light, bright and tangy with orange and lemon zest. It is floral, crisp and ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Foz 2014 Vinha da Foz Branco White (Douro)

description: A rich red from the warm south of Portugal, the wine is soft, spicy and juicy. It has some oak aging that shows through the ripe red-berry fruits. The tannins are soft, just giving shape to the open, rich fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Valcatrina Red (Alentejano)

description: A ripe straw-colored wine, it has a good freshness and attractive green acidity. There is a hint of vanilla as well as apple and pear fruits. It's fruity and ready to drink.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2012 Monte da Peceguina White (Alentejano)

description: This is a deliciously fruity wine with tropical fruit tones, a light mineral texture and fine, crisp acidity. From vines planted at 1500 feet above the river, it is fresh, cool and ready to drink.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2014 Fronteira Branco White (Douro)

description: Azal is one of most widely planted vines in Vinho Verde. It gives an attractive wine, with high acidity. This wine is crisp with lemon and with a tangy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Raza 2015 Dom Diogo Colheita Seleccionada Azal (Vinho Verde)

description: While the wine is rich and fruity, it also a cool, crisp edge that comes from the nearby ocean. Red-berry fruits are shot through with acidity and a dry core of tannin. The pepper and spice flavor probably comes from the high alcohol.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 What Else? Red (Lisboa)

description: Rustic in character, this wine shows a bit too much alcohol, manifested by burnt and pepper notes. The acidity works hard to bring balance but ultimately is overpowered by the weight of the wine.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2011 Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: This big, ripe wine is well polished with a juicy, fragrant character from the spiced plums. The wood aging has resulted in deceptively soft tannins, and the delicious black fruits are still upfront. This wine could age for 2â€“3 years.
title: Luis Duarte 2011 Rapariga da Quinta Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: Oily-textured wine, flavored with mango and peaches. It's so soft and unctuous that freshness seems to have been left behind. In its place is the ripest fruit giving an open texture and an opulent aftertaste.
title: Fitapreta Vinhos 2008 Fitapreta Branco AntÃ£o Vaz (Alentejano)

description: Espirito do CÃ´a is named after the prehistoric wall drawings that decorate the cliffs of the valley. The wine is rich, dense and fruity. Blackberries and fine acidity give a tarry, dense character. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Espirto do CÃ´a Reserva Red (Douro)

description: An Alvarinho that comes from the southern Minho, close to the Douro River, this is a perfumed, ripe and richly textured wine. Pear and green plum fruits are combined with fine acidity and tangy lemon zest minerality to create a fresh while rich wine. Drink from late 2016.
title: Quinta da Lixa 2015 Pouco Comum Alvarinho (Minho)

description: This is a deliciously ripe and fruity wine. Citrus and apricot and peach flavors are given a lift by a nutty, toasty character. It is rich and full, with minerality and acidity shooting through the attractive aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Manuel Carvalho Martins 2014 Golpe Branco White (Douro)

description: With a dominance of Tinta Roriz, this is a smooth, ripe wine that has spice and blackberry fruits. It is dense and rich, packed with juicy fruitiness as well as some firm tannins. There is a burn at the end from the alcohol that does spoil the aftertaste.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2014 Fronteira Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This well-balanced ripe wine shows the hand of Pedro SÃ¢, wine and vineyard director for all Sogevinus Ports. Sweet with a hint of yeastiness and good acidity, its ripe strawberry flavors are strong and fresh. This is a pink Port wine that is ripe and fruity, finishing with both sweetness and freshness. Drink now but with this blend, Kopke doesn't rule out sip-store-sip over a couple months.
title: Kopke NV RosÃ©  (Port)

description: This is a fruity, full wine that is dominated by Arinto, giving fresh, lemon and apricot flavors. It is crisp, lightly textured and offers a bright tang of zest and acidity on the finish. Drink now.
title: Caves Velhas 2014 CabeÃ§a de Toiro Reserva White (Tejo)

description: In the Alentejo, Syrah exhibits power, body and concentration without much subtlety. So this wine is solid, tannic with considerable pepper and spice flavors that dominate the black fruits. Wood aging has softened the tannins. Acidity gives the wine a fresher finish.
title: Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel 2013 Syrah (Alentejano)

description: This rich blend brings together Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah with Touriga Nacional and Alicante Bouschet. It forms a richly textured wine that is ripe with red fruits and acidity, as well as spicy tannins. Light wood aging has smoothed out the corners of the wine. Drink from 2018.
designation: Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel Colheita Seleccionada Tinto
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2015 Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel Colheita Seleccionada Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: A brief period of wood aging delivers soft tannins and juicy blackberry fruits to this ripe wine. A streak of acidity gives the powerful wine a crisp edge. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Valcatrina by Santos Lima Red (Alentejano)

description: A young firmly tannic wine still influenced by its wood aging. The berry fruits are ripe and chunky with a licorice and nutmeg character. It needs aging over several years.
title: Borges 2009 Quinta da Soalheira Red (Douro)

description: FernÃ£o Pires with Sauvignon Blanc allows the second grape's herbal nature to shine. So it is crisp, citrusy and with intense acidity. The wine has a ripe feel with hints of tropical fruit at the end. Drink now.
designation: Companhia das Lezirias Herdade de Catapereiro Escolha
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Companhia das Lezirias Herdade de Catapereiro Escolha White (Tejo)

description: Partly wood-aged, this Alvarinho gives a smooth southern take on this northern Portuguese grape. It brings out apricot and pineapple fruits as well as the more typical lemon flavors. The acidity remains in place to give a crisp, tight aftertaste.
title: BacalhÃ´a Wines of Portugal 2013 Quinta dos Loridos Alvarinho (Lisboa)

description: This fine ripe wine is smooth and rich. Its acidity and apple-fruit aspect is balanced by richer yellow fruit and a touch of almonds. Drink this finely made wine now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Premium Branco White (Alentejo)

description: There is a toasty character to this wine with its (not unpleasant) lightly oxidized flavors. There is also perfumed fruit and flavors of ripe rich fruitiness. It is a finely structured wine, ready to drink now.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2015 Private Collection Branco Verdelho (Tejo)

description: Showcasing the richness of 2009 without sacrificing fine structure, this is stylish and concentrated. Dark black fruit accompanies a tight, minerality and a fine shaft of acidity. This single-vineyard offering is worth aging for 2â€“3 years.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2009 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: The wine has dark tannins and a firm structured texture. They act as a foil to the berry fruits and intense, young acidity. Dominated by Touriga Nacional and Aragonez, the wine has black fruits, juicy freshness and and an almost crisp aftertaste. It needs some time to fully integrate, so wait until 2017.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2013 Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: Smooth, creamy and lightly perfumed, this wine is packed with apple, pear and yellow fruit flavors that are topped with acidity. Well balanced, it is ready to drink.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2016 Evel Branco White (Douro)

description: Reliant on perfumed Touriga Nacional, this single estate wine is generous, ripe and full of black fruits. Richly tannic and structured, it has a serious side, firm and with good potential. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2013 Red (Douro)

description: This blend of Rabigato and CÃ³dega do Larinho grapes brings out the crisp acidity of a Douro white. The wine has a fragrant character with hedgerow fruits and white flower aromas. The aftertaste goes more towards yellow fruits while keeping all the freshness.
title: Quinta do Passadouro 2014 Passa White (Douro)

description: Big and bold, this is a massive Touriga Nacional, emphasizing the structure as much as the fruit. It has a rich black plum character that is paired with firm wood and fruit tannins and a ripe juicy aftertaste. It could do with a year's aging, so drink from early 2017.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2013 Senses Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: Vines grown at 1,800 feet give this wine its cool climate attitude. The granite soil gives a strong mineral character to the grapefruit and green apple flavors. With its textured almond and spice character, this is a ripe wine that is ready to drink now.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2014 douROSA Branco White (Douro)

description: This big, bold wine blends local grapes with Cabernet Sauvignon and Touriga Nacional. It has red fruits and rounded tannins that are well integrated with the fruitiness. Full in the mouth and with delicious acidity, it is ready to drink.
title: Herdade das Servas 2013 Monte das Servas Escolha Red (Alentejano)

description: This attractively fruity wine is crisp and full of red currants. Its acidity and soft caramel flavor are nicely blended with the touch of tannin and crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2016 Lagoalva Vinho RosÃ© (Tejo)

description: This relies on its ripe fruit to convey the rich flavors of the Douro. Its black fruit flavors dominate the broad tannic structure, with a light hint of wood aging. It's bold, chunky and ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Sagrado 2008 Sagrado Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Named after the rare Douro golden oriole bird (which obviously likes to eat figs), this is a bright, fruity wine with light tannins that give it a delicious fresh, red fruit character. It has a smoky edge from wood aging, finely balanced and ready to drink now.
title: Casa Ferreirinha 2014 Papa Figos Red (Douro)

description: Soft and smooth, this is a ripe and creamy wine. It has light acidity, pineapple and apricot flavors and a rounded aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 Arinto-FernÃ£o Pires White (Tejo)

description: Perfumed and lightly spicy, this is a Sauvignon Blanc that brings out the tropical fruit side of the grape. With its rich fruit and soft citrus, it is smooth and ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Monte de BaÃ­a Sauvignon Blanc (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: Full-bodied and smooth, this wine has weight, richness and a dense, rounded texture. There's some good juiciness as well, adding dark berry fruits to the soft tannins and rounded feel of the wine. Acidity at the end brings a sense of balance. Drink from 2014.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2011 Portas da Herdade Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: The full juiciness of CastelÃ£o is balanced by spice and structure from wood maturation. The result is a smooth, textured wine, firm with tannins for aging. It is rich, smoky, dry and edgy at this young stage. Drink from 2016.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Fonte do Beco CastelÃ£o (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: Part of a series highlighting the principal varieties of the Douro, this wine is made from the grape that is known as Tempranillo in Spain. It is structured and dense, with red-berry fruits and the beginnings of the smooth texture more familiar with the grape. The mineral texture and acidity give further complexity. Drink from 2018.
title: Adega Vila Real 2015 Tinta Roriz (Douro)

description: Named after an old parcel of vines on the estate, the wine is ripe, and flavored with black currant and red berry. Its tannic character and tight line of acidity gives it a crisp and fruity finish. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Noval 2013 Maria Mansa Red (Douro)

description: Made from the CÃ³dega do Larinho grape (also called SÃ­ria), this is a refreshingly rich wine. It's full in the mouth yet it retains its natural freshness, with a touch of pepper, tangy acidity and great depth of flavor. The finish bears notes of citrus, pear and green apple.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Andreza CÃ³dega do Larinho Siria (Douro)

description: This dry rosÃ© is soft and fruity. Red-berry fruit permeates a wine that also has a rich texture from lees aging giving the wine some weight. Its acidity balances all this, finishing the wine with crisp acidity.
title: Santos & Seixo 2016 Santos da Casa RosÃ© (Douro)

description: Smooth, creamy and lightly perfumed, this wine is packed with apple, pear and yellow fruit flavors that are topped with acidity. Well balanced, it is ready to drink.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2016 Evel Branco White (Douro)

description: A full-bodied wine, ripely fruity while preserving the natural, cool freshness of a Vinho Verde. It is richly endowed with apple and pear flavors, a touch of yellow fruit and a just a hint of spice. One in a series of single variety wines from Vilacetinho.
title: Casa de Vilacetinho 2012 Avesso (Vinho Verde)

description: With some concentration from skin contact during fermentation, this is a wine with richness, spice and apricot character. The palate is full with hints of toastiness, with the ripeness laced by a fresher burst of lemon acidity, resulting in an overall well-balanced wine.
title: Terra Silvestre 2012 Arinto (Tejo)

description: While the wine is rich and tarry, it has an old-fashioned feel to it that comes from the juicy tannins and touch of rusticity. That's not unattractive, a wood-aged oxidized wine that has fruit and spice to add to its allure. Drink from 2015.
title: Vidigal 2010 Reserva dos Amigos Red (Lisboa)

description: A popular Portuguese brand, this is a ripe, fruity wine that's made to be drunk young. It has fresh berry fruits and some firm tannins to support the otherwise easygoing acidity and fruitiness. Aging in large barrels has given the wine an open, ripe aftertaste. Drink from late 2016.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2014 MarquÃªs de Borba Tinto Red (Alentejo)

description: New wood aging gives this fine wine its smooth, ripe texture. It is rich and full of spice and generous tannins. It is dense with plum skin and blackberry fruits. Drink the wine from 2017.
title: Perescuma 2015 Colheita Red (Alentejano)

description: It is the ripe dark Alicante Bouschet that dominates this firmly structured wine. It is packed with tannins along with a hugely dense texture and concentrated juicy berry flavors. It is very firm, still young. Wait until 2017.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2012 Premium Red (Alentejo)

description: Putting Syrah and Touriga Nacional together is a popular blend in Alentejo, producing structured wines that also exude ripe berry fruitiness and a fine aromatic character. This wine is still young as its firm tannins are evident even as its fruit is well in place, fresh and fruity and with a rich aftertaste. Drink from late 2016.
title: Herdade do EsporÃ£o 2014 Vinha da Defesa Red (Alentejano)

description: There is something of the essential crispness and green fruit character of a Vinho Verde. But the wine also has some richness, weight, and a creamy texture. Very aromatic, this is a wine to drink and also age a few months.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Maria Papoila Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a rounded smooth wine. It does have a crisp edge of red currants and acidity but the main flavor comes from the ripe red-berry fruits and touch of caramel. Drink the wine now.
designation: Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel Colheita Seleccionada
title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2016 Herdade de SÃ£o Miguel Colheita Seleccionada RosÃ© (Alentejano)

description: This is young for an Alvarinho. Its bright fruit needs time to fill out and open its ripe texture. The elements are there in this attractive wine, so just wait until 2018.
title: Casa de Vila Verde 2016 Pluma Alvarinho (Minho)

description: The wood aging shows strongly in this spicy wine. Besides bitter tannins it also gives the wine a minty character. It is young and hopefully the fruit will develop more and fill out this structure.
title: Casa de Cambres 2014 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A fine, firm, structured wine that shows richness along with elegance. Fresh, black fruits ride over dry tannins and acidity, allowing this to be a food-friendly wine that could benefit from some aging. To finish, the lifted, vibrant fruits leave a ripe, clean taste.
title: Messias 2003 Grande Escolha Red (Douro)

description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc and FernÃ£o Pires is aromatic and ripe. Its fruitiness is tropical, with pineapple as well as apricot flavors. It's softly textured  and ready to drink.
designation: Companhia das LezÃ­rias Catapereiro Escolha Branco
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Companhia das LezÃ­rias Catapereiro Escolha Branco White (Tejo)

description: This warm, ripe wine is open and ready to drink. With its bold red fruit and generous, well-integrated tannins, it's made for barbecues. Drink now.
title: Falua 2014 Reserva Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: A soft and ripe wine with spicy red fruit flavors cushioned by a smooth texture, this has well-embedded tannins and can be drunk young.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: A bold wine, this is full of ripe tannins and black-plum fruits. The local Baga grape dominates the blend, giving its special style of firm tannins that are integrated into the rich fruits. The wine will be best from 2018.
designation: Q do E Encontro Preto Branco Reserva
title: Global Wines 2014 Q do E Encontro Preto Branco Reserva Red (Bairrada)

description: An immediately attractive fruity wine that's half-and-half Touriga Nacional and Cabernet Sauvignon. Neither of the two grapes' natural tannins show in this wine with its soft texture and blackberry fruitiness. It is ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2012 Forma de Arte Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: A fruity and attractive wine from high vineyards above the Douro valley, with acidity, red berry fruits and a touch of tannin. Made in a light, fresh style, it is ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Portal 2011 Colheita Red (Douro)

description: The scene is set by the natural herbaceous notes of Sauvignon Blanc. They follow through to the green, crisp flavors of the wine. However, it also has a more sunny feel, more tropical in character at the end. Ready to drink now.
title: Cortes de Cima 2012 Sauvignon Blanc (Alentejano)

description: This is a tight and structured wine, showing a fine balance between tannin and acidity, with dark, brooding fruit that still need time to develop. Give this wine until 2018.
title: JosÃ© Maria da Fonseca 2013 Domini Red (Douro)

description: A young firmly tannic wine still influenced by its wood aging. The berry fruits are ripe and chunky with a licorice and nutmeg character. It needs aging over several years.
title: Borges 2009 Quinta da Soalheira Red (Douro)

description: A blend of four classic Douro grapes, this is structured and firm. It has a mineral texture that gives the wine depth and concentration. Ripe red berries and balanced acidity are now mature and the wine is ready to drink.
title: Santos & Seixo 2014 Santos da Casa Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This is a ripe perfumed wine based on Verdelho and Arinto. The blend, which also includes some AntÃ£o Vaz, creates a rich character full of juicy apricot and melon fruit shot through with lime zest. It is a refreshing wine to drink now.
title: Santos & Seixo 2015 Santos da Casa Branco White (Alentejano)

description: The wine is soft and ripe. With delicious yellow fruits, a soft texture and just enough lively acidity, it is rich and fruity. There is an attractive orange zing at the end.
title: Colinas do Douro 2014 Branco White (Douro)

description: This lightly oaked wine is full of fruit, ripe with red berries and crisp with acidity, just hinting at Douro minerality. That makes for a balanced fruity wine that with its soft tannins is ready to drink.
title: Delaforce 2014 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Made principally from Touriga Nacional, this is a rich wine with attractive acidity and strawberry fruitiness. It is ripe, touched with caramel and finished with wild raspberry flavors.
title: Quinta de Covela 2013 Covela RosÃ© (Minho)

description: Vegetal, green flavors appear on a wine that doesn't balance the fruit and structure. Considering its age, it needs to be drunk now.
title: AlÃ©m 2006 Red (Alentejano)

description: Hints of oak smooth out the inherent herbal character of the grape, yielding ripe tones of apricot and pineapple. This wine is ripe and fruity and ready to drink.
title: Fiuza 2014 Premium Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)

description: A blend of typical Alentejo grapes, this is a firm effort, with the fruit laced inbetween the complex tannic structure. The acidity gives the wine a final lift.
title: Herdade do EsporÃ£o 2010 4 Quatro Castas Red (Alentejano)

description: Ripe and fruity, this is a full-bodied, intense wine. It has citrus acidity as well as more tropical fruits, laden with wood. The whole is much more than the sum of the parts, giving a full, ripe and complex wine that will age.
title: Fontes da Cunha 2011 Munda Encruzado (DÃ£o)

description: This is a wine that reveals the younger side of Moscatel in SetÃºbal. It shows honey, spice and perfumed fruitiness that contrast with the richness of the texture and its fresh peach and apricot flavors. Drink now for immediate enjoyment.
title: JosÃ© Maria da Fonseca 2010 Alambre  (Moscatel de SetÃºbal)

description: This is a finely integrated, rich wine that shows impeccable balance between dusty tannins and juicy dark berry tones. The wood aging shows through in a smooth texture that gives a sense of richness to the ripe fruit. This is an elegant wine that can be drunk now although it will benefit from some aging. Drink from 2017.
title: JosÃ© Maria da Fonseca 2013 Periquita Reserva Red (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: Rich, but structured and balanced, this is a wine that has delicious swathes of ripe blackberry and black plum. There is a touch of bitter extract, but this will integrate as the wine ages. The acidity goes well with the solid tannins. Drink from 2016.
title: Cooperativa Reguengos de Monsaraz 2011 Monsaraz Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: Aged for 12 months in wood, this smooth, ripe wine is already rich and delicious. Its structure is well integrated into the berry fruits and acidity. It's ready to drink from 2018.
designation: Rapariga da Quinta Colheita Seleccionada Tinto
title: Luis Duarte 2015 Rapariga da Quinta Colheita Seleccionada Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Mature, definitely dry in character, with attractive wood acidity. Dark gold in color, it has just enough sweetness, but the style is certainly a sipping Port, not a mixer, giving an intriguing finishing austerity.
title: Wiese & Krohn NV Dry White  (Port)

description: The producer is based in the MonÃ§Ã£o and MelgaÃ§o region of northern Vinho Verde. It is crispâ€”so fresh and cut with apple and citrus acidity. Light and poised, it has just the lightest touch of wood from the short oak aging. Drink now.
title: Provam 2015 Portal do Fidalgo Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: Attractive lemon-flavored citrus character with light acidity. This is a classic, creamy wine with a fresh aftertaste. A drink now wine. Screw cap.
title: Casca Wines 2009 Cape Roca Fish White (Vinho Verde)

description: On the Atlantic coast, south of Lisbon, the Herdade da Comporta style is rich, soft wines, generous in their warm tannins. The 2007 shows ripe fruit, figs, chocolate and plum flavors and dense texture.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2007 Red (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: The wine is rich and full of ripe white and citrus fruits. It has a sense of concentration from the tense mineral fruitiness and full mouthfeel. This wine is still a little young and will be better from the end of 2017.
title: Quinta da Raza 2016 Dom Diogo Alvarinho (Minho)

description: This wine is deliciously fruity and crisp, with perfumed red fruit and lively acidity. Bone dry, and full of bright fruitiness, it makes a classic, easy to drink apÃ©ritif wine.
title: Casa S.M. de Tourais 2015 SÃ£o Matias RosÃ© (DÃ£o)

description: A classic DÃ£o blend, which includes Alfrocheiro and Jaen grapes, this is produced by top winemaker Alvaro Castro. A year in oak has given it richness and a smooth, almost velvety character. Underneath this surface, the tannins are all there, balancing the ripe fruit flavors. It will develop well	 drink from 2017.
title: Obrigado 2012 DAC Red (DÃ£o)

description: A firmly tannic wine, with a woody core. It shows stalky black currant fruit along with tense acidity. At this stage, it is rough round the edges and could use  another year.
title: Casca Wines 2008 Monte Cascas Colheita Red (Douro)

description: This wine is earthy, with a yeasty edge. It offers plenty of Touriga Nacional's perfumed fruit although this is masked by a barnyard character that needs to blow away. The wine requires another year to show its full potential, so drink from 2018.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2015 Touriga Nacional (Alentejano)

description: Made principally from Touriga Nacional, this is a rich wine with attractive acidity and strawberry fruitiness. It is ripe, touched with caramel and finished with wild raspberry flavors.
title: Quinta de Covela 2013 Covela RosÃ© (Minho)

description: The blend of Bical and Arinto is typical of the sparkling wines from the Bairrada region. Together they give a crisp style of wine, bright with acidity and tangy with citrus and orange peel. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Azul Portugal Spumante Bruto Sparkling (Bairrada)

description: This is a big, bold, fruity wine, typical of the powerful reds of Alentejano. It has ripe tannins, concentrated dark fruits and juicy final acidity. With a blend that includes Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah, it's made to age, and this full-bodied wine should be kept until 2016.
title: Herdade de Medeiros 2010 Red (Alentejano)

description: Made from one of the most widely planted varieties in Portugal (known as Tinta Amarela in the Douro), this is a soft wine with attractively juicy fruit that is made to drink young. Its gentle tannins and red-fruit flavors are open, lifted by some tannins and ready to drink from 2018.
title: Herdade do EsporÃ£o 2016 T Trincadeira (Alentejo)

description: Rich plums and soft tannins, with an attractive ripe and juicy character. This is a wine with good spice, a hint of leather and final acidity.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2009 Fonte Serrana Red (Alentejano)

description: As with other wines from Quinta do Cardo, this is packed with minerals and a dark, stony texture. It is concentrated, full of intense acidity and powerful tannins. Rich, it conveys a genuine sense of aging potential. Don't drink before 2018.
designation: Quinta do Cardo SelecÃ§Ã£o do EnÃ³logo
title: Companhia das Quintas 2011 Quinta do Cardo SelecÃ§Ã£o do EnÃ³logo Red (Beira Interior)

description: A lightly wood aged wine, deliciously fresh and creamy, hinting at smooth Chardonnay-like textures. A light perfume from Malvasia adds piquancy to this attractive, textured wine.
title: Quinta do Filoco 2008 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: A juicy, spicy wine, packed with open, generous black fruits. The blend of CastelÃ£o and Trincadeira gives blackberries, some raisins and a smooth chocolate underlay.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2004 Falcoaria Red (Ribatejo)

description: Partially aged in oak, this wine is crisp, juicy and bright with citrus and acidity. Apples and pears come through strongly in this attractive wine that is ready to drink.
title: Quanta Terra 2014 Terra a Terra Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: Very light wood aging gives a complex dimension without losing the ripe yellow fruits that give the wine its rich character. Fresher acidity is integrating well with the spice and vanilla. Drink in 2016.
title: Herdade Grande 2013 Colheita Seleccionada White (Alentejano)

description: Vicente Faria delivers a densely ripe wine made from selected vineyards. Wood aged, with rich black, tarry fruit and dark chocolate aromas, it's an impressive blend that will need to age. Drink from 2019.
title: Vicente Faria Vinhos 2015 Gloria Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Initially austere, with strong mineral character, this opens up to give bramble fruits, dense tannins and firm structure. The fruit does show some juicy freshness, but the tannins are the key here to a wine that needs 3â€“4 years aging.
title: CARM 2005 Quinta do CÃ´a Red (Douro)

description: This fruity, crisp blend of local white grapes offers a touch of vanilla as well as creamy white stone fruits. It is juicy, full of acidity and minerality. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Montes Claros Reserva Branco White (Alentejo)

description: Rich while also structured, this big, ripe wine comes from an estate owned by the CÃ lem family since the 1820s. It has concentration both from the tannins and from the black-plum fruits, and offers good potential. Drink from 2019.
title: Quinta do Sagrado 2013 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Dominated by Syrah, this wine is dark and dense. It is perfumed with solid tannins and the potential of juicy red fruits. Grown in the Pamela area of the SetÃºbal peninsula, south of Lisbon, the wine is both warm and densely concentrated. Drink from 2018.
title: Manzwine 2010 Contador de EstÃ³rias Red (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: Based on the local CastelÃ£o grape, this wine is aged in wood for eight months. Its ripeness and soft tannins are both fruity and lightly structured. It is full-bodied, yet has enough acidity to bring out a juicy, fruity aftertaste.
title: JosÃ© Maria da Fonseca 2014 Periquita Reserva Red (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: The wine is rich and full of ripe white and citrus fruits. It has a sense of concentration from the tense mineral fruitiness and full mouthfeel. This wine is still a little young and will be better from the end of 2017.
title: Quinta da Raza 2016 Dom Diogo Alvarinho (Minho)

description: Crisp, fresh, unoaked wine, with green plum and red apple flavors. It's lively, smooth and creamy, with delicious finishing acidity.
title: CARM 2006 White (Douro)

description: Aged for a year in oak, this rich wine is a blend that includes Touriga Nacional and Alfrocheiro. It has a fine structure that brings in dense tannins as well as a darker, firmer character that will allow it to age further. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta das Marias 2014 Lote Red (DÃ£o)

description: This wine is ripe, juicy and full of fruit. It has a jammy character, with soft tannins and a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Caves Transmontanas 2012 Terra a Terra Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Avesso, a rare varietal in the Vinho Verde region, has produced a smooth and ripe wine. It has flavors of green olive, pear and a tight citrus character. There's fine depth of flavor on this delicious wine.
title: Quinta de Gomariz 2011 Avesso (Vinho Verde)

description: This is an attractive wine that is given a perfumed lift by the inclusion of Malvasia Fina in the blend. It is fresh and young, emphasizing the crisp character and chalky texture typical of the Douro whites. The wine is cool, fruity and will be better enjoyed from summer of 2016.
title: Rozes 2014 Terras do Grifo Branco White (Douro)

description: A perfumed wine, it has a rich, rounded character packed with yellow fruit. Layers of wood add complexity and density. The wine is named for the white owl found in the nature reserve close to the vineyards.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Companhia das LezÃ­rias Tyto Alba White (Tejo)

description: The rare Codega do Larinho grapes make up half this rich, perfumed wine. Touched by the wood aging, it is both fruity and has more complex toast and almond flavors. It's ripe but could do with a few more months. Drink from the end of 2016.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Castello d'Alba Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a beautifully ripe, smooth wine. The wood aging adds a touch of vanilla to what is rich blend of Aragonez, Trincadeira and Touriga Nacional. Black berry fruits, rich tannins and just the right amount of acidity make a wine that will be ready to drink in the medium-term. Drink from 2016.
title: Luis Duarte 2012 Rapariga da Quinta Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: Rich and fruity, this is a dense, wood-aged wine. It has a perfumed character as well as ripe tannins and blackberry fruits. The wine is broad, rounded and full of fruit. Drink this attractive, concentrated wine now.
title: Adega de Cantanhede 2011 MarquÃªs de Marialva Reserva Baga (Bairrada)

description: A tangy textured wine that is impressively fresh for such a hot region as Alentejo. It has a crisp texture that is balanced by a touch of vanilla as well as freshened with citrus and green apple flavors. It is fresh and very drinkable at this young stage. Wait a year until 2017 and it will be even better.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2014 Montes Claros Reserva Branco White (Alentejo)

description: A fine, sweet, fresh Port, well integrated with the spirit. It has just a touch of acidity to give a good balance.
title: PoÃ§as NV Pink RosÃ©  (Port)

description: This wine is lean and still young, with concentrated tannins, firm acidity and smoky fruits that will take some time to develop. The palate suggests it will always be a mineral, tight and firm wine, even as the tannins soften. The finish is pure, juicy black currants. Drink from 2018.
title: DÃ£o Sul 2011 Cabriz Reserva Red (DÃ£o)

description: This is a ripe take on the crisp Alvarinho. The wine does have acidity but it also has hints of rich tropical fruits. The texture is tangy while revealing a full-bodied, perfumed and vibrant wine. Drink now.
title: Adega MÃ£e 2015 Alvarinho (Lisboa)

description: Bairrada is well known for its sparkling wines often based around the Baga grape. This example is fruity with crisp apple flavors and just a touch of tannin to give structure. The wine is still young and could age more, although it is ready to drink now.
title: Messias 2012 Bruto Grand CuvÃ©e Sparkling (Bairrada)

description: From 60-year-old bush vines, this is rich, spicy and with a soft texture. Black fruits give a ripe character and a smooth texture that is beginning to bring in some secondary, earthy flavors. Drink this mature wine now.
title: Casa Cadaval 2012 Preta Vinhas Velhas Trincadeira (Tejo)

description: In a richer style of Vinho Verde but nevertheless retaining plenty of cool, fresh characters. The wine has vivid grapefruit, lime and green apple flavors, rounded out attractively.
title: Casca Wines 2009 Monte Cascas Colheita White (Vinho Verde)

description: This second wine from Quinta de Roriz is ripe, warm and ready to drink. With its ripe black fruits, soft tannins, layers of wood spices and just a hint of acidity, it's a rich offering from a big vintage.
designation: Quinta de Roriz Prazo de Roriz
title: Prats & Symington LDA 2009 Quinta de Roriz Prazo de Roriz Red (Douro)

description: Smooth and rounded, this has the dense character of Douro wines, with open flavors of spice and black currant. The junior wine of Quinta de la Rosa, this is balanced and will be ready to drink in a year.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2010 Dourosa Red (Douro)

description: This lightly wood aged Douro blend is certainly rich, full of generous white stone fruit as well as melon. With its balancing acidity, the wine is both rich and crisp and will be better from 2017.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2015 La Rosa Branco White (Douro)

description: After 14 months in large wood barrels, this wine is full of spicy flavors that go with the rich yellow fruits, generous apricots and peaches, and delicious acidity. This ripe wine is ready to drink.
title: Quanta Terra 2014 Grande Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: With apricot and floral perfumes, this is a ripe wine, full in the mouth and with a subtle mix of fresh acidity and rich yellow fruits. It is still a little young and will be better from late 2016.
title: Dona Maria-JÃºlio Bastos 2014 Viognier (Alentejano)

description: With 12 months of oak aging, this is a ripe smoothly textured wine. It has black fruits, rich tannins and a jammy, generous texture. The wine is fruity and will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2014 Montes Claros Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: The flagship wine from Alorna is a blend of Touriga Nacional and Cabernet Sauvignon, the two grapes melding well into a rich, harmonious whole. Flavors of spice, black figs and dark plum skin tannins are smoothed by 12 months wood aging. There is an edge of youth, which suggests good aging potential.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2004 Reserva Red (Ribatejano)

description: Called 2 Worlds because of the two different vineyards that go into the blend, this is a structured, firm wine. It has a fine balance between the acidity, the tannins and the black currant fruit. With its texture and dry core, it needs time, so drink after 2015.
title: Pinhal da Torre 2009 2 Worlds Reserva Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Floral and aromatic, this has a hint of prickle to go with the citrus, green apple and white peach flavors. There is an attractive mineral characterâ€”the wine dancing and fragrant.
title: Quinta de Gomariz 2011 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: While it is still young, this is a complex wine, with black currant notes supported by firm tannins. It shows wood aging, fresh acidity and a solid core of structure that promises good aging. Drink from 2015.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2011 Forma de Arte Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: A lively, fresh wine, whose wood aging has just enhanced the delicious fruit flavors of mango and pineapple. The acidity bounces up and down, vibrant and crisp. Considering its origin in one of the hottest regions of the Douro, this is impressive.
title: CARM 2006 Quinta do CÃ´a White (Douro)

description: From the homeland of Alvarinho in the MonÃ§Ã£o region in the north of Vinho Verde, the wine is rich and mineral with touches of wood fermentation adding spice. It is textured, full of juicy fruit at the end. Drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: Very fruity, this is a dry wine, with green fruits, citrus and a tangy character. It is light, bright and fresh, very ready to drink.
title: Casca Wines 2012 Monte Cascas Colheita White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a creamy ripe wine, spicy and toasty in character with rich Chardonnay and local grapes to give a balanced texture. Acidity is there along with pineapple and white peach flavors. The rich rounded texture is generous and opulent. The wine needs to age, so drink from 2017.
title: Quinta do Pinto 2014 Terras do Anjo Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Packed with ripe fruits and soft tannins, this is a juicy, red fruit flavored wine. Although it is young with the fruity side right up front, it is really not a wine that needs to age for long. Enjoy the wine for its freshness and light touch of minerality.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Castello d'Alba Tinto Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is a light wine, with fresh berry fruits and acidity that delineate the structure. It's already an easy wine to drink, hinting at minerality and finishing softly.
title: Casca Wines 2011 Monte Cascas Colheita Red (Douro)

description: Ripe and smooth, balancing dense black fruit flavors with spice, wood and acidity, this is a solid, concentrated wine. It has a good restrained power, although the pepper hints at the alcohol. It certainly demands rich food.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2003 Casa de Alorna Colheita Seleccionada Red (Ribatejo)

description: A very aromatic, violet-perfumed wine. It has structured fruit, with wood and blackberry flavors, plenty of acidity and long-term aging potential.
title: Quinta da Cortezia 2008 Reserva Touriga Nacional (Lisboa)

description: This is an earthy wine, showing strong tannins, minerality and a distinctly dry texture. The wine does have weight with its layered black currant fruits giving a strong sense of structure. From the granite soils of the DÃ£o, this is a wine to age for three more years.
title: Moura Basto 2010 Colheita Seleccionada Red (DÃ£o)

description: A blend of Portuguese grapes with Cabernet Sauvignon, this is attractive and softly fruity. Its black fruit and gentle tannins make it completely ready to drink.
title: Fitapreta Vinhos 2011 Sexy Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: The juiciness of Alicante Bouschet shows well in this full-bodied wine, packed with black berries and soft tannins. The dry finish suggests some agingâ€”maybe 1 year.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2005 Grand'Arte Alicante Bouschet (Estremadura)

description: A fine, crisp wine, with delicious green apple flavors and a tang of lime, a touch of yeast, and a dry, fresh aftertaste. There's a delicious bite to this fragrant wine.
title: Quinta de Serrade 2006 Solar de Serrade Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: This mature wine, has lost youthful fruitiness and gained a more nutty, smooth and rich quality. There are touches of toastiness and almonds, with an aromatic aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Coteaux da Murta 2013 Quinta da Murta Arinto (Bucelas)

description: With light wood-aging flavors, this creamy wine is still young, with tangy orange and lemon zest as well as touches of vanilla. Let it develop further and drink from late 2017.
title: Adega MÃ£e 2014 Chardonnay (Lisboa)

description: This is a wood-fermented wine, spicy and lightly perfumed. The wood aging does dominate the yellow fruits and acidity that still need time. Drink this wine from late 2017.
title: Adega MÃ£e 2014 Viognier (Lisboa)

description: This wine is soft, with gentle tannins and red-berry fruits. It will develop quickly, so drink from 2019.
title: Prats & Symington LDA 2015 Prazo de Roriz Red (Douro)

description: This is a hard, edgy and tannic wine that has a bitter edge overlaying the fruit. It seems tough, although there are hints of ripe berry fruits that are hiding away. Some softening over the next year will offer integration. Drink from 2016.
title: Quinta dos Aciprestes 2011 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: A powerful and concentrated blend of Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Aragonez. Solid blackberry flavors give the wine strength, while tannins and hot pepper bring out bitterness and spice. It's not a wine for the faint-hearted.
title: Herdade da GÃ¢mbia 2011 Red (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: Viosinho and Gouveio, two classic Douro white grapes are blended in this ripe wood-aged wine. It has spice as well as rounded fruit, giving the wine a ripe character that is balanced with final citrus acidity. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Monte Cascas Reserva White (Douro)

description: This is a dry style of white Port, with an aromatic character that goes through to the palate. The spirit and wine don't taste properly integrated, giving a fiery feel without much fruit. The aftertaste is bitter.
title: Quinta da MaritÃ¡vora NV White  (Port)

description: Grown on granite soil that is shot through with quartz, this is the epitome of a mineral, structured wine. On top of that texture, the wine has ripe lemon and green plum fruits that are full of juicy flavor. The wine is so fresh it could do with a few months aging. Drink from late 2016.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Beyra Reserva Quartz White (Beira Interior)

description: From the far north of the Vinho Verde region, the rich and creamy wine balances acidity, green plum and crisp minerality. Aromatic, elegant, fresh.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2009 Touquinheiras White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a solidly tannic wine. A dry edge comes from the Baga grape in the blend. At the same time, the wine has plenty of ripe black fruits that give a rounder character. The wine is ready to drink, although it will be better from late 2017.
title: Messias 2012 Quinta do Valdoeiro Colheita Red (Bairrada)

description: This wood-aged Vinho Verde is a world away from the light and sweetened wines. It is rich, almost Chardonnay-like in its smooth, creamy character. At the same time, it still shows its origin in its tight acidity and a crisp aftertaste. Drink now, or better in a year.
title: Casa do Valle 2013 Grande Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: The wine is rounded, perfumed and fruity. It has touches of spice and toast from the wood aging, giving a firm background to the ripe black fruits. It is a generous wine that is ready to drink.
title: UDACA 2012 Touriga Nacional (DÃ£o)

description: The wine has strongly catty aromas that seems to dissipate on the palate. A tense, mineral-driven acidity carries gooseberry flavors and a herbal aftertaste. Drink now.
title: JoÃ£o Teodosio Matos Barbosa 2013 Ninfa Escolha White (Tejo)

description: A fruity tawny, with cherry-jelly flavors plus attractive acidity that balances the sweet, simple, forward flavors. Perhaps drink it as an apÃ©ritif, easy and fragrant.
title: Messias NV PÃ¡tria Tawny  (Port)

description: Alvarinho with a prickle is unusual, as is a Vinho Verde that has been aged an extra year before release. The wine doesn't quite work because it has lost its fruit and developed a strong pepper and spice character. The acidity at the end is the most characteristic part of the wine.
title: Conde Villar 2014 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: Named after an ancestor of the present owners who became a Catholic saint, this wine comes from a vast aristocratic estate northeast of Lisbon. It's dense and fruity, full of tannins and dark plum flavor. Spicy and perfumed, it's drinkable now but will be better from 2018.
title: Casa Cadaval 2013 Padre Pedro Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: There is a slight pepper character in this wine with its ripe fruits and fresh acidity. The result is a balanced wine that is not just about fruitiness but also full of character and with some complexity. The wine can be drunk now, although it will be better from the end of 2016.
title: Quinta de Soalheiro 2015 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: The wine is rounded and fat with an oily texture. Its ripe apple and rich pear flavors only allow a small place for the acidity and crisp texture. It comes across as full bodied, rich and easy to drink now.
title: Quinta da Ribeirinha 2016 Vale de Lobos FernÃ£o Pires (Tejo)

description: Celebrating the beaches and waters around Lisbon in name, this ripe and fruity wine is forward with black fruits and soft tannins. It's an easy, rich wine, finishing with bright acidity.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2009 Mar da Palha Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a bold, ripe wine, full of fruit and equally full of dense tannins. A blend that includes Cabernet Sauvignon, it is solid, powerful and spicy from wood aging. The structure is still young in this impressive wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Perescuma Red (Tejo)

description: This ripe, spicy wine offers strong wood flavors as well as bold red fruits, accompanied by acidity and rich tannins. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2014 Nana Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: Catty and grassy this is a very Sauvignon style of Sauvignon. It is tight, herbal and intense with a cool climate character that comes from the proximity of the Atlantic Ocean to the vineyards. Drink now.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Lisboa)

description: The natural acidity of Arinto is well known for sparkling wines in Bucelas close to Lisbon. Here it has the same fresh, crisp, tight character and vibrant texture. It's light, creamy and fruity, a fine apÃ©ritif style.
title: Quinta da Lapa NV Reserva Bruto Nature Arinto (Tejo)

description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this wine has firm tannins as well as ripe fruits. A tough edge needs to soften as the wine matures. Drink from 2019
title: Symington Family Estates 2015 Altano Organically Farmed Vineyard Red (Douro)

description: Dominated by its tannins and woody characteristics, this is a tough, chunky wine. It has weight and potential depth of black fruit, needing at least four years to soften out.
title: Caves Velhas 2011 Magna Carta Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: To judge by the weight of the bottle, this is regarded as an important wine by the producer. The wine inside is attractive and fruity, ripe with berry fruits and considerable freshness. The tannins give the power for the bottle, dry and dense at this young stage. Drink from 2017.
title: Caves Velhas 2013 Magna Carta Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: The SÃ© (cathedral) on the label of this wine is in Viseu, the granite-built capital of the DÃ£o region. The wine has fine structure and some serious tannins. They march with the perfumed, sweet flavors of Touriga Nacional and of Alfrocheiro. The wine is still young and will certainly be better from 2017.
title: UDACA 2012 Adro da SÃ© Reserva Red (DÃ£o)

description: This is a wine with strong earthy aromas. Its structure is dense and hard at this young stage, but there is enough weight of barnyard and black plum flavors to balance the dry tannins. While it feels rustic, it will certainly develop and soften out. Drink from 2016.
title: Boas Quintas 2012 Quinta da Giesta Red (DÃ£o)

description: The natural acidity of Arinto is well known for sparkling wines in Bucelas close to Lisbon. Here it has the same fresh, crisp, tight character and vibrant texture. It's light, creamy and fruity, a fine apÃ©ritif style.
title: Quinta da Lapa NV Reserva Bruto Nature Arinto (Tejo)

description: This is a wine that's made to be enjoyed young. It is fresh and fruity with a high proportion of Aragon (a.k.a. Tempranillo) giving a sophisticated touch of dusty tannins and red berry fruit. The wine is ripe and ready to drink.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2014 Portas da Herdade Red (Alentejano)

description: A blend of two of Vinho Verde's richer grapes results in this concentrated full-bodied wine. It is smooth and rich with fruit flavors ranging from citrus to apricot. The acidity is cushioned by the ripe texture. Drink this serious from late 2017.
title: Quinta da Raza 2016 Avesso-Alvarinho Colheita Seleccionada White (Vinho Verde)

description: This is a bold, ripe wine, full of fruit and equally full of dense tannins. A blend that includes Cabernet Sauvignon, it is solid, powerful and spicy from wood aging. The structure is still young in this impressive wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Perescuma Red (Tejo)

description: Fermented and aged in wood, this rich and complex wine is still young. The potential of the ripe yellow fruits, tight structure and toast and spice flavors are all there. Rounded and generous, this is a wine for some good aging	 drink from 2017.
title: DÃ£o Sul 2014 Casa de Santar Reserva Branco White (DÃ£o)

description: This is a ripe, spicy wine that has dense tannins and dark fruits. Now mature, it is full bodied, packed with black fruit flavors and a concentrated structure. The Alicante Bouschet in the blend gives the wine its dark color and also its intense fruits. Drink now.
title: Marcolino Sebo 2011 Visconde de Borba Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: This is a wine that is full of red fruits and fresh acidity. The tannic structure is well in balance giving a firm edge to the bright, ready-to-drink fruits. The wine is the entry level to the always impressive range from Crasto. Drink this wine now.
title: Quinta do Crasto 2014 Crasto Red (Douro)

description: This is light and bright, with crisp acidity and the fruitiness of an attractive, early-drinking wine.
title: PV Vinhos 2010 Egle White (Douro)

description: This is a finely perfumed wine, full of ripe CastelÃ£o grapes. It has a smooth, polished feeling from the wood aging, yet still allows plenty of room for a dense black-fruit character. It will need to age and will be best after 2016.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Pegos Claros Reserva CastelÃ£o (Palmela)

description: This is a ripe, soft and juicy wine that is ready to drink. Warm blackberry tones are contrasted by a rich wood character and fresh, lively acidity.
title: Herdade Grande 2012 Red (Alentejano)

description: Fermented in open stone lagars, this wine shows a smooth, rounded and very rich character. Sweet wood flavors suggest vanilla, while the tannins are fine, dense and attractively spicy. The aftertaste, with juicy black fruits, adds balance to the wine. Drink now.
title: Marcolino Sebo 2009 Visconde de Borba Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: This is a creamy, intensely fruit wine, with lime and tropical fruit flavors, merely hinting at a minerally structure. It's delicious and ready to drink now.
title: Terra d'Alter 2011 Alvarinho (Alentejano)

description: Lightly spicy aromas give this an exotic feel. At the same time, there is plenty of crisp, citrusy acidity, along with a rounded melon texture. The wine is full-bodied, concentrated and will be ready to drink in six months.
title: Terra d'Alter 2011 Verdelho (Alentejano)

description: This rich wine still shows its wood-aging character. It has firm tannins, dark fruit and concentration. From vineyards in the Douro Superior, this wine should be drunk from 2018.
title: Douro Prime 2010 Inquieto Tinto Touriga Nacional (Douro)

description: This is a ripe wine with its juicy black fruits and generous tannins. It has a mature character that's emphasized by the wood aging and rich fruitiness. There's a touch of pepper at the end from the alcohol which is a shame. Drink now.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2014 Cassa Reserva Red (Douro)

description: The wine has the correct texture and attractive perfumes for a delicate Riesling. The crisp apple and tight mineral flavors are light and floating. It's a surprising wine for the Lisbon region, but it works so well.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2013 Riesling (Lisboa)

description: This is a deliciously perfumed wine that is fresh and fruity with a fine, tight texture to add interest and give it shape. It takes advantage of the natural aromatic flavors of the grape to produce a wine that is both crisp and fragrant. Drink now.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2014 Verdelho (Lisboa)

description: This is Alvarinho from the southern part of the Minho region, close to Oporto. It has lemon fruit and a smooth texture, giving a rich wine. It could age a little longer, so wait until 2018.
title: Conde Villar 2015 Alvarinho (Minho)

description: With a typical touch of fizz, this wine is fruity, light and bright. It is dry, very fresh, full of apples and lime juice. Refreshing and ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Cruzeiro 2012 White (Vinho Verde)

description: In this rich, earthy wine, plum and licorice flavors combine with a core of tough tannins. It is rich, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Delaforce 2009 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: The historic Port house of Delaforce has now launched its own Douro table wines, and this Alvarinho is soft and fruity. It has a creamy initial texture followed by touches of vanilla and quince. This is not for aging, so drink it now.
title: Delaforce 2011 Alvarinho (Duriense)

description: An attractive, red-fruited wine, lightweight with acidity and smoothed with wood. It is fresh, with coffee and black cherry flavors, now ready to drink.
title: Rozes 2008 Quinta do PÃ©go Red (Douro)

description: A ripe, tropical fruit flavored wine that is both fresh and rich. While produced in an area of Vinho Verde that is predominately dedicated to the Alvarinho grape, this dry wine is a refreshing, bright blend of many of the local varieties. It is juicy, crisp and ready to drink.
title: Anselmo Mendes 2015 Muros Antigos Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: A lemon flavored wine that's crisp and fruity. The texture is soft with fruit and fresh acidity dominant. With its refreshing aftertaste, the wine is ready to drink now.
title: Terra Silvestre 2014 Arinto (Tejo)

description: Although known in the Douro as an increasingly essential component of Port and table wines, the Touriga Nacional is equally at home in the DÃ£o. As here, it produces linear wines, very mineral, full of acidity with a perfumed elegance. This is a wine for aging over 4â€“5 years.
title: Borges 2009 Touriga Nacional (DÃ£o)

description: A wine that starts out all tannins. The fruit takes a while to show through and then produces juicy red cherry flavors and considerable acidity, the wood aging rounding the corners. This is for medium-term aging.
title: Rozes 2008 Quinta do Grifo Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is a smooth, impressively rich wine powered by silky tannins and ripe black fruits. The palate is intensely concentrated with a big, bold structure and a solid feel. It does need some aging, so drink from 2016.
designation: Aguia Moura em Vinhas Velhas Reserva
title: Wines & Winemakers 2009 Aguia Moura em Vinhas Velhas Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A juicy, fruity wine that is named after the Knights Templar who built a magnificent castle and convent in the local city of Tomar. It is fresh with red berry acidity and some perfumed tannins. It should be ready to drink soon, but wait until the end of 2016 for the best results.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2013 TemplÃ¡rios Colheita Seleccionada Red (Tejo)

description: This is fresh, fruity and with an attractive creamy texture. The crisp apple comes from the high-acid Rabigato grape that's softened by Viosinho and Gouveio. That makes for a balanced, light wine that is ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Crasto 2014 Crasto White (Douro)

description: A particularly clean, fresh and dry rosÃ©, full of currant fruit, a taut, refreshing texture and a final burst of acidity.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2010 RosÃ© (Lisboa)

description: Almost black in color, this is a big, bold and rich ruby. Dark berry fruits are sustained by a sweet, jammy character. The tannins do give the wine structure, but the rich sweetness dominates. Drink now.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas NV Reserva Ruby  (Port)

description: This is a ripe yellow fruit and mango-flavored wine. It is all fruit, rich and deliciously refreshing. The 10% of Moscatel in the blend has had an enormous effect on the perfumed character of the wine. At the end, the acidity keeps it fruity and crisp.
title: PoÃ§as 2016 Coroa d'Ouro Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a bold and ripely fruity wine. Fine tannins and blackberry fruits are already well combined in a big and juicy whole. The wine does have a structure and layers of wood aging that suggest it will age. Drink from 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Abreu Callado ReservaÂ  Red (Alentejano)

description: This is an attractive, soft blend of Arinto, Viosinho and AntÃ£o Vaz. With white fruit flavors and a warm, ripe texture, it's crisp, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Dona Maria-JÃºlio Bastos 2015 White (Alentejano)

description: French oak aging has given this still-young wine a firmly structured character, with dark tannins and a firm texture. It's still very dry, structured and dark and needs a good few years to age and round out. For now, the ripe fruit and acidity are both showing great promise. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta da Rede 2012 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: DFJ Vinhos manages this 16th century property which has produced a now mature wine. It has great balance, the berry fruits moving to secondary flavors of spice, smokiness, sweet tannins and hints of toast. It's ready to drink, but will continue to develop through 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 Quinta do Rocio Red (Lisboa)

description: This youthful crisp blend of Chardonnay and FernÃ£o Pires comes from the Lisboa region. With a light texture, plenty of acidity and a fruity aftertaste, it is a great apÃ©ritif style.
title: Adega MÃ£e 2015 Bruto Sparkling (Lisboa)

description: Blending Douro's native Viosinho and Verdelho grapes, this is ripe, wood aged and smooth. It has layers of citrus, grapefruit and white fruits, apple juice and pears. It is fruity, fresh and ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Andreza Branco White (Douro)

description: Solid tannins lead into a wine that balances very dry, dark fruits with dense wood textures. It's a solid, chunky, bold wine, richly fruity and still young. Drink this firm, ageworthy wine from 2016.
title: PoÃ§as 2011 Vale de Cavalos Red (Douro)

description: This is a strongly mineral wine, textured and rich at the same time, with fine acidity. Blackberry fruit dominates the palate, with rich tannins and cool freshness. It tastes of terroir, a true DÃ£o from the granite soils. Drink from 2016.
title: Casa da Passarella 2009 Somontes Reserva Red (DÃ£o)

description: The wine has a fat fruity texture along with acidity and plenty of tannins. It is austere in character, very dry and dense and with a serious intent. There is a juicy aftertaste that is more attractive and has promise for the future.
designation: Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Andreza Reserva
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Andreza Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is an off-dry wine, soft with strawberry flavors that are balanced by crisp acidity. It is light and fruityâ€”a fine wine to drink as an apÃ©ritif.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Cara Viva RosÃ© (Lisboa)

description: Alvarinho is hardly native to the Douro, hence the regional designation of this fruit-driven wine. It's fresh, crisp and creamy with just a touch of yellow fruits to go with the apples. It's ready to drink now.
title: Delaforce 2013 Alvarinho (Duriense)

description: From vineyards in the southern section of Vinho Verde, this ripe Alvarinho is soft and fruity. It has a light texture that is balanced with crisp acidity and a juicy, perfumed aftertaste. Drink this wine now.
title: Quinta da CalÃ§ada 2015 CalÃ§ada Terroir Alvarinho (Minho)

description: Predominantly Loureiro, this is rich, ripe wine. It has a sunny character, ripe with green plums and apples and lightly shot with acidity. It is aromatic, fresh and ready to drink.
title: Quinta da CalÃ§ada 2015 CalÃ§ada Terroir Loureiro-Alvarinho White (Vinho Verde)

description: A selection of wines made after harvest, this Reserva is a firm, perfumed, structured wine. It has powerful tannins that go with the black fruits and acidity, but it's also deliciously juicyâ€”a powerful and ripe wine that will improve for several years.
title: Casa Cadaval 2010 Padre Pedro Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: The wine reveals a serious side to CastelÃ£o that is not often shown. Its wood aging and structured character give the wine longevity as well as solid fruits and concentrated tannins. Lightness comes in the form of the acidity and the juicy black fruits. Drink from 2019.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Pegos Claros Reserva CastelÃ£o (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: The main estate wine from Chocapalha, this is firm, with a beautiful balance between tannins and fruit. Blackberry and wood-derived spice notes are cut with acidity. It's elegant and ready to drink.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2012 Red (Lisboa)

description: A soft, fruity wine, with spice, strawberry and currant flavors. It has a warm, open feel, with a hint of tannin. Its name refers to the winding Douro River Valley.
title: Niepoort 2009 Twisted Red (Douro)

description: This JosÃ© Ferreira family project in the Douro Valley had its first vintage in 2007. This partially wood-aged wine is rich and full of black fruits. Fermentation in open lagars has given the wine a ripe character as well as dense tannins. The wine is concentrated and likely to age a little further, so drink from 2018.
title: Quinta do PÃ´pa 2014 PÃ´pa Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Structured with a strong mineral character, this is a full rich wine. Its density comes from the fermentation in stone lagars giving richness and opulence. The wood aging has added to the smoothness that is balanced by the intense acidity of the black currant fruits at the end. Drink from 2018.
title: Vinha Paz 2015 Colheita Red (DÃ£o)

description: Named after the 13th-century house at the center of the estate, this is a rich, full-bodied wine. With citrus flavors at its heart, it also shows a texture that gives minerality from the granite soil, followed by juicy yellow fruits and finishing with intense acidity. Give this wine until mid-2015 to settle down.
title: Quinta de PaÃ§os 2013 Casa do CapitÃ£o-mor Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: Surprisingly soft for a Cabernet, this is a rich, generous wine with very ripe black fruits and a minimum of tannins. It is dense and ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Arrobe 2014 Quinto Elemento Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)

description: High-altitude vines yielded this full while also crisp wine. It is fruity, touched by caramel and spice and some toast flavors from wood aging. This is a rosÃ© style that goes with food.
title: Muxagat 2013 RosÃ© (Douro)

description: A serious and dense wine, this is rich and full of dark juicy fruit. It has plenty of structure of course, with its rich tannins and wood aging flavors right up front. The acidity is perfumed, underlining the ripe fruit. Drink this concentrated wine from 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Pegos Claros Vinhas Velhas Reserva CastelÃ£o (Palmela)

description: This is a rich, smooth wine that has ripe fruit and plenty of smooth plum flavors. It has some spice, balanced acidity and a fine dense texture. The wine, with its fresh aftertaste is ready to drink.
title: Quarles Harris 2010 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Wood aging gives this ripe wine its toasty character. This texture is balanced by rich peach and apricot fruits, rounded and fruity. Old vines bring an extra concentration to this full, generous wine. Drink from 2016.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2012 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a smooth wine, soft with just a hint of tannins and with plenty of juicy acidity. Black-currant fruitiness dominates this crisp, clean and ready to drink wine.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Cara Viva Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: This crisp blend of Arinto and FernÃ£o Pires is light and fruity. Acidity and a lively mousse make for an attractive bright wine, with toast and almonds at the end. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Arrobe 2016 Oculto Extra Bruto Sparkling (Tejo)

description: A big, bruising wine that is bursting with sweet tannins and juicy blackberry flavors. All of its acidity and attractive flavors of up-front fruit, spice and wood are clamoring for attention. Ready to drink with strong flavored food.
title: Alente 2006 Alicante Bouschet+Aragonez+Trincadeira Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: Light in color, the wine from hand-picked Touriga Franca, Touriga Nacional and Tinta Barroca grapes has strawberry flavors, light acidity and a fresh finish. It is, of course, sweet, hinting at the spirit added to halt fermentation. It's an attractive wine from the Sogrape family group, ready for chilling. Drink now.
title: Offley NV RosÃ©  (Port)

description: In the classic Portuguese tradition, this is a blend of four of the Alentejo's local grapes. Together they give big power and dark tannins. They also offer great black fruits, fresh acidity and a firm, very dry core. The wine needs to soften over the next several years, so drink from 2017.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2011 Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: Aged for 18 months in wood, this impressive ripe wine is full of fruit and also a firm, smoky tannic structure. The partial fermentation in open stone tanks has given the wine an extra dimension of richness. This is a fine, concentrated wine that is now ready to drink.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2011 Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: Blending Baga and Touriga Nacional, this wine delivers a big sweep of red fruits and spice. Juicy acidity bursts from the glass. The firm tannins of both grapes are still there and need time to round out. Give this wine until 2017.
title: AtaÃ­de Semedo 2012 Tinto Red (Bairrada)

description: This 50-50 blend of Pinot Noir and Touriga Nacional works surprisingly well. It has weight, but also a smooth texture and juicy swathes of black plum and red berry fruits. Juicy fruit flavors are encased in a firm, tannic shell that's solid and dark. The wine is drinkable now after decanting, but could benefit from aging until 2016.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 Consensus Pinot Noir-Touriga Nacional Red (Lisboa)

description: A blend of Touriga Nacional and Alicante Bouschet with Syrah, this is a finely structured wine. It is spicy, packed with black-currant fruits and with ripe tannins. The fruits and the dusty texture are just coming together, although the wine will be better from 2017.
designation: Companhia das LezÃ­rias Herdade de Catapereiro Escolha
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Companhia das LezÃ­rias Herdade de Catapereiro Escolha Red (Tejo)

description: Produced by the winemaking team of Casa Santos Lima in Lisboa, this wine has rich black fruits and a soft texture. Its depth, concentration and richness are finely integratedâ€”full and fruity with a core of firmer tannins. Drink now.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2015 Sete Vales Red (Douro)

description: A deep pink colored wine, this is soft, fruity and ripe. It has just enough acidity while also having an edge of tannins that leave a bitter aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Fontes da Cunha 2015 Quinta do Mondego RosÃ© (DÃ£o)

description: Selected fruit and longer barrel aging are the hallmarks of this Reserva. With its bright mint flavors, well integrated into the firm tannins and plum skin fruits, this is a wine ready to age.
title: Casa Cadaval 2007 Padre Pedro Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: Want dense tannins? Then this your wine. Of course, it has much more than that. It has mineral-driven stone fruit flavors, a sense of terroir, of restrained power. It also has a serious side, and definite aging potential.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2007 Escada Red (Douro)

description: Firm and ripe, this is a richly juicy wine full of berries. Sweet tannins dominate the firmer structure at the back. There is some concentration and the wine is still young, so it's best to drink from 2016.
title: Herdade do PerdigÃ£o 2009 Terras de Monforte Escolha Red (Alentejo)

description: A serious, dense wine that impresses with its elegant structure and rich fruit. The wine has an austere mineral feel that contrasts with its black-currant flavors, and its ripe, juicy character.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2008 Falcoaria Classico Red (Tejo)

description: A light wine with attractive berry flavors, this has a touch of caramel to go with its fruitiness and crisp acidity. Drink now.
title: Dona Maria-JÃºlio Bastos 2015 RosÃ© (Alentejano)

description: Ripe with red-berry flavors, this wine is fresh and crisp with acidity. Drink from 2019.
title: Quinta Dona Matilde 2014 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This is rich and dry yet also fruity. Perfumed in character, it is full, soft and smooth, allowing the acidity a place on the finish.
title: Quinta do Portal 2011 Colheita RosÃ© (Douro)

description: Six months barrel aging have given this wine richness and spicy texture. It is rounded, full of peach and white fruit flavors and with a complex texture. It's still young, drinkable now but much better from 2016.
title: Luis Pato 2013 Vinha Formal White (Bairrada)

description: This is big, concentrated wine produced from old vines. It has a dense blackberry fruit backed by layers of firm tannins. Rich and full bodied, it will be better from 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Album Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a classic Reserve Ruby, full of berry fruits, juicy acidity and light tannins. Hints of dried fruits combine with red berries to give a wine that is stylish and dry in the Warre's style.
title: Warre's NV Warrior Reserve  (Port)

description: High-altitude vines yielded this full while also crisp wine. It is fruity, touched by caramel and spice and some toast flavors from wood aging. This is a rosÃ© style that goes with food.
title: Muxagat 2013 RosÃ© (Douro)

description: Heavily toasted aromas promise strong wood flavors. The fruit, rich with pear flavors, balances that wood, although the wine does need a few months more integration.
title: Campolargo 2010 Branco Arinto (Bairrada)

description: This is a generous black-fruit-driven wine. It has great fruit with some spice from wood. The tannins are firm while giving plenty of richness. With its black plum and berry flavors now developing well, it should be ready from 2018.
title: Ribafreixo 2014 GÃ¡udio ClÃ¡ssico Red (Alentejano)

description: A really perfumed wine, full of oak and truffle aromas. With its juicy rich fruit, it is not a shy wine. Bold red fruits, balanced tannins and a ripe texture all contribute to the dense concentration. The alcohol shows in the pepper edge. Drink this just mature wine now.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2012 Merlot (Lisboa)

description: This oak-aged wine is intense, rich and packed with black fruits. It has spice from the wood as well as from the Syrah in the blend, while the juicy ripe character comes from Alicante Bouschet. It's an impressive concentrated wine that will be best from 2018.
designation: Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte da BaÃ­a Reserva
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Casa Ermelinda Freitas Monte da BaÃ­a Reserva Red (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: From selected grapes, this partially wood-aged wine is a rich take on Vinho Verde. It has weight and a fine creamy texture. The acidity and the orange zest flavors are filled out with ripe apples and green plums with just a hint of toast. Drink from late 2017.
title: Casa do Valle 2016 Grande Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: An old and rarely planted vine in the Douro, CÃ³dega do Larinho has produced a rich, lightly perfumed wine. With plenty of acidity and citrus, it is both ripe and refreshing. It could benefit from a few months in bottle	 drink after 2015.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Andreza CÃ³dega do Larinho (Douro)

description: Crisp, bright, strawberry-flavored wine that has some weight and spice to it. It shows ripe fruit as well as vivid acidity, freshly balanced with red currant aftertaste.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2009 RosÃ© (Lisboa)

description: A smooth, wood-aged wine that is ripe and polished. A blend of Touriga Nacional, CastelÃ£o and Trincadeira is given style by its toast, spice and fresh acidity. It is packed with blackberries that contrast with the firm structure. It needs to age, so drink from 2017.
title: Moura Basto 2012 Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: A young, bright fruity wine, packed with creamy mousse. The wine has a fresh green apple character, lively with a zing to it.
title: Murganheira 2006 Reserva Bruto Sparkling (Vinho Espumante de Qualidade)

description: The wine reveals a serious side to CastelÃ£o that is not often shown. Its wood aging and structured character give the wine longevity as well as solid fruits and concentrated tannins. Lightness comes in the form of the acidity and the juicy black fruits. Drink from 2019.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Pegos Claros Reserva CastelÃ£o (PenÃ­nsula de SetÃºbal)

description: This lightly wood-aged wine is soft and round in character. It has light spice and warm yellow fruits, as well as sliced apple and acidity to balance the fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Casa Cadaval 2015 Vinha Padre Pedro Reserva Viognier-Arinto White (Tejo)

description: From the good winds (Bons Ventos) estate, this balanced wine has good acidity as well as black-currant fruit. Tannins give the wine its dry core and structure. Nine months in wood have added spice and the smooth texture. Drink from 2018.
